(She accidentally starts the blender without the lid on it and fruit flies everywhere.)ScenesRachel: (looking up at the ceiling) God, Monica it’s on the ceiling.ScenesMonica: That’s okay, this is more important than fruit (pause) (angrily) on my ceiling! You broke up?!ScenesRachel: Yeah, but it’s okay, because when Ross left Mark came over.ScenesMonica: Oh no!!ScenesRachel: No.ScenesMonica: Rachel, you and Mark?!ScenesRachel: No, no-no, it’s okay, calm down. Mark and I talked, and I realised how much I love your stupid brother, and, yeah, we got our problems, but I really want to make it work.

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Bedroom, Ross is waking up. He straightens himself out on the bed and puts the covers over his head.]
rows.Content: Chloe: (entering from bathroom) Morning!Scenes(Ross sits bolt upright, without moving the covers.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Ross’s Kitchen, Ross is taking some aspirin and checking his messages.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (on answering machine) Hi, it’s me. I’ve been trying to reach you all night. I feel awful. Please, Ross, you gotta know there is nothing between me and Mark. This whole break-up thing is just stupid.ScenesRoss: Yeah!!ScenesRachel: Eh, I’m just so sorry I put you through it. And, I y'know, I don’t want to get back together over a machine.ScenesRoss: Na-huh.ScenesRachel: So, I love you.ScenesRoss: I love you.ScenesRachel: And y'know what, I’m gonna, I’m gonna go to bed now, but ah, on my way to work tomorrow morning, I’m gonna stop by around 8:30.ScenesRoss: Okay. (Ross starts frantically looking for a clock.)ScenesRachel: Bye.Scenes(Ross finds a clock, sees it’s almost 8:30, and silently screams.)ScenesRoss: Chloe, Chloe how’s it coming?!!ScenesChloe: (entering from bedroom) Hey, what kind of puppy do you think I should get?ScenesRoss: Umm, oh, hey, I don’t know. How about a big one?ScenesChloe: But my apartment is so...ScenesRoss: Well then a small one!! Listen, let’s, we kinda have to get going!ScenesChloe: Wait! Where’s my shoes?ScenesRoss: You, you sure you need shoes? (Chloe nods her head) Okay. (reaches down and picks up a shoe)ScenesChloe: Do I know why we’re rushing?ScenesRoss: Yeah, y'know the ah, the girlfriend I told you about last night? (He’s frantically throwing the cushions off of the couch looking for her other shoe) Well it turns out she ah, she wants to get back together with me. Oh, I found it!!ScenesChloe: That’s so great for you guys!ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesChloe: You must be so happy!ScenesRoss: Yes, yes I am, one of the many things I’m feeling. Well.... (picks up her coat)ScenesChloe: Good luck, with your girlfriend.ScenesRoss: Oh, thank you. (She goes to kiss him, but he holds her coat up between their faces to stop her.) Hey, hey. (opens the door, sees Rachel, and hides Chloe behind the door) Rachel!!!!ScenesRachel: Hi. Ohhh, you got my message.ScenesRoss: Yeah, oh hey, you are right on time.ScenesRachel: So what do you say? Can I be your girlfriend again?ScenesRoss: Yes, you can, very much.Scenes(Chloe gives Ross the thumbs up while still standing behind the door.)ScenesRoss: (seeing the thumbs up) Ahhhh!! (Hugs Rachel tighter.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering carry a large box, Monica is mopping the ceiling.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: Hey, why are you mopping your ceiling?ScenesMonica: Oh, there’s banana on it.ScenesPhoebe: Wow, I have the spirit of an old Indian women living in mine.ScenesMonica: So then you know? (Phoebe nods her head)ScenesPhoebe: The mailman was downstairs, so I brought up your mail.ScenesMonica: Oh, good. Thanks.ScenesPhoebe: Now what is Fabutec?ScenesMonica: Okay, all right don’t judge me to much. Okay? Um, but I saw this info-mercial, and um, I swear to you I have never-ever bought anything on TV before, except for this mop. But there was this stuff on leg waxing, it just, it looked so amazing....ScenesPhoebe: Waxine!!ScenesMonica: Yes! Have you seen it?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s incredible! I so want to be a Waxine girl.ScenesMonica: I know!!ScenesPhoebe: God. Do think it really doesn’t hurt? ‘Cause how can they do that?ScenesMonica: Hello! Organic substances recently discovered in the depths of the rain forest!ScenesPhoebe: They have the best stuff in there.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross has told Chandler and Joey his terrible act.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Oh my God! Oh my God!ScenesJoey: Yeah. We figured when we couldn’t find you, you’d gone home to make up with Rachel. Which is probably what you shoulda done. Huh?ScenesRoss: You think?! God, I, ah, I’m in hell. I mean what, what am I gonna do? Rachel’s all like, ‘I love you and, and let’s work on this.’ And all I can think about is, ‘What is she gonna do? What is she gonna say?’ when I tell her what I did.ScenesChandler: Well, before we answer that, I think we should address the more important question. How dumb are you?ScenesRoss: What?! Look, we’re trying to rebuild a relationship here, right. How am I supposed to do that here, without being totally honest with each other?ScenesJoey: Look, Ross look, I’m on board about this totally honesty thing, I am, just not about stuff that’s gonna get you in trouble.ScenesChandler: He’s right. Nobody’s gonna benefit, and you’re just gonna hurt her.ScenesJoey: Yeah, and there won’t be a relationship left to rebuild.ScenesRoss: Yeah, but don’t you think....ScenesChandler: All right look, if you absolutely have to tell her, at least wait until the timing’s right. And that’s what deathbeds are for.ScenesRoss: Yeah, okay. (he plops down into one of the leather chairs, with the footrest extended.)ScenesJoey: All right, okay, now, we just have to make sure she doesn’t find out some other way. (spins the chair around so that Ross is facing him) Did you think about the trail?ScenesRoss: What trail?ScenesJoey: (stomps on the footrest which pops Ross up into a sitting position) The trail from the woman you did it with to the woman you hope never finds out who did it! (slapping his hands with each word) You always have to think about the trail!ScenesRoss: Oh, I-I don’t think there’s any trail.ScenesChandler: Okay, okay-okay, ah, Chloe works with that guy Issac. Issac’s sister is Jasmine. And Jasmine works at that message place with Phoebe. And Phoebe’s friends with Rachel. And that’s the trail, I did it!

rows.Scenes: Monica's Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are waxing their legs.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (reading from the instructions) After applying the Waxine and linen strips to leg number one,ScenesMonica: Did that!ScenesPhoebe: Grasp one of the linen strips by its ‘easy grab tab’ and pull it off in one quick pain free motion.ScenesMonica: Okay. (Does so.) Ow!!!!! Ow-oh-oh!ScenesPhoebe: Was it not pain-free?ScenesMonica: No. It was painful. Oh my God , they should call it Pain-zine, now with a little wax.ScenesPhoebe: Huh, well, the girls in the satin nighties on the commercial don’t seem to think it’s that bad.ScenesMonica: That’s because their nerves are probably deadened from being so stupid. But hey, y'know if you don’t believe me, please, by my guest.ScenesPhoebe: (Removing one of the strips) Ow-ow-ow-ow! Oh my God!!!ScenesMonica: Now, are you glad we didn’t start with the bikini strips?

rows.Scenes: The Xerox Place, Ross is trying to break the trail.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering) Chloe? Hi..ScenesChloe: Is this about me taking your watch?ScenesRoss: You took my watch?ScenesChloe: I’m sorry, I do that.ScenesRoss: Just you keep it, listen did you, did you tell anyone about us?ScenesChloe: Oh no. I feel it isn’t really anybody’s business, y'know.ScenesRoss: Exactly. So you didn’t, didn’t mention anything to Issac right?ScenesChloe: Oh, well I tell Issac everything.ScenesRoss: You tell, of course you do. Issac. Issac. Hey, Issac. Issac, hi! Y'know we haven’t actually met...ScenesIssac: You dog!ScenesRoss: Yes, I suppose I am a dog. But Issac, see I-I happen to have a girlfriend.ScenesIssac: Oh right, that Rachel chick from the coffee place.ScenesRoss: Yeah, that’s the one. Listen, I don’t want to hurt her.ScenesIssac: Oh, hey, man I know, doesn’t matter how much we love ‘em, monogamy is too cruel a rule.ScenesRoss: Yeah. Listen, can you keep this information to yourself?ScenesIssac: Aw, no problem dude. Y'know we got to look out for each other. We’re the same, you and me.ScenesRoss: Actually, no, we’re not.ScenesIssac: Yeah, we are.ScenesRoss: No, we’re not.ScenesIssac: Yeah, we are.ScenesRoss: No, we’re not!!ScenesIssac: Okay, we’re not.ScenesRoss: Right.ScenesIssac: But, we are.ScenesRoss: Fine. I just need to know that you’re not gonna tell your sister.ScenesIssac: I can promise not to tell her again.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s Work, Ross is now trying to stop Jasmine from telling Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering out of breath) Jasmine?ScenesJasmine: Uh-huh.ScenesRoss: We met at Phoebe’s birthday party, I’m, I’m Ross Geller.ScenesJasmine: You did a bad thing!ScenesRoss: Yes, I did.ScenesJasmine: Very bad!ScenesRoss: Very bad.ScenesJasmine: Very, very bad.ScenesRoss: I’m agreeing with you. Did you, listen, did you happen to tell Phoebe yet?ScenesJasmine: No.ScenesRoss: Okay, Jasmine, please, please don’t. I love my girlfriend very much, and I want more than anything to just work it out with her. Okay?ScenesJasmine: All right.ScenesRoss: Thank you, thank you.ScenesJasmine: But you should probably talk to my roommate, because I told him and he knows Phoebe too.ScenesRoss: (angrily) Who’s your roommate?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gunther is wiping down the counter as Ross rushes in.]
rows.Content: Ross: Gunther! Gunther. Gunther, please tell me you didn’t say anything to Rachel about me and the girl from the Xerox place.ScenesGunther: I’m sorry. Was I not supposed to?Scenes(Ross turns around and sees Rachel sitting by the window. She is just glaring at him.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica’s Bedroom, Monica and Phoebe are removing the rest of their wax strips.]
rows.Content: Monica: Ow!ScenesPhoebe: Oh!!ScenesMonica: Ow!! Ow!!ScenesPhoebe: Ow!!!ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Ow!!!!!!! Ow-ow-ow-ow!Scenes(Hearing the screaming Chandler and Joey rush in. Joey has a pan, Chandler has a tea kettle.)ScenesPhoebe: We’re all right.ScenesMonica: It’s okay, it’s okay.ScenesPhoebe: We’re all right.ScenesMonica: We were just waxing our legs.ScenesChandler: Off?!!ScenesPhoebe: For your information, this happens to be a pain like no man will ever experience.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well I don’t think you can make that statement, unless you’ve been kicked in an area that God only meant to be treated nicely.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I-I think that women just have a lower threshold of pain than men, that’s all. I mean, come on, it’s just a little wax.ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah, come here. (Puts a little wax on Joey’s arm and puts a strip on it.)ScenesChandler: Oh, that’s mature.ScenesJoey: Okay, fine, so now what, I just pull it off?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: That’s right.Scenes(Joey laughs, pulls it off, then does a high-pitched whine.)Scenes[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is trying to close the door on Ross.]ScenesRoss: (forcing the door open) Come on, Rachel, come on! Talk to me! Please!!Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom, Chandler slowly closes the door, and we hear Rachel from the living room.]ScenesRachel: I can’t talk to you. I can’t even look at you right now!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: Nothing, nothing.ScenesMonica: (going over to listen at the door) Rachel said everything was okay.ScenesPhoebe: (to Joey) What, what are they talking about?ScenesRoss: Rachel?Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: Just get away from me!ScenesRoss: No, it was a mistake! I made a mistake! Okay?ScenesRachel: A mistake?! What were you trying to put it in? Her purse?!Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesPhoebe: Whe-where did he put it?!Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: Ross, you had sex with another woman!Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom, both Monica and Phoebe gasp.]ScenesMonica: Oh my God.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I knew something had to be wrong, because my fingernails did not grow at all yesterday.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, I guess they had a fight, and he got drunk....ScenesMonica: Oh!! (hits Chandler and Joey in the head) You guys knew about this and you didn’t tell us?!ScenesChandler: (to Joey) He has sex, and we get hit in our heads.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: (opening the door) Y'know what, I want you to leave! Get outta here!ScenesRoss: No!!ScenesRachel: Just get out! Now!!ScenesRoss: No!! No!! I wanna stay. I wanna talk about this.ScenesRachel: Okay! All right! How was she?Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesChandler: Uh-oh.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Was she good?Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Don’t answer that.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: Come on Ross! You said you wanted to talk about it, let’s talk about it!! How was she?ScenesRoss: She was...Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Awful! Horrible!ScenesChandler: She was not good. Not good.ScenesJoey: She was nothing compared to you.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: She, she was different.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Ewwwww!ScenesChandler: Uh-oh.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: Good different?ScenesRoss: Nobody likes change.Scenes(Rachel picks up a newspaper and starts beating him with it.)ScenesRoss: What? Okay, okay, okay, okay.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesPhoebe: Should we do something?ScenesChandler: Yeah, never cheat on Rachel.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry. I wa-I was disgusted with myself, and this morning I was so, I was so upset and then I got your message and I was so happy, and all I wanted was to get her out of my apartment as fast as possible.ScenesRachel: Whoa!! Whoa, whoa, wait a minute. What time did your little friend leave? (Ross can’t answer that) Oh my God. She was there? She was still there? She was in there, when I was in there?!Scenes(Ross hands Rachel back the newspaper, and she starts beating him with it again.)ScenesRoss: Listen. Oh hey, hey, the important thing was that she meant, she meant nothing to me!ScenesRachel: And yet she was worth jeopardising our relationship!!Scenes(She throws the paper at him, misses and hits Monica’s door, they all jump back at the sound.)ScenesRoss: Look, I didn’t think there was a relationship to jeopardise. I thought we were broken up.ScenesRachel: We were on a break!ScenesRoss: That, for all I knew would, could last forever. That to me is a break-up.ScenesRachel: You think you’re gonna get out of this on a technicality?ScenesRoss: Look, I’m not trying to get out of anything, okay. I thought our relationship was dead!ScenesRachel: Well, you sure had a hell of a time at the wake!Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Y'know what, I don’t think we should listen to this anymore. (Goes to open the door)ScenesMonica: (stopping him) What, what are you doing? You can’t go out there.ScenesJoey: Why not?! (to Chandler) I’m hungry.ScenesMonica: Because they’ll know we’ve been listening.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRachel: God! And to have to hear about it from Gunther!!ScenesRoss: Come on! Like I wanted him to tell you, I ran all over the place trying to make sure that didn’t happen!ScenesRachel: Oh, that is so sweet. I think I’m falling in love with you all over again.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesChandler: Y'know what, I think we can go out there. I mean they have more important things to worry about.ScenesJoey: Yeah, we’ll be fine.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: Look Rachel, I wanted to tell you, I thought I should, I-I did, and then Chandler and Joey convinced me not to.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesChandler: (handing Monica the wax) Wax the door shut, we’re never leaving, ever.Scenes[Later, Phoebe is on the phone, they’re all still trapped in Monica’s bedroom.]ScenesPhoebe: Hi, it’s Phoebe. Listen someone’s gonna have to take my 9:00 with Mr. Rehack, ‘cause it’s like 9:15 now, and I’m not there.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: Don’t you realise none of this would’ve ever happened if I didn’t think at that same moment you weren’t having sex with Mark?ScenesRachel: All right. Let’s say I had slept with Mark. Would you have been able to forgive me?ScenesRoss: (pause) Yes I would.ScenesRachel: You’d be okay if you knew that Mark had kissed me, and been naked with me, and made love to me?ScenesRoss: (less sure) Yes.ScenesRachel: You knew that our hot, sweaty, writhing bodies were....ScenesRoss: (covering his ears and screaming) La-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la-la! Okay, okay, yeah, I would have been devastated but, I would still want to be with you. Because it’s, I mean it’s you.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesAll: Ohhhhh!Scenes[Later, Ross and Rachel are sitting in the kitchen.]ScenesRoss: What? Come on Rach, tell me what you’re thinking?ScenesRachel: I’m thinking, I’m gonna order a pizza.ScenesRoss: Order a pizza like, ‘I forgive you?’Scenes(She turns around and glares at him, he turns away.)Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Oh man, pizza? I like pizza. (makes like he is trying to send a telepathic message to Rachel) Put olives on the pizza.ScenesPhoebe: We could eat the wax! It’s organic.ScenesChandler: Oh great, food with hair on it.ScenesPhoebe: No, not the used wax.ScenesChandler: Because that would be crazy?Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: Hey, can I, can I get in on that? Because I’m kinda hungry myself.ScenesRachel: Fine. (on phone) Hi! Yes, I’d like to order a large pizza.ScenesRoss: No anchovies.ScenesRachel: With ah, extra anchovies.ScenesRoss: That’s okay, I’ll just pick ‘em off.ScenesRachel: Yeah, and could you please chop some up and just put it right there in the sauce?Scenes[Cut to later, they are finishing up the pizza, there’s one piece left.]ScenesRoss: You can have the last piece, if you want.ScenesRachel: Well, I should think so. You slept with someone.Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom, they’re all eating the wax, Chandler and Phoebe, don’t like it. Joey tries some and makes a face like: ‘Hey, that’s not so bad.’]ScenesPhoebe: They’re gonna get through this, aren’t they?ScenesChandler: Yeah, come on, it’s Ross and Rachel, they’ve got too.ScenesMonica: What if they don’t?Scenes(Long pause.)ScenesJoey: You think I need a new walk?ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Well y'know, I’ve been walking the same way since high school. Y'know, y'know how some guys they walk into a room and everybody takes notice. I think I need a ‘take notice’ walk.ScenesChandler: Are you actually saying these words?Scenes[Later, in the living room, Rachel is sitting on the couch, Ross is on the chair.]ScenesRoss: What, now you’re not even taking to me? (moves over to the coffee table) Look Rachel, I-I’m sorry, okay, I’m sorry, I was out of my mind. I thought I’d lost you, I didn’t know what to do. Come on! Come on, how insane must I have been to do something like this? Huh? I-I don’t cheat right, I, that’s not me, I’m not Joey!Scenes[Cut to Monica's bedroom]ScenesJoey: Whoa-ho-ho! (He looks at Chandler, who gives him a ‘come on’ look.) Yeah, okay.ScenesMonica: Hey. It’s three in the morning. They don’t know that I’ve come home yet. You notice how neither one of them are wondering where I am.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, y'know, people can be so self-involved.Scenes[Cut to Living Room]ScenesRoss: Y'know what, y'know what, I’m-I’m not the one that wanted that, that break, okay. You’re the one that bailed on us. You’re the one that, that ran when things got just a little rough!ScenesRachel: That’s....ScenesRoss: That’s what?!ScenesRachel: That is neither here nor there.ScenesRoss: Okay, well here we are. Now we’re in a tough spot again, Rach. What do you want to do? How do you want to handle it? Huh? Do you wanna fight for us? Or, do you wanna bail? (sits down next to her) Look, I, (on the verge of tears) I did a terrible, stupid, stupid thing. Okay? And I’m sorry, I wish I could take it back, but I can’t. (We see Monica and Phoebe are almost in tears.) I just can’t see us throwing away something we know is so damn good. Rachel, I love you so much.Scenes(He kisses her on her shoulder, then her neck, then the side of her face, then just before he kisses her on the lips....)ScenesRachel: No Ross!! (stands up and moves away from him) Don’t! You can’t just kiss me and think you’re gonna make it all go away, okay? It doesn’t work that way. It doesn’t just make it better. Okay?ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, okay.ScenesRachel: (softly) I think you should go.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: (softly) I really think you need to go now.ScenesRoss: (moving over to stand in front of her) Okay, okay. This morning you said there was nothing so big that we couldn’t work past it together...ScenesRachel: Yeah, what the hell did I know!ScenesRoss: Look, look, there’s got to be a way we can work past this. Okay, (takes a hold of one of her arms.) I can’t imagine, I can’t imagine my life without you. (Both of them are starting to cry.) Without, without these arms, and your face, and this heart. Your good heart Rach, (drops to his knees and hugs her around her waist) and, and....ScenesRachel: (crying) No. I can’t, you’re a totally different person to me now. I used to think of you as somebody that would never, ever hurt me, ever. God, and now I just can’t stop picturing with her, I can’t, (Ross stands up and backs away) it doesn’t matter what you say, or what you do, Ross. It’s just changed, everything. Forever.Scenes[We see the rest of them are now crying.]ScenesRoss: (crying) Yeah, but this can’t be it, I mean.Scenes(Pause)ScenesRachel: Then how come it is?ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica’s bedroom.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: They’ve been quiet for a long time.ScenesJoey: Maybe she killed him?ScenesChandler: Let’s go.Scenes[Cut to Living Room, Rachel is sleeping on the couch, Ross is gone, the rest of them can finally emerge from their cell. They all wave good bye, and start to walk quietly out, as Monica goes and puts a blanket on Rachel. Joey starts walking all hunched over and bobbing his shoulders as he goes.]ScenesChandler: (to Joey) Is that your new walk?ScenesJoey: (whispering) No, I really have to pee.ScenesEndScenesThe One Without The Ski TripScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Joey are sitting on the couch reading.]
rows.Content: Joey: Can I see the comics?ScenesChandler: This is the New York Times.ScenesJoey: Okay, may I see the comics?Scenes[Monica and Phoebe enter.]ScenesMonica: Guys. I thought you were taking Ross to the game?ScenesChandler: We are. He’s meeting us here.ScenesMonica: No! Rachel is meeting us here.ScenesPhoebe: Oh come on, they can be in the same room.ScenesJoey: Yeah, you shoulda been there last night.ScenesPhoebe: Why? What happened now?ScenesJoey: Well Ross was hangin’ out over at our place, Rachel comes over to borrow some moisturiser from Chandler....ScenesChandler: Yeah y-you, how hard is it to say something? Rachel came over to borrow something.ScenesJoey: Anyway! Her and Ross just started yelling at each other.ScenesPhoebe: Wait. Why was he yelling at her? He’s the one who slept with someone else.ScenesJoey: Well, I guess he says that because they were on a break when it happened, that she should of forgiven him by now.ScenesPhoebe: Whoa!! He is soo unreasonable! God, although I think I understand what he means. Oh my God, this is like 60 Minutes, okay, when, when, at first you’re really mad at that pharmaceutical company for making the drug and then y'know you just feel bad for the people because they needed to make their hair grow.ScenesChandler: Y'know what this is like? This is like when my parents got divorced. Man, I hope Ross doesn’t try to kidnap me after Cub Scouts.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know I had a dream where Ross and Rachel were still together, they never broke up. And we were all just like hanging out, and everyone was happy....ScenesJoey: I had the same dream!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, and nobody slept with that Xerox girl.ScenesJoey: Oh, I had the opposite dream.ScenesChandler: Y'know what maybe it’s gonna be okay, I mean it’s been a week.ScenesJoey: Yeah, I mean it’s never taken me a week to get over a relationship.ScenesMonica: It’s never taken you more than a shower to get over a relationship.Scenes[Rachel enters.]ScenesMonica: (seeing her) Okay, let’s go!! Let’s hit the road!!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesMonica: Let’s get the show on it!ScenesRachel: Okay, let me just get a cup of coffee.ScenesMonica: Oh Rachel, I know the best coffee house and it’s sooo close.ScenesRachel: Closer than here?ScenesPhoebe: (turning around and picking a cup off of a table) Oh, hey, look, I found coffee! (handing her the cup) Okay, let’s skedaddle.ScenesRachel: Wait, I’m not just gonna drink somebody’s old coffee.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, your highness.Scenes[Ross enters behind Rachel, and look at each other for a moment.]ScenesPhoebe: (in a deep voice, imitating Ross) Um, Rachel I’m really sorry. (imitating Rachel) That’s okay, do you wanna get back together? (imitating Ross) Yeah, okay. (in her normal voice) Did anyone else hear that?!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, the whole gang is there, except for Ross and Rachel. Joey is trying to eat Chinese with chopsticks and fails miserably. There’s a knock on the door, and Chandler answers it to reveal Rachel]
rows.Content: Rachel: (softly) Is he here?ScenesChandler: No.ScenesRachel: Oh. (smiles) Here’s your moisturiser. Hi!ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Hey!ScenesRachel: You guys are gonna love meee! Okay, check it out, Thursday night, five tickets, Calvin Klein lingerie show, and you guys are coming with me. (they’re all silent and look away) Okay, I said that out loud right?ScenesChandler: Yes, yes, it’s just that we ah, we kinda all ready, made plans with Ross.ScenesRachel: Oh, well okay. Well, there you go.ScenesPhoebe: No, it’s just that he got this new like home theater dealie, and he wants y'know, us to check it out.ScenesRachel: Hm-mm.ScenesChandler: Yeah, he’s really excited about it too, he even recorded show times on his answering machine.ScenesRachel: Ohh!ScenesMonica: We’re sorry honey.ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s okay. (starts to leave)ScenesJoey: Rach, it’s, it’s ah, it’s not that we don’t want to, really. (quietly) Are we talking models in their underwear?ScenesRachel: And heels.ScenesJoey: (He turns around to Chandler looking for approval to go with Rachel, Chandler mouths ‘Come on!’) (turning back to Rachel) Ross, did ask us first, and we set that night aside.ScenesRachel: No, hey, come on, if he asked you first, that’s only fair. (leaves)Scenes[Chandler makes a noise of absolute disgust and heads into the living room.]ScenesPhoebe: Ohhh boy, do I feel bad.ScenesJoey: Oh yeah.ScenesMonica: Very bad.Scenes[We see Chandler lighting up a cigarette.]ScenesPhoebe: Chandler what are you doing?!ScenesMonica: Chandler!!ScenesChandler: (jumps back and points at the cigarette) Oh my God!ScenesJoey: You’re smoking again?!ScenesChandler: Well, actually, yesterday I was smoking again. Today, I’m, I’m smoking still.ScenesPhoebe: Why would you start again after chewing all that quitting gum?ScenesChandler: Look, I’m telling you this is just like my parents divorce, which is when I started smoking in the first place.ScenesMonica: Weren’t you nine?!ScenesChandler: Yeahhh. I’m tellin’ ya something, that ah, first smoke after nap time....Scenes[There’s a knock on the door.]ScenesChandler: Oh that’s great, with my luck, that’s gonna be him.ScenesPhoebe: Him? Him, Ross?ScenesChandler: Nope, hymn 253, His Eyes Are On The Sparrow! When my parents got divorced is when I started using humour as a defence mechanism. (answers the door and it’s Rachel again.)ScenesRachel: Hi! Uhh, do you guys have plans for the weekend? Because I have my sister on hold, and she said that we could use her cabin for the weekend and go skiing. Huh? I’m asking you first, right?!. I mean I’m playing by the rules.ScenesAll: Absolutely, yeah!ScenesRachel: Chandler! You’re smoking? What are you doing?!ScenesChandler: Hey, shut up!! You’re not my real Mom!!

rows.Scenes: Ross’s, the gang, minus Rachel of course, is there. Chandler is forced to smoke by an open window.]
rows.Content: Joey: (obviously cold) Hey, can you close that window Chandler? My nipples can cut glass over here!ScenesPhoebe: Wait. Really?! ‘Cause mine get me out of tickets.ScenesRoss: Look, you guys I just wanna say, I really, really appreciate you spending this time with me. It’s been a pretty hard time right now, so I just wanna say thanks.ScenesChandler: Can somebody else hug him? I have to stay by the window.ScenesRoss: Oh hey, hey, huh, how about this weekend we have a laser disc marathon okay, and maybe a tournament on my new dart board? Huh, huh, what do you think? (in an Irish accent) Two days of darts, it’ll be great!ScenesJoey: It’ll be great for next weekend.ScenesRoss: No, no, no, this weekend guys!ScenesJoey: It’ll be great for next weekend. I mean, (in an Irish accent) it’ll be grrreat.ScenesRoss: What’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Well, we were um, sorta invited to go skiing, y'know Rachel’s sister’s cabin. (Chandler goes back to the window to smoke again.)ScenesRoss: So, for the whole weekend?ScenesMonica: We’re really sorry, but um, she did ask us first.ScenesRoss: Yeah, that’s okay, I mean if you guys all have to go away for the first weekend I’m alone by myself, y'know then I totally, totally understand.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what, I can stay, I’m gonna stay. ‘Cause the last time I went skiing I was to afraid to jump off the chair lift, I just went around and around.ScenesJoey: Uh, Pheebs we kinda need you to drive us all up there in your grandmother’s cab, but y'know what, I’ll stay.ScenesMonica: Noo! I’ll stay. He’s my brother.ScenesRoss: What a pity stay?ScenesMonica: No! We’re gonna have fun. We can make fudge!ScenesRoss: Pity food? Y'know what that’s okay, all right, I don’t need any of you to stay, okay nobody stays.ScenesChandler: Well, then, I might as well offer to stay.

rows.Scenes: In Phoebe’s Grandmother’s cab, driving up to the cabin. Phoebe’s driving, Rachel’s sitting shotgun, Chandler, Monica, and Joey are in the back seat.]
rows.Content: Joey: (to Chandler and Monica) Hey, does anybody else feel bad about Ross?ScenesMonica: Why? Do you think he’s still mad at us?ScenesChandler: (to Joey) Well he’s probably mad after you called him this morning to borrow his goggles.ScenesJoey: What? Mine aren’t tinted.Scenes[Chandler starts to light a cigarette.]ScenesPhoebe: Chandler!!ScenesChandler: What?ScenesPhoebe: What does the sign say?ScenesChandler: Beam me up Jesus.ScenesPhoebe: No, the ‘No Smoking’ sign. There’s no smoking in my Grandmother’s cab.ScenesChandler: Okay, well, then, I-I have to go to the bathroom.ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesPhoebe: Please!ScenesMonica: No Chandler no! No unscheduled stops. You can go when we stop for gas.ScenesChandler: Oh, come on, there’s a rest stop right up there! Come on, I really have to goooooooooo.ScenesJoey: Oh, now I have to go!!

rows.Scenes: The rest stop, Phoebe’s pulling in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Here we go. Okay, brace yourselves.ScenesMonica: What?Scenes[Both Chandler and Joey put their feet up against the glass, Monica doesn’t and gets thrown up against the glass.]ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: Ow!Scenes[Joey gets out and sprints to the bathroom and Chandler follows with a cigarette in his hands.]ScenesPhoebe: (to Rachel, who’s staying in the cab.) Aren’t you gonna go?ScenesRachel: No. Thank you.ScenesMonica: (getting out) No, Rachel never pees in public restrooms.ScenesRachel: Well, they never have any paper in there y'know. So my rule is ‘no tissue, no tuschy.’ (Phoebe laughs and gets out.) Well, if everybody’s going. (She gets out and starts to close the door.)ScenesPhoebe: No, y'know what don’t close it (Rachel slams the door shut locking themselves out.) ‘cause the... keys...are in there.ScenesChandler: Oh, no-no-no-no-no-no!!ScenesJoey: What’s going on?ScenesChandler: (to Joey) My lighter’s in there! (points to the cab)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The rest stop, the gang is still stuck, Chandler is kneeling at the rear bumper.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Damn! (stands up) The tailpipe’s not hot enough to light this!ScenesJoey: Relax okay, I-I-I can get this open. Anybody have a coat hanger?ScenesChandler: Oh I do! Op, no, wait a minute, I took it out of my shirt when I put it on this morning.ScenesMonica: So, if you’re parents hadn’t got divorced, you’d be able to answer a question like a normal person?ScenesJoey: Look, I just need a wire something to jimmy it. Oh hey, one of you guys give me the underwire from your bra!ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoey: Come on! Who has the biggest boobs?ScenesMonica: Please!!ScenesJoey: Whoever has the biggest boobs, has the biggest bra, therefore has the biggest wire.ScenesThe Girls: No, not getting my bra!ScenesJoey: If you wanna get back in the car, we need the wire, your call.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Monica’s are the biggest.ScenesMonica: These tiny, little non-breasts?! Please, it’s gotta be Rachel.ScenesRachel: What, no, no, no, mine are deceptively small I mean, I-I-I actually sometimes, st-stuff my bra.ScenesMonica: All right then, your bra would still be big.ScenesRachel: No, I stuff outside the bra.ScenesChandler: Ladies, ladies, let’s just compromise okay? Phoebe, Rachel take off Monica’s bra.ScenesPhoebe: All right, forget it, nevermind, you can have mine.Scenes[Chandler crumples up his cigarette pack and throws it on the ground.]ScenesRachel: (seeing him) Chandler, what are you doing? There is a trash can right there.ScenesChandler: Well, I thought if I littered, that crying Indian might come by and save us.ScenesPhoebe: (finishing removing her bra) Okay, there.ScenesJoey: Thank you Phoebe, that is very, very generous.ScenesChandler: Okay, now let’s decide who has the nicest ass.ScenesJoey: (opening the door) And there you go!ScenesAll: Oh, yeahhhhh!!!Scenes[They all run to get in the cab, and Chandler pulls out a smoke.]ScenesMonica: Chandler!!ScenesChandler: At least let me smoke it to the good part.Scenes[Phoebe puts the car in gear and starts to back out.]ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (The car moves a few feet and sputters to a stop.) Oh, no!ScenesRachel: What, what’s it, what’s going on?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, this has happened before.ScenesRachel: So you know how to fix it?ScenesPhoebe: Yep. Put more gas in.

rows.Scenes: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is setting a romantic dinner for Susan as there is a knock on the door.]
rows.Content: Carol: (answering the door) Hi!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey.ScenesCarol: Hey, what are you doing here?ScenesRoss: Well, oh just ah, I was just wondering, when you and I split up, did you get the tape that was half the last episode of M*A*S*H and half the hostages coming home?ScenesCarol: Ah yeah, but now it’s Susan and me in Mexico and the hostages coming home.ScenesRoss: Where’s Ben?ScenesCarol: He’s sleeping.ScenesRoss: Ahh. (notices the table) Ooh, is this a ah, is this a bad time?ScenesCarol: Umm, yeah, actually, Susan’s gonna be home any minute, it’s kinda an anniversary.ScenesRoss: Oh! I thought you guys got married in uh, January?ScenesCarol: It’s not that kind of anniversary.ScenesRoss: Ah! (realises) Oh.ScenesCarol: Sooo!! Anyway...ScenesRoss: Umm, candles, champagne, yeah anniversaries are great. ‘Cause you know love lasts forever, y'know. Nothing like it in this lifetime, money in the bank, so Rachel and I broke up.ScenesCarol: Oh God, Ross I am so sorry.ScenesRoss: Yeah, well.ScenesCarol: Y'know what, I want to talk to you about this so much, but we should probably do it when we could really get into it, are you free for dinner tomorrow night?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah, I’d love that.ScenesCarol: Oh, great! Me too.ScenesRoss: I guess it all started when Rachel got this new job. (he sits down at the table.)

rows.Scenes: The rest stop, Phoebe is on the phone to the motor club.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay, yeah. (to Monica and Rachel) Triple A can pick us up.ScenesRachel: Great!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, what town are we near?ScenesMonica: Freemont. West-Westmont, ah Westburg?ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica) Then why are you answering? Do you at least know what route we’re on?ScenesRachel: Yeah, we are definitely on Route 27.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (on phone) We are at a rest stop on Route 27. Okay. (to Rachel) There is no Route 27. (listens) (to Rachel) Okay, either 93 or 76?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, I’m sorry, I always slept in the back when we drove up here.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (on phone) Hey, can you send somebody up and down 76 and check every rest stop, and, and also 93? (listens) Okay! (hangs up) Yeah, no they don’t do that.ScenesRachel: Ugh, okay, well somebody will come and save us.ScenesMonica: Who? I mean have you seen a car come by here in the last hour and a half? I think we should call Ross, maybe he can get a car and come pick us up.ScenesRachel: No! No, I am not getting in a car with Ross, we will just have to live here!ScenesPhoebe: But if...ScenesRachel: No you guys, I am not getting in a car with him, you’ll have to think of something else.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good, oh Joey and Chandler are back.Scenes[Joey walks up helping Chandler.]ScenesMonica: So the going for help went well?ScenesJoey: Oh yeah, Smokey Joe here got half way to the highway and collapsed.ScenesChandler: I have the lung capacity of a two year old. (starts to light another cigarette.)ScenesMonica: Then why are you smoking?ScenesChandler: Well it’s very unsettling.

rows.Scenes: Carol and Susan’s, Ross is eating the dinner Carol made for Susan.]
rows.Content: Ross: ....right? Right? I mean it’s pretty unbelievable y'know, I mean they just took off, took off without even looking back. Y'know I don’t, I don’t need them, huh, I’ve got you guys now as friends, you and Susan.ScenesCarol: Ah, Susan will be so pleased.Scenes[Ross’s beeper goes off.]ScenesRoss: (looking at the page) 717? (to Carol) Where’s 717? (He gets up to return the page, Carol starts to take the last of the food into the kitchen, but Ross grabs the last piece.) Hey, you’ve have more of these for Susan right?ScenesCarol: No. But it’s okay, I’ll just put out pickles or something.Scenes[Cut to the rest stop, Monica and Phoebe are waiting anxiously by the phone as it rings.]ScenesPhoebe: (answering the phone) (whispering) Ross, thank God.ScenesRoss: Pheebs? What, why are you whispering?ScenesPhoebe: I ate a bug.Scenes[Rachel starts to walk up.]ScenesMonica: (running over to stop Rachel) Hey Rach, the tampons here are only a penny. Let’s stock up. (takes her into the bathroom)ScenesPhoebe: Listen Ross, we ran out of gas, and we don’t know where we are, so we can’t get a tow truck.ScenesRoss: Oh, now you want a favour?ScenesPhoebe: Yes, please.ScenesRoss: Well, oh, I’m sorry your car broke down Pheebs, but I’m a little too busy with some of my real friends right now, but please call to let me know you got home safely okay?ScenesCarol: (running over and grabbing the phone away from Ross) (on phone) Phoebe, hang on a second. (Hands Ross her keys) Here, take my car, go pick up your friends.ScenesRoss: No, I’m not gonna pick them up.ScenesCarol: Listen, we both know you’re gonna do it ‘cause you’re not a jerk. Okay? So you can either sulk here for a half hour and then go pick them up, or save us both time and sulk in the car.ScenesRoss: No, Rachel doesn’t want me to....ScenesCarol: Look, I-I-I am sorry that Rachel dumped you ‘cause she fell in love with that Mark guy, and you are the innocent victim in all of this, but don’t punish your friends for what Rachel did to you.ScenesRoss: Yeah, you’re right.ScenesCarol: (on phone) Phoebe hang on a second Ross wants to say something. (listens) What? (listens) (to Ross) You slept with someone else?!ScenesRoss: We were on a break!!! Okay!! (grabs the phone) We were, we were..., (calms down) yeah. Where are you? I’ll find you. (hangs up)ScenesCarol: You slept with another woman?ScenesRoss: Oh, you-you’re-you’re one to talk.

rows.Scenes: The rest stop, Joey is making a sign.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, done.ScenesMonica: (reading the sign) What’s ‘pleh’?ScenesJoey: That’s ‘help’ spelled backwards so that the helicopters can read it from the air!ScenesMonica: Huh. What’s doofus spelled backwards?Scenes[Ross drives up.]ScenesRachel: (all excited) Op, op, car! Car!! (sees it’s Ross) Ugh!!!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s Ross on one of his drives!ScenesChandler and Joey: Hey!!ScenesPhoebe: Hi!ScenesRachel: What is he doing here?!ScenesRoss: He is saving your butt, ah, unless of course I’m stepping on some toes here, in which case I can just mosey on, I’ve got plenty of people to help on the Interstate.ScenesAll: No! Come on!ScenesRachel: All right!! Fine! Fine.Scenes[Ross grabs the gas can he brought along, and walks through Joey’s sign destroying it.]ScenesJoey: Arrrghh!!ScenesChandler: Oh no, now it’s not gonna make any sense!ScenesPhoebe: (to Chandler and Monica) You guys, what, what do we do about Ross who drove all the way up here? What do we do? Just like send him back and we’re then gonna go skiing?ScenesChandler: Oh, this is horrible, it’s just horrible.ScenesJoey: Guys, do you think we should ask Ross to come along?ScenesMonica: I know, what about Rachel? I mean how are we even gonna ask her?ScenesRachel: Ask me what?ScenesMonica: Umm, if ah, it might be okay if Ross came skiing?ScenesChandler, Phoebe, and Joey: No, I wasn’t gonna ask you that, no.ScenesRachel: You guys are unbelievable. No! He cannot come.ScenesRoss: Excuse me?ScenesChandler: It’s horrible.ScenesRoss: (sarcastic) Oh please, can’t I come to your special, magical cabin?ScenesRachel: Why would you even want to come Ross? You’re a horrible skier.ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, hitting me where it hurts, my ski skills.ScenesMonica: Here we go again.ScenesJoey: I-I can’t handle this, you guys.ScenesChandler: Y'know what, I can handle it, handle’s my middle name. Actually it’s the ah, middle part of my first name.ScenesRoss: All right Pheebs, your cab’s ready.ScenesRachel: All right, let’s go!ScenesRoss: You’re welcome.ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry, were you speaking to me or sleeping with someone else?ScenesRoss: We were on a break!ScenesRachel: Y'know Ross why don’t you put that on your answering machine!ScenesRoss: Hey-hey, it’s valid okay? And I’m not the only one who thinks so, Monica agrees with me.ScenesRachel: (to Monica) What?!ScenesMonica: (shyly) I don’t know.ScenesRoss: That’s what you said last night.ScenesMonica: What I said was, was that I understood. Joey’s the one who agreed with you!ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: Really Joey?ScenesJoey: (pause) What?ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what, but there is, there is no right or wrong, here.ScenesRachel: No, I think it’s very obvious who’s wrong here.ScenesRoss: Obviously not to Joey.Scenes[They all turn around and look at Joey.]ScenesJoey: (pause) What?Scenes[They all start fighting with each other.]ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Look both, Joey and Monica feel the same way that I do. No-no-no-no.ScenesChandler: Guys, guys, guess who I am?! (starts dancing around in an effort to stop the fighting.)Scenes[They stop briefly to look at Chandler, but then start fighting again.]ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Hey! Hey! Hey!! Hey!!! (they all stop fighting, Chandler continues to dance.) Look what you’re doing to Chandler!! (Chandler finally stops) (to Ross and Rachel) Yeah, look, we know this is really, really hard for you guys. Okay? (Ross starts to leave) You don’t, all right you don’t have to love each other, okay? You don’t, you don’t even have to like each other much right now. But please, you have to figure out a way to be around each other.ScenesJoey: Yeah, and not put us in the middle.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, otherwise, I mean that’s, that’s, that’s just it for us hanging out together. Y'know is that what you want? (they both look away) Can you be civil?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: I can.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Good, all right, let’s get back in the car, ‘cause it’s freezing, and my chest is unsupported.ScenesJoey: Oh what, wait, wait a second, I mean, what are we doing? Who’s going with who?ScenesRoss: Look, you guys, you guys should go. (Joey tries to say something, but Ross cuts him off.) No, I’m, you, you planned this all out, and I don’t want to ruin it, so you guys should just go.ScenesJoey: Come on man, you drove all the way up here.ScenesRoss: No, no, really, I’ve got to take the car back anyway, I’m spending all day tomorrow with Ben, It’s fine, no guilt I promise.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesMonica: All right, we’ll call you when we get back.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe we can like go to a movie or something.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Or, or the rodeo!!ScenesRoss: That would be great.ScenesPhoebe: Okay!ScenesChandler: I was being Shelly Winters from The Poseidon Adventure.ScenesRoss: I know!Scenes[They all get in the cab and drive away.]ScenesPhoebe: Bye!!!Scenes[Ross tries to start the truck, and discovers the battery’s dead.]ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Carol and Susan’s, Carol is running to answer the door.]
rows.Content: Carol: (looking through the peephole) Ugh. (opening the door) Ross!ScenesRoss: (entering) Hi! Sorry I’m late. Were you sleeping?ScenesCarol: Ahh, nooo!!ScenesRoss: Oh, great! Listen, oh I had to get you a whole new battery. I got you the best one I could, ‘cause that’s not where you want to skimp.ScenesCarol: You’re a genius, Ross.ScenesRoss: Yeah, well it came to about $112, but what the hell, just call it an even 110?ScenesCarol: Okay, I’ll pay you tomorrow. (pushes him out the door)ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesCarol: Okay, bye!!ScenesRoss: So they ah, they all took off, it was pretty hard watching them go, y'know?ScenesCarol: Yeah, okay, bye. (closes the door, turns out the lights, and runs back to the bedroom)ScenesRoss: (outside the door) So I’m gonna take off then!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Hypnosis TapeScenesWritten by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, all but Chandler are there, Joey laughs for no apparent reason.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Joey) What’s so funny?ScenesJoey: Oh, nothing, no. It’s an acting exercise, I’m practising my fake laugh.ScenesMonica: Oh. (she laughs)ScenesJoey: What-what’s so funny?Scenes(Chandler enters with a cigarette.)ScenesGunther: (to Chandler) Oh, no-no, no-no-no, there’s none of that in here.ScenesChandler: Oh come on man! At least let me finish this last one.ScenesGunther: Okay, but only if you give me a drag.ScenesChandler: Okay.Scenes(Chandler hands him the cigarette, and he takes a long drag.)ScenesGunther: Oh dark mother, once again I suckle at your smokey tit. (hands Chandler back the cigarette.)ScenesChandler: No-no, why don’t you hang on to that one.Scenes(He goes and sits down next to Rachel and puts a cigarette in his mouth, which Rachel takes away from him. He puts another cigarette in his mouth, and Rachel takes it away again.)ScenesChandler: Okay, that’s like the least fun game ever.ScenesRachel: Well, I’m really sick of your smoking, so I brought something that is going to help you quit. (hands him an audio cassette)ScenesChandler: Oh. (takes the cassette and puts it on his arm like the stop smoking patch, and it falls off.) Nope, that patch is no good. (Joey and Monica both do their fake laughs.)ScenesRachel: Come on, it’s a hypnosis tape. This woman at work used it for two weeks straight and she hasn’t smoked since.ScenesRoss: Pffhah.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) What’s your problem?ScenesRoss: Nothing, it’s just that hypnosis is beyond crap.ScenesRachel: Ross, I watched you get hypnotised in Atlantic City.ScenesRoss: Hey, that guy did not hypnotise me! Okay.ScenesRachel: Oh right, ‘cause you always pull your pants down at the count of three and play Wipe-out on your butt cheeks.ScenesPhoebe: All right, y'know forget hypnosis. The way to quit smoking is you have to dance naked in a field of heather, and then bath in the sweat of six healthy young men.ScenesChandler: Or what my Father called Thursday night.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier, Ross is handing Rachel a cup of coffee.]
rows.Content: Ross: Here you go.ScenesRachel: Oh, y'know what, I didn’t want cinnamon on this.ScenesRoss: Sorry. (To remedy that, Ross scoops the cinnamon off of the top with his hand.)ScenesFrank: (entering) Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!!ScenesFrank: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Frank! Hi!ScenesFrank: How are you?ScenesPhoebe: What are you doing here?ScenesFrank: Oh, well y'know, I would’ve called but I lost your phone number and then ah, my Mom locked me out of the house so I couldn’t find it. And then, I tried to find a pay phone, and ah, the receiver was cut off. So...ScenesPhoebe: What happened?ScenesFrank: Ah, oh, the ah, vandalism.ScenesPhoebe: But, also, what happened between you and your Mom?ScenesFrank: Well, we got into a fight ‘cause ah, she said I was to immature to get married.ScenesPhoebe: Your getting married?!ScenesFrank: Oh, yeah!ScenesAll: Wow!ScenesPhoebe: My little brother’s getting married!!ScenesFrank: Oh, I knew you’d be so cool about this. All right, ah, hey, do you want to meet her?ScenesPhoebe: Do I?ScenesFrank: Do you?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I do, yeah.ScenesFrank: Okay, cool, all right, she just ah, parking the truck. (to Joey) I’m gonna, I’m gonna get my ah, my fianc�e man!ScenesChandler: Y'know, I would’ve bet good money that he’d be the first one of us to get married.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, isn’t it fantastic?ScenesMonica: Yeah, ah, but Pheebs don’t you think he’s a little young to get married?ScenesPhoebe: What, he’s 18.ScenesRoss: Exactly, it’ll be illegal for him to drink at his own bachelor party.ScenesJoey: Yeah, or-or to get a hooker.ScenesChandler: Always illegal Joe.ScenesFrank: (entering with his fianc�e Alice, who is obviously much, much older than he is) Hey! Hey! This is ah, my fianc�e, Mrs. Knight. (he points out Phoebe to her)ScenesAlice: Y'know it-it’s funny, um, Frank told me so much about you, but your not how I pictured you at all.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I’m a big surprise.Scenes(Ross lets them both sit in his chair.)ScenesMonica: So, um, how-how did you guys meet?ScenesFrank: Well um, I was in ah Mrs. Knight’s ah, I mean Alice, sorry, Alice, I always do that. I was in her ah, Home Ec class.ScenesAlice: And he was my best student.ScenesFrank: Yeah, she was my best teacher.ScenesAlice: Ohhh. (They embrace in a very passionate kiss.)ScenesChandler: If that doesn’t keep kids in school, what will?ScenesRoss: And so now you guys are gonna be married?ScenesAlice: Yeah. Y'know we-we talked about just living together, but um, we want to have kids right away.Scenes(Both Chandler and Phoebe have shocked looks on their faces.)ScenesRachel: Oh my God!! Great!ScenesPhoebe: Wow, kids. Frank, are you sure you’re ready for that?ScenesFrank: I mean, how hard can it be? Y'know, I mean, y'know, babies, y'know who doesn’t want babies right? And besides y'know, I never had a Dad around, and ah, now-now I always will, ‘cause y'know, it’ll be me. Right?ScenesAlice: Y'know, I mean, really we do realise that there’s an age difference between us.ScenesPhoebe: Oh good! Okay. ‘Cause you were acting like you didn’t.ScenesAlice: Oh no, but when it comes to love, what does age matter?Scenes(They both growl and hiss at each other and then kiss passionately again.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s bedroom, Chandler is listening to the hypnosis tape.]
rows.Content: Hypnosis Tape: You are falling fast asleep. Deeper. Deeper. Deeper. You are now completely asleep. You don’t need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman.

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner, Monica is working, Rachel is having lunch.]
rows.Content: Monica: And y'know what, I just realised, in the last year I’ve only gone out with two guys, Richard and Julio. You gotta help me out here, you gotta set me up, you gotta get me back in the game.ScenesRachel: Well, that shouldn’t be a problem. I mean I work in fashion and all I meet are eligible straight men.ScenesMonica: (to a customer) Pete, can I get you something else?ScenesPete: Yeah, a slice of cheesecake and-and a date if you’re given’ ‘em out.ScenesMonica: Haven’t you and I covered that topic?ScenesPete: Hmm, come on, you just said to her that you….ScenesMonica: Aww, the only reason you want to go out with me because my blond wig, and the big boobs, and the fact that I serve you food.ScenesPete: Well, if that were true, I’d dating my Aunt Ruth. And the two times we went out were just plain awkward. (to Rachel) Come on, you think she should go out with me, don’t you?ScenesRachel: (laughs) Well, I mean, are you sure you want to go out with her? I mean that ain’t a pretty picture in the morning, y’know what I mean. That wig all in disarray, and boobs flung over the night stand, y'know.ScenesMonica: I mean really, think about it.ScenesPete: Ho-ho, I will.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are being lectured by Phoebe.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: No, I know, I know, that this is Frank’s life, (walks behind them, they turn around in the leather chairs to face her) y'know. Y'know, I don’t want to be all judgmental, y'know, but this is sick, it’s sick and wrong!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, what, is it the age thing?ScenesPhoebe: No-no, oh, I’m fine with the age thing y'know, until it starts sticking it’s tongue down my little brother’s throat!ScenesJoey: Pheebs, he seems to enjoy it.ScenesPhoebe: But, I mean, do you think he’s gonna enjoy it when he’s up to his elbows in the diapers from all the babies they have to have right away?! This is not fair to Frank, (she walks behind them again, and hey again turn to follow her) and it-it’s not fair to the babies, and y'know what, it’s not good home economics.ScenesJoey: Well, have-have you told him how you feel?ScenesPhoebe: Yes. Not out loud.ScenesRoss: Pheebs, if you don’t tell him, soon he’s gonna be married, and then you’re gonna hate yourself.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but if I do tell him, then he’s gonna hate myself. I mean look at him and his Mom, I can’t. (pause) But, you guys can, please you gotta talk him out of it.ScenesRoss and Joey: No-no-no-no-no. (They start to turn away, but Phoebe stops them, and turns them back to face her.)ScenesPhoebe: Come on, you guys, you have nothing to lose, I have everything to lose. Do you want me to lose everything? Everything?!ScenesRoss and Joey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I’m gonna go get Frank. (exits)ScenesJoey: So, we’re walking down the street and I turn to you and I say, “Hey, let’s go hang out at Totally Nude Nudes,” remember? And then, and then, you turn to me and say, “Nah, let’s just hang out at your place.” Well, that was a nice move dumb ass.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Monica are entering.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I think you should definitely go out with this guy.ScenesMonica: Nah, he doesn’t do anything for me.ScenesRachel: Monica, last Saturday night, what happened on Walker: Texas Ranger?ScenesMonica: Well, umm, Walker was looking for this big bus load of kids…. (realises) All right, I get your point.ScenesRachel: All right.ScenesChandler: (entering, carrying a briefcase) Hi.ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Y'know, I forgot the combination to this about a year ago? I just carry it around. Do you have any Chap Stick?ScenesMonica: Uh, yeah.ScenesRachel: Hey, how are those tapes working out for ya?ScenesChandler: Y'know what, pretty good.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesChandler: Good! I haven’t smoked yet today, I feel great, and-and-and confident, that is a stunning blouse.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesMonica: Here you go.ScenesChandler: ThanksScenesRachel: Hey Mon, let’s give Pete a chance Come on, he was funny, he seems really nice, and that check thing was adorable.ScenesChandler: What check thing?ScenesMonica: As a joke, this customer at work who has a crush on me gave me a $20,000 tip. His number is on the check, he just did so I’d call him.ScenesChandler: (reading the check) Pete Becker. Pete… (quickly grabs a magazine and opens it up to show her a picture) (pointing to the picture) Is this him?ScenesMonica: That’s Bill Clinton.ScenesChandler: Who’s he huggin’?ScenesMonica: Oh my God! That’s Pete! But why is Bill huggin’ Pete?ScenesChandler: This guy invented Moss 865! Every office in the world uses that program!ScenesRachel: We use it!!ScenesChandler: There you go!!ScenesRachel: Oh my God, Monica’s gonna go out with a millionaire.ScenesMonica: I’m not gonna go out with him.ScenesRachel: Oh my God, I can’t believe this is a real $20,000 check, oh this is just so exciting.ScenesMonica: Or incredibly offensive.ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, sure, that too.Scenes(Chandler is putting on the Chap Stick the same way that women put on lipstick, including the bit with the piece of tissue.)ScenesChandler: (to the girls who are staring at him) What?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Joey are talking to Frank.]
rows.Content: Ross: All we’re saying is don’t rush into anything.ScenesJoey: Yeah, come on, think about it. You’re 18, okay, she’s 44, when you’re 36, she’s gonna be 88.ScenesFrank: What, you don’t think I know that?ScenesJoey: Look, the point is, there’s a lot of women out there you haven’t even had sex with yet!ScenesRoss: Yeah, he-he’s right, he’s right. This is your time y'know, yeah, you’re young, you’re-you’re weird, chicks dig that.ScenesFrank: Okay, but isn’t sex better when it’s with one person that you really, really care about.ScenesJoey: Yeah, in a poem maybe.ScenesRoss: No the man’s right, that’s what I had with Rachel.ScenesFrank: You don’t have it anymore?ScenesRoss: No, I ah, I slept with someone else.ScenesFrank: Okay, so wait, all right, so how does that make things better?ScenesRoss: It didn’t.ScenesFrank: Okay, so what you used to have with Rachel, is what I’ve got with Alice.ScenesJoey: Now, wh-what, what is that like?ScenesFrank: It’s so cool man, it’s so, it’s just ‘cause being with her is so much better than like not being with her.ScenesRoss: Yeah, yeah.ScenesJoey: (to Ross) Why can’t I find that?ScenesRoss: Don’t ask me, I had it and I blew it!ScenesJoey: Well, I want it!ScenesFrank: You can have it!ScenesJoey: I don’t know, maybe I can’t. I mean, maybe there’s something wrong with me.ScenesRoss: Oh, no! No!ScenesFrank: It’s out there man! I’ve seen it! I got it!!ScenesJoey: Then you hold on to it!!ScenesFrank: All right, man!!ScenesJoey: All right, congratulations you lucky bastard! (hugs him)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, it’s after Ross and Joey’s talk with Frank, and Phoebe’s is finding out what happened.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (to Joey) You’re Frank’s best man?!ScenesJoey: I couldn’t help it, there love is so pure.ScenesPhoebe: Well then, (to Ross) what about you?! Huh?!ScenesRoss: I’m the ring bearer.Scenes(As Phoebe stands there in shock and disbelief, Chandler comes out of the bathroom and walks to his bedroom. He’s just got out of the shower and has the towel wrapped around himself high across his chest, and another towel wrapped around his head, like women wear towels. Joey watches Chandler wondering what the hell he’s doing.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s, Phoebe is opening the door.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hi! Oh, Alice, hi! Thanks. I’m so glad you could come, ‘cause I’ve got a real umm, Home Ec emergency. (Points to the table cloth, which has a huge mustard stain on it.)ScenesAlice: Oh my God, who died on this?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know. It’s a real mustard-tastrophe. Can you help me?ScenesAlice: Absolutely. Okay, first we’ll start with a little club soda and salt, and then if that doesn’t work we can go back to…ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what, forget it. It’s ruined.ScenesAlice: Oh no-no, never say that. If we can’t get it out then we can cut around the stain, add a little lace, you make a stylish throw.ScenesPhoebe: Or instead, maybe you could just not marry my brother Frank.

rows.Scenes: Pete’s office, he is participating in a conference call with three other employees, each of whom are on a different TV screen that he controls with a remote.]
rows.Content: Pete: Okay, that’s great, but can we make it smaller? Can we make it fit on the head of a pin? I love when we make things fit on the head of a pin.ScenesAll: Got it. Yeah all right. Yeah, okay.Scenes(The intercom buzzes.)ScenesSecretary: You have a Miss Monica Geller here.ScenesPete: Uh, absolutely, yeah, sEnd her in. (Monica enters) Hi.ScenesMonica: What the hell is this? (holding up the check)ScenesPete: Hang on a second. (to the employees) I’ll-I’ll talk to you in the morning. (turns two of the three off) I’m sorry what?ScenesMonica: Seriously, what is this supposed to mean?ScenesPete: Well, y’know, I never know how much to tip.ScenesMonica: You’re supposed to double the tax. Not double the tax of Romania. I mean, what’s-what’s the deal? Are you, are you trying to buy me? Is this the way you get girls to go out with you?ScenesEmployee: Umm, I’m still here.ScenesPete: (turns off the TV) You’re taking this all wrong. Because, if I didn’t leave you that tip, you wouldn’t of come down here, we wouldn’t be having this argument, and there wouldn’t be this ah, heat between us.ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesPete: Come on, you gotta admit that our relationship is ah, is hitting a new level now. ‘Cause you used to be like the chef, and I was the customer, and now we’re like this-this couple that fights.ScenesMonica: Okay, umm, you’re a loon.ScenesPete: Look, forget the check, okay. (rips up the check) I like you. I think you’re great. Come on, what do you say?ScenesMonica: I don’t know.ScenesPete: Why not?ScenesMonica: ‘Cause I don’t want to encourage this kind of behaviour.ScenesPete: One meal! That’s all I’m asking for. Please? We go out, we eat, and if you don’t have a good time, I give you ten grand, we call it even.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s, she is coming home. She turns on the lights, and sits down on the couch.]
rows.Content: Frank: (hiding under a pile of clothes) Hi. (She jumps up screaming.) Wait, no! Just put the mail down. It’s-it’s me!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Whoa, sorry. Why were you just like all in the dark?ScenesFrank: Oh well, um, your, your laundry just smelled so good, that I thought I’d curl up in it. Is that all right?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, sure. So, how was your day?ScenesFrank: Oh, well just probably the worst one since I’ve been alive.ScenesPhoebe: What umm, what happened?ScenesFrank: Umm, Alice ah, she ah, called it off.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no. Did umm, did she say why?ScenesFrank: Uh, no, not really, just that I was too young, y'know, but I don’t see how I could all of the sudden be too young, ‘cause I’m older than I was when we first got together.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah, no, I don’t, I don’t know. But, y'know what, maybe it’s just all for the best?ScenesFrank: Yeah, if the best is like unbelievable pain!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, sweetie, oh. (hugs him)ScenesFrank: Y'know, I just was finally happy y'know. For the first time in my life! After my Dad left me, and then, and then getting arrested for stealing those birds, and then, and then the whole punctured lung thing! I can, it’s still really hard to take deep breaths in cold weather, but with Alice all that stuff kinda went away. And now it’s, and now it’s gone and I don’t know why!ScenesPhoebe: Uh, well I can tell you why. It’s, it’s because of me. But, y'know what, I only did it because I love you. Okay?ScenesFrank: What?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, well I, I kinda had a little chat with Alice, and I sort of made her see why you two shouldn’t be together, y'know. And you’re gonna see it to, one day, you really, really will.ScenesFrank: Wait a minute, wait, this is because of you?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesFrank: Well, you, wait no, my Mother didn’t want us to be together, but the worst thing she ever did was tie me to the porch.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, but.ScenesFrank: Wait, y'know what, I-I came to you because I thought you’d understand! Oh no!! Y'know, I would storm out of here right now if-if I had some money, or a place to go…

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting Monica ready for her date. The guys are also there. The door buzzes.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh my God! The millionaire’s here!ScenesChandler: (in a feminine way) Oh my God! (and he jumps all around)ScenesMonica: Guys, please, I’m just gonna have dinner with him. Okay?ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, just because he buys you dinner, does not mean you owe him anything.ScenesMonica: I know!!ScenesChandler: Okay, then get the lobster!ScenesMonica: (opening the door) (to Pete) Hey!ScenesPete: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi!!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!Scenes(They’re all staring at him, with big, huge smiles on their faces.)ScenesJoey: Hey, how much cash do you got in your pocket right now?ScenesMonica: And that’s why, I’m not inviting you in for a drink. (starts to leave) Bye.ScenesAll: Oh-no-no-no-no….ScenesRachel: Just one drink?!ScenesMonica: (in the hallway) So, where do you want to go?ScenesPete: Hey, you like pizza?ScenesMonica: Oh, that’s sounds great.ScenesPete: I know a great little place.Scenes[Cut to a shot of the coliseum in Rome, Italy.]

rows.Scenes: A restaurant in Rome, Monica is paying for the pizza.]
rows.Content: Pete: You’re, hey, you’re not paying for the pizza!ScenesMonica: Oh come on, it’s only fair, you paid for the flight. Now is, is that enough lire?ScenesPete: Ahh, I’d throw another thousand on that.ScenesMonica: Why, how much is that?ScenesPete: That’s about 60 cents.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, it’s the middle of the night. Joey is walking into the living room, and runs into the entertainment centre.]
rows.Content: Joey: Every night!!Scenes(He starts to walk to the bathroom and hears the hypnosis tape from Chandler’s bedroom.)ScenesHypnosis Tape: You do not need to smoke. Cigarettes don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. A strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke. (Joey walks out smiling to himself.)

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s, Frank is watching TV, and he’s very depressed as Phoebe enters.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey, Frank. Look, okay, I know that you think I did like this totally evil thing, but I so didn’t. There’s someone here who can explain this better than I can.ScenesAlice: Hi Frank.ScenesFrank: Hi, Mrs. Knight.ScenesAlice: Phoebe’s right Frank. I know it’s hard to hear, but it would’ve been wrong to go through with it. I-I-I was being selfish, even though we, we want the same things now, in the future we may not. (to Phoebe) Is that it, is that what it is?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, but not just that.ScenesAlice: Right, not just that. Umm, even though we love each other as much as we do, none the less…ScenesPhoebe: None the less.ScenesAlice: None the less. Umm, you’re too young to, to really know what you want. (They embrace in a passionate kiss.)ScenesPhoebe: That’s right, exactly. (sees them) All right, it’s a good bye kiss, that’s good. (Frank picks Alice up and they move to the couch) Bye-bye. (They both lie down on the couch and start to make out.) Okay, no, the important thing is that you see what I’m saying, y'know, just y'know, this is clearly wrong. (They ignore her) Okay, I’ve decided I’m gonna let this happen! Okay, can I just get my purse? (She reaches in and Alice moans) Okay, all right, good. (leaves).ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s bedroom, he’s listening to the hypnosis tape again.]
rows.Content: Hypnosis Tape: Cigarette’s don’t control you. You are a strong, confident woman, who does not need to smoke.ScenesJoey: (He’s recorded his voice on the tape) Joey’s your best friEnd. You want to make him a cheese sandwich everyday. (he laughs) And you also want to buy him hundreds of dollars worth of pants.Scenes(Chandler wakes up and stares at the tape.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Tiny T-shirtScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Gunther is pouring Rachel coffee.]
rows.Content: Gunther: Here you go.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesGunther: (In his head) Say Rachel, I was wondering if you’d like to go to a movie with me sometime. As my lover! Nnnsch, to out there. Maybe you’d just like to ah, get something to eat with me sometime? As my lover.ScenesMark: (entering) Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! All right, let’s go shoppin’!!ScenesMark: Um, y'know, before we go ah, there’s something I need to say.ScenesRachel: Oh, okay.ScenesMark: I’ve kinda of had this ah, this crush on you. (Rachel is shocked) But since you were with Ross, I-I didn’t do anything about it. But, now that you’re not, I’d really like to ask you out sometime. So-so that’s-that’s what I’m doing, now.Scenes(Gunther gets this hurt expression on his face and goes into the back room)ScenesRachel: Wow! Umm....Scenes(She’s interrupted by a loud crash and the sound of braking dishes. Followed quickly by another crash. Everyone turns and looks at the back room, as Gunther emerges.)ScenesGunther: I dropped a cup.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the two apartments, Pete and Monica are returning from their date.]
rows.Content: Pete: ...so y'know, that’s why, within a few years, that voice recognition is gonna be pretty much standard on any computer you buy. Y'know, so you could be like-like, ‘Wash my car.’ ‘Clean my room.’ It’s not gonna be able to do any of those things, but it’ll understand what you’re saying.ScenesMonica: Oh, this is so great.ScenesPete: Yeah, it was.ScenesMonica: All right then. (He leans in to kiss her goodnight, but she quickly kisses him on the cheek and pats his shoulder.) Bye.Scenes(She goes into her apartment and sees Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross sitting there.)ScenesMonica: Hello, people who do not live here.ScenesAll: Hi! Hello!ScenesMonica: I gave you a key for emergencies!ScenesPhoebe: We were out of Doritos.ScenesRoss: Hey, how’d the date go with Mr. Millionaire?ScenesChandler: Mr. Millionaire, new from Snooty Playthings! Third wife sold separately.ScenesMonica: He’s great! I mean we have such a good time together! He’s so funny, and sooo sweet, and I’m not attracted to him at all!!ScenesRoss: Still?!ScenesMonica: Noo!! It’s driving me crazy. I mean every other way he’s like the perfect guy, he has everything. Plus! He actually has everything.ScenesChandler: Life-sized Imperial Storm Troopers from Sharper Image?ScenesMonica: Two.ScenesChandler: Wow!! Can Joey and I put them on and fight?ScenesJoey: (entering, dancing and singing) Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! Oh mommie, oh daddie, I am a big old baddie! (He dances around the dinner table and exits)ScenesRoss: I guess he musta gotten the part in that play.ScenesMonica and Phoebe: Oh.ScenesChandler: Yeah, either that, or Gloria Estefan was right, eventually, the rhythm is going to get you.

rows.Scenes: A Theatre, Joey is arriving to rehearse the play he’s in.]
rows.Content: The Director: Joe. How’s it going?ScenesJoey: Good. (He sets his stuff down and starts talking to Kate, another cast member.) Hey.ScenesKate: Hi.ScenesJoey: Oh, so you’re playing Adrienne, huh?ScenesKate: Yes. Are you one of the retarded cousins?ScenesJoey: Oh, no. Ah, I playing your husband, Victor. I’m Joey Tribianni.ScenesKate: Hi, nice to meet you. Kate Miller.Scenes(She goes over to the snack table, and Joey quickly runs over and pours her a cup of coffee.)ScenesJoey: So the ah, play’s pretty great, huh?ScenesKate: Oh, yeah. I love Jennifer Van Murray’s work. She’s so brilliantly incisive when it comes to deconstructing the psyche of the American middle class.ScenesJoey: Oh, forget about it. She rocks!ScenesKate: Where do I know you from?ScenesJoey: Dr. Drake Remoray. Days of Our Lives. Voted most datable neurosurgeon by Teen Beat.ScenesKate: No, that’s not it. So, you’re a soap actor? Well this must be pretty exciting for you to be in a real play, hmm?ScenesJoey: Hey, I’ve done plays before. I’m a serious actor.ScenesKate: That info-mercial! For the milk carton spout thing! You’re-you’re-you’re the guy that doesn’t know how to pour milk!!ScenesJoey: See, I actually can pour milk, but I got you believing that I couldn’t. Now, see, that’s acting.ScenesKate: Right, at the end, you choked on a cookie.ScenesJoey: Yeah, that was real.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is telling Phoebe about Mark, as Gunther eavesdrops behind them.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Wow! I cannot believe Mark asked you out.ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesPhoebe: What, so what are you gonna tell him?ScenesRachel: Well, I told him I would think about it, but I’m gonna tell him no.ScenesPhoebe: Huh.Scenes(Gunther tries to swoop in to ask Rachel out.)ScenesRachel: I mean I think I’d say no to anybody right now. (Hearing this Gunther swoops back to cleaning tables.) Oh, but it was so strange. I mean I’m standing there with this charming, cute guy, who’s asking me to go out with him, which I’m allowed to do, and I felt guilty. Y'know, like I’d be cheating on Ross or something.ScenesPhoebe: Wow. So, okay, maybe that means that, you’re not over Ross yet and you have issues with your father.ScenesRachel: I don’t have any issues with my Father.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so it’s probably just the Ross thing then.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is telling Chandler about Kate.]
rows.Content: Joey: I hate this woman!! I hate her! She told everyone in the company about that info-mercial, and now they all keep asking me to open their drinks. Okay, and whenever I can’t do it, they’re all like-like laughing at me.ScenesRoss: (entering) Hello.ScenesChandler and Joey: Hey!ScenesRoss: So Rachel called. Wants to see me. Going over in a minute.ScenesJoey: Wow, what-what do you think she wants?ScenesRoss: Well, maybe the crazy fog has lifted and she realises that life without me.... a-sucks.ScenesChandler: It’s possible. You are very loveable, I’d miss you if I broke up with you. (Ross glares at him) I was just trying to be supportive.ScenesRoss: Then be supportive like a guy.ScenesChandler: (in a deep voice) If I broke up with you, I’d miss you.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is there as Ross enters, walking very confidently.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: You ah, wanted to see me?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Ahh, here’s a box of your stuff. (hands him a box)ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: Oh, y'know, it’s just like hats, and a shirt, and CD’s, just sort of stuff that you’ve left here.ScenesRoss: What are you doing? Are you trying to hurt me? Or something?ScenesRachel: No. Ross, it, it just seems that y'know it’s time we-we y'know, move on. I mean, I mean don’t’ you think?ScenesRoss: Yes.ScenesRachel: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Yes, I do.ScenesRachel: Good.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I-I really do. (takes a dinosaur mug out of the box) Hey! This-this was a gift?!ScenesRachel: Ross, you got that for free from the museum gift shop.ScenesRoss: It’s still a gift! I got it from the gift shop!ScenesRachel: Okay, all right, give me the mug! I’ll keep the mug.ScenesRoss: No!! Y'know-y'know don’t do me any favours. In fact, where, where’s the rest of my stuff?! Huh? Like-like my umm, (picks up a book) Hey, this book is mine!! And-and-and, and that T-shirt you sleep in? I’d like that back too. Yes, I do.ScenesRachel: You know how much I love that T-shirt! You never even where that T-shirt!ScenesRoss: I’m just trying to help you, move on.ScenesRachel: Oh, you are a petty man. You are a petty, petty....ScenesRoss: Petty...ScenesRachel: Petty... (goes into her room)ScenesRoss: Petty...ScenesRachel: Petty...ScenesRoss: Petty...ScenesRachel: Small...ScenesRoss: Small... (Rachel comes back into the living room and catches Ross mocking her.)ScenesRachel: You are so just doing this out of spite.ScenesRoss: Awwwahuh, no, no, no!!ScenesRachel: Huh?ScenesRoss: I’m-I’m gonna wear this all the time! I love this shirt!! (he kisses the shirt)ScenesRachel: You have not worn that T-shirt since you were 15!! It doesn’t even fit you anymore!ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah-yeah-yeah-yeah...ScenesRachel: (imitating him) yeah-yeah-yeah!!ScenesRoss: Oh-oh, okay, okay! (He quickly takes off his sweater in order to put on the T-shirt. It’s an old ‘Frankie says relax’ T-shirt, that barely fits him. Rachel nods her head in approval of the new look.) If you don’t mind I’m gonna the rest of my stuff, and relax, in my favourite shirt. (Starts to leave) You have a pleasant evening. (He exits and leaves the door open.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gang minus Rachel and Ross are talking to Pete.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: So, you’re like a zillionaire? (Pete smiles and nods)ScenesChandler: And you’re our age. You’re our age.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what, you should like, you should buy a state and then just name it after yourself.ScenesPete: What like Pete Dakota?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, or, or, or, Mississ-Pete.ScenesJoey: Oh, oh, I got it! Pete-Chicago.ScenesChandler: That’s not a state Joe.ScenesJoey: Oh, and Mississ-Pete is?ScenesPete: I got to go, so ah, I’ll see you guys later.ScenesAll: Okay.ScenesChandler: You’re our age!ScenesPete: (to Monica, by the door) So ah, we on for tomorrow?ScenesMonica: Absolutely! (He goes to kiss her, but she stops him and rubs his head and says...) Now get out of here you!! (Pete leaves) (to the gang) Okay, I’m running out of places I can touch him! Look, is there something wrong with me? I mean why am I only attracted to guys where there’s no future? Either they’re too old, or they’re too young, and then there’s Pete who’s-who’s crazy about me, and who’s absolutely perfect for me, and there’s like zip going on! I mean, seriously, does it sound like something’s wrong with me?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, kinda.

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing for the play.]
rows.Content: Kate: Happy?! Is that what I’m supposed to be Vic? Happy?ScenesJoey: Well, why don’t you tell me what you’re supposed to be! Huh? Because I sure as hell can’t figure it out! I talk to you and nothin’. You look at me, and it’s nothin’. (He kisses her) Nothing.ScenesThe Director: Tasty! I’m really starting to feel like you guys have a history, it’s-it’s nice.ScenesKate: I have a question about this scene.ScenesThe Director: Yes?ScenesKate: Well, I don’t understand why Adrienne’s attracted to Victor.ScenesThe Director: Peel the onion. First of all, he’s good looking.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesKate: I think my character’s gonna need a little bit more of reason than that.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, how about this one. Ah, it’s says so in the script! Y'know ah, I-I don’t know why my character likes you either, I mean it says in the script here that you’re a bitch.ScenesKate: It doesn’t say that in the script.ScenesJoey: It does in mine!

rows.Scenes: The Hallway, Chandler and Ross are returning from working out.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can blow dry it. I can put gel on it. It doesn’t matter, I still wind up with this little (pats the flat spot on the back of his head) cowlicky thing on the middle part of my head. It’s so annoying. Does it bug you?ScenesRoss: You bug me.Scenes[Rachel comes out of her apartment, followed by Mark, and they leave on their date, without saying a word to Ross. Ross is stunned.]ScenesChandler: Is there any chance you didn’t see that?ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching a basketball game, Ross is staring out the peephole.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Ross! You gotta stop! Okay?! You can’t just stare through the peep hole for three hours! You’re gonna get peep eye!ScenesRoss: I knew it! I knew it! I always knew she liked him! Y'know, she’d say no, but here we are! Right?
