I actually was gonna bring someone myself, so…ScenesJoey: But you said one.ScenesRachel: I meant, me plus one!ScenesJoey: Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one?ScenesRoss: All right, I’ll see you tonight.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay, bye-bye!ScenesChandler: Bye!ScenesMonica: Bye-bye!Scenes(Ross exits)ScenesRachel: Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom)ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate!ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes it.ScenesMonica: Joey, what are you doing?! It’s never gonna happen, she’s seeing somebody.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne.ScenesJoey: The green bottle next to the shaving cream.ScenesChandler: Oh! Worm medicine for the duck.Scenes(In horror, Joey wipes his neck and smells it.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is getting ready to go to Joey’s premiere and Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Phoebe) Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (on phone) Ooh, I’m setting the phone down. (does so) But I’m still here! Just don’t go anywhere I’m still here. (starts to put on the sweater) Don’t-don’t switch or anything, ‘cause I’m, I’m right here. (She has pulled the sweater over her head, but her head is stuck in a sleeve.) Just one sec. One sec! One second!! (She is now frantically trying to get the sweater on, as Monica returns from the bathroom.) Wait! One second! Just…ScenesMonica: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: What?! Monica, I’m scared!!ScenesMonica: All right. Honey, that’s-that’s a sleeve. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)ScenesHold Voice: Please, stay on the line. Your call is important to us.ScenesMonica: Okay, wait, you gotta hang up ‘cause we’re gonna be late.Scenes(Phoebe starts to hang up the phone, but…)ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesPhoebe: Yes!! Yes!! I’m the next caller! You were gonna have me hang up.ScenesChandler: (entering, carrying the chick and duck) Hey! Can you take a duck and a chick to the theatre?ScenesMonica: Of course not.ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesChandler: Okay. I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy who's played by Ben Stiller who will be in There's Something About Mary and Meet The Parents, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of the dates and pats him on the shoulder.)ScenesRoss: Good.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here.ScenesRachel: Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!!ScenesRoss: Yay!!Scenes(An awkward silence follows.)ScenesRachel: Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy.ScenesTommy: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey. Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin.Scenes(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to shake each other’s hand, and Ross says…)ScenesRoss: And! Break!!Scenes(Awkward laughter follows.)ScenesRachel: Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room.ScenesTommy: Okay.ScenesCailin: I’ll join you.ScenesTommy: I’ll get our seats.ScenesRoss: Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is awkward.ScenesTommy: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Well y'know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out.ScenesTommy: Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that.ScenesRoss: Oh! Well then this is awkward. So what do you uh…ScenesTommy: I think we’re here.ScenesRoss: Oh! Yeah.ScenesTommy: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me, I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats.ScenesMan: Umm, no, I don’t think so.ScenesTommy: Can-can we take a look at your ticket?ScenesMan: Sure. (Hands him the ticket.)ScenesRoss: (looking at ticket) Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh…ScenesMan: Oh, well I thought that ah…ScenesTommy: Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too well for you did it you idiot!! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?! Look you’re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?!ScenesMan: Uh, the usher told us to come…ScenesTommy: Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross, calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle?ScenesRoss: No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, at the post premiere party. The gang is already there, except Phoebe. Joey runs in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (seeing Joey) There he is!ScenesMonica: There’s our star!ScenesJoey: So, so, what’d ya think?ScenesChandler: Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw.ScenesJoey: I-I wasn’t in that.ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesJoey: (sees Kate) Oh-oh, hey-hey, Kate! Listen I want you to meet everybody. Everybody, this is Kate.ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesThe Director: (stepping in) Excuse me. Excuse me. (to Kate) Sweetheart! (Kisses her.) Come! (They leave.)ScenesChandler: So that’s the girl you like.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: (drags Chandler over to buffet table) I’m telling you, this guy Rachel is with is crazy! Okay? He viscously screamed at total strangers! I think he’s baaad news!ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, wait a minute, you don’t like the guy Rachel’s dating? Well, that’s odd.Scenes[cut to Joey, Rachel, and Tommy.]ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, Lauren. Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate’s understudy, Lauren.ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesLauren: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey. Gosh, you look soo familiar.ScenesLauren: Oh, yeah! I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building. It was right after I slept with Joey. He dumped me the next day.Scenes[cut to Monica, Pete, and Cailin]ScenesCailin: So. How’d you guys meet?ScenesPete: Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months, then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine.ScenesMonica: Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version.Scenes[cut to Joey as Estelle, Joey’s agent, approaches]ScenesEstelle: Joey, sweetheart, you were fabulous!ScenesJoey: Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle.ScenesEstelle: How do you do. (to Rachel and Monica) Ooh, you two girls were outstanding! (to Joey) Did they have representation?ScenesJoey: No, they-they weren’t in the play.ScenesRachel: We’re not actors.ScenesEstelle: Ooh, what a shame! Because with her face (points to Monica) and her chest (points to Rachel) I could really put something together.ScenesChandler: Could I borrow it?Scenes[cut to later]ScenesCailin: (to Ross) Hi! Remember me?ScenesRoss: Hi! Yeah! Tommy’s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in front of him, I think he’s gonna snap. (He’s watching very intently)ScenesCailin: Ross, I’m gonna go.ScenesRoss: Go? Why?ScenesCailin: I don’t know. Could be because I don’t feel like standing around all night waiting for some guy who may or may not scream.ScenesRoss: But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream.ScenesCailin: Good bye Ross.ScenesRoss: Uh, oh-ho bye.ScenesThe Director: (entering carrying a newspaper) Here we go people! (starts reading the review) Boxing Day! The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la… Ah-ha! Joey Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr. Tribianni is not the worst thing in this production.ScenesJoey: Yes!!! Ha-ha-ha!ScenesThe Director: Kate Miller’s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable. (Kate walks away depressed.) Badda-badda-badda. Ah-ha! Here it is! The direction by Marshal Talmant is… (stops, reads it again, and throws down the paper in disgust) Thank you, boys and girls, you’ve ruined my life. Please, stuff your talentless faces with my Mother’s crab cakes! (starts to leave) Excuse me!!Scenes(Joey steps in a picks up the paper, the gang all look at him.)ScenesJoey: Anyone mind if I save this?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, is the play over?ScenesMonica: Yeah. Where were you?ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesMonica: You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Nah. I kept myself busy.Scenes(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living room with confused looks on their faces.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff in your room.Scenes(They both look at each other, nod their heads ‘All right’ and follow their stuff into their new rooms.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Are you okay?ScenesKate: Fabulous.ScenesJoey: Listen, drama critics they’re nothing but, but people who couldn’t make it as actors. You know what you should do?ScenesKate: Become a drama critic!ScenesThe Director: (entering, drunk) I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both your houses! (walks away)ScenesKate: By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.ScenesJoey: Oh, classy.ScenesKate: Yep! I sure know how to pick ‘em, huh? Y'know I gave up a part on a soap for this!ScenesJoey: Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.ScenesKate: Really. What?ScenesJoey: Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We’ll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.ScenesKate: Why the Post?ScenesJoey: Oh, you didn’t see the Post?ScenesKate: No. You?ScenesJoey: No. Why?

rows.Scenes: Kate’s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the town.]
rows.Content: Kate: (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?ScenesJoey: Oh, absolutely! You’re talented and you’re good looking.ScenesKate: Oh, you’re sweet and cute.ScenesJoey: I know! That’s why they trashed me!Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesJoey: Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.ScenesKate: What?ScenesJoey: I, I don’t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.ScenesKate: What? So you never went out with an actress before?ScenesJoey: Kate, do you even like me?ScenesKate: Of course I do.ScenesJoey: Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him?ScenesKate: I don’t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone like you?ScenesJoey: Thanks.ScenesKate: You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you’re just so, you’re so, so… (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)ScenesJoey: (Checks to see if she’s drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay, hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let’s get your feet up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I’m gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is STILL on hold.]
rows.Content: Hold Voice: Please stay on the line. You’re call is very important to us.ScenesMonica: (entering from her bedroom) Pheebs, you’ve been up for 24 hours! Go to sleep, honey. Th-this isn’t healthy.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, I’m fine, and y’know why? ‘Cause of all the riboflavin.ScenesJoey: (entering, happily) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! Didn’t you have that outfit on last night?ScenesJoey: Yeah! I stayed at Kate’s, but ah, nothing happened. Hey, Pheebs, where were ya?ScenesPhoebe: I’m so, so, so sorry, Joey. I definitely am gonna see you’re play. I swear you’re play is very important to us, thank you for your patience. You’re play is the next play is the next play I’m gonna see.ScenesMonica: Anyway, how did it go with Kate?ScenesJoey: Oh, it was great! Yeah, I-I walked her home, and it was amazing how much we connected, y'know? Then ah, then she passed out, but then she woke up. Yeah? And we stayed up all night talking, and now we’re like totally crazy about each other!ScenesMonica: Joey, you had the night!ScenesJoey: What?ScenesMonica: When two people finally realise their feelings for each other, and-and they talk for hours, and they-they learn all about the other person!ScenesJoey: You-you think?ScenesMonica: Did you like learn about her family?ScenesJoey: Two brothers, one died!ScenesMonica: Yes!!ScenesJoey: Yeah?!ScenesMonica: Oh! (They hug, triumphantly.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are sitting on the couch, Rachel is on the chair.]
rows.Content: Gunther: (bringing Chandler a cup) This is from the woman at the bar.ScenesChandler: Oh-ho-ho-ho.Scenes(He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and takes the mug away from Chandler.)ScenesGunther: Sorry. She thought you were somebody else.ScenesRachel: What time is it?ScenesMonica: One.ScenesRoss: One.ScenesChandler: 7:15. (Monica looks at him) Watch doesn’t work.ScenesRachel: Tommy’s supposed to be here soon, we’re going to lunch.ScenesRoss: Look. Look, I wasn’t going to say anything to you, but... All right, I don’t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore.ScenesRachel: You don’t?!ScenesRoss: No! The guy is mean. I mean really mean. I think you should stay away from him.ScenesRachel: Umm, or, maybe, I should stay away from all men.ScenesRoss: No, it’s not just ‘cause I’m jealous. (Both Monica and Chandler give him a ‘Come on’ look) I mean I’m not, I’m not, I’m not jealous, okay? It’s… Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at this couple sitting in our seats.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y'know, and he just started like, (claps his hands) banging his hands together!ScenesRoss: Okay, fine, fine. You don’t want to believe me? No, that’s fine. (starts to leave)ScenesMonica: We’re kidding!ScenesChandler: Ross, don’t. Ross!ScenesMonica; Ross!Scenes[cut to outside of Central Perk]ScenesRoss: You don’t want to believe me, I’m Mr. Funny to you. Mr. Funny… (turns around and almost spills his coffee on Tommy)ScenesTommy: Whoa!!ScenesRoss: Whoa, sorry Tommy.ScenesTommy: What’s in the cup, Ross?ScenesRoss: Umm…ScenesTommy: What is in the cup?!ScenesRoss: Okay, it’s coffee.ScenesTommy: Ice coffee? Tell me it’s ice coffee!ScenesRoss: It’s-it’s hot…ScenesTommy: Hot coffee!!! You idiot!! You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me, huh?!! What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo, huh?! Huh?!Scenes[cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately trying to get the gang’s attention, while Tommy is still screaming at him]ScenesRachel: (not seeing Ross) What’s your favourite thing about summertime?ScenesMonica: Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late.ScenesRachel: Yeah…ScenesTommy: (entering, finished with yelling at Ross, who follows him in shell shocked) (happily) Hey!ScenesRachel: Tommyyyy! Say, what’s your favourite thing about summer?ScenesTommy: Ooh, I don’t know. Probably the smell of freshly cut grass.ScenesChandler: Ohh, that’s a good one.Scenes(Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is now)

rows.Scenes: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is arriving, late.]
rows.Content: Joey: Sorry! Sorry, I’m late; sorry, I’m late! My duck and my chick and a fight, it-it was ugly.ScenesStage Manager: Look, we held the curtain for you buddy. Come on, let’s go! Let’s go!Scenes[cut to onstage with Lauren standing in for Kate, the doorbell rings.]ScenesLauren: (answering the door) Vic! Where have you been, baby?!ScenesJoey: (surprised it’s Lauren) (hugs her) (whispering) Where’s Kate?ScenesLauren: (whispering) She got a job in L.A.ScenesJoey: (stunned) What?!ScenesLauren: I’ve been waiting up all night for ya. Where have you been? (Joey doesn’t answer) Where have you been? Vic?!ScenesJoey: Oh, ahh, go to the window. I’m wanna run down to the truck and show you something.ScenesLauren: (at the window, she’s looking down out of the window) What do you got down there, Vic? What do you got under that tarp?ScenesJoey: (grabs the window from the outside and sticks his head in) (whispering) When is she leaving?ScenesLauren: (whispering) Tonight. What are you doing?ScenesJoey: (making like he is yelling up to the second floor) I’m coming up!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are in the kitchen, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Phoebe is, you guessed it, still on hold.]
rows.Content: Tommy: Hey, mind if I use the phone?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I… (starts jabbering incoherently)ScenesChandler: Why don’t you use ours across the hall, ‘cause she…has…problems.ScenesRoss: (coming out of the kitchen with a cup of coffee, almost running into Tommy) Oh-ho, whoa! Sorry, Tommy. I almost spilled this hot coffee on you.ScenesTommy: Yeah, but you didn’t.ScenesRoss: No, but it’s-it’s-it’s hot!Scenes(We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler’s apartment)ScenesRachel: Ross, would you just stop it! It’s getting really old.ScenesRoss: I can’t believe no one believes me!ScenesPhoebe: I do, I believe you.ScenesRoss: You do Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. But I also believed her (points to the phone) when she said I was next.Scenes[cut to Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Tommy is using the phone]ScenesTommy: (noticing the chick) Ooh, hey! Hey, there little fella. (picks up the chick) Mr. Fuzzy-Man, how are you doing? (starts to pet him) Aww. (The chick poops on his hand.) Eww! Oh! Eww! Gross! Idiot!! Stupid little, fuzzy, yellow creature!! Oh look at me, I’m so cute, I’m a little chick who’s disgusting! God, you’re so stupid, how are you not yet extinct!! (the duck wattles behind him and quacks) (to the duck) Quack-quack, quack-quack!! What are you quacking about?! Dumb Donald Doo-Doo!!Scenes(We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.)ScenesChandler: Step away from the duck.ScenesTommy: Ooh, sorry little Mr. Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand! (starts to walk out and stops) (to Rachel) Well, I guess we’re not going out anymore. Whaa!!!Scenes(He leaves the gang in stunned silence.)

rows.Scenes: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is changing for the next scene as Kate arrives, carrying her bags.]
rows.Content: Kate: Joey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesKate: I’m soo glad I caught you, I couldn’t find you before.ScenesJoey: Wh-wh-what’s going on? Wh-what’s this about L.A.?ScenesKate: They still want me for General Hospital.ScenesJoey: But, but wh-what about us?ScenesKate: Last night was wonderful. But I-I can’t stay here just for you.ScenesJoey: Well, so, stay for the museums!ScenesKate: I’m sorry.ScenesStage Manager: Joey, onstage!ScenesJoey: Well can you at least stay to the end of the play? I mean, I’ll go to the airport with ya, I-I wanna say good bye.ScenesLauren: (yelling from onstage) Where are you Vic?ScenesKate: Flight’s in an hour. I-I gotta go.ScenesLauren: Vic! Vic! Vic!!!ScenesJoey: (to Lauren) In a minute!!Scenes[cut to the end of the play]ScenesLauren: So this is it? Victor?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I guess it is. (sees Kate is watching, he turns Lauren so that he can talk directly to Kate, but still look like he is talking to Lauren) Listen, I ah, I gotta say good bye, and-and I gotta say it quick ‘cause this is killing me. One thing you gotta know, is that I will never forget you. But, you’ve got things you have to do now, and so do I. And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship, (smoke starts pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, colored lights on the side of it) and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all. (gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne, baby, I’m gonna want to meet her.Scenes(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7, and Kate waves good bye.)ScenesLauren: So long, Vic! (waving good bye as the ladder retracts)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, except Joey, is there. Phoebe is, well you y'know.]
rows.Content: Monica: Phoebe, it’s been two days.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know. Oh, good thing it’s one of those 801 numbers. Right?ScenesRoss: Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it’s has to be 800. (picks up the instruction manual to check the phone number) ‘Cause all those big companies have 800 numbers, every one. (Finds the number) Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one.ScenesRachel: Phoe-be!!ScenesPhoebe: Sorry, I’m so sorry, I will pay you back.ScenesChandler: And yet, she’s still not hanging up the phone.ScenesAll: Hang it up! Hang up the phone!!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! Fine! (slams the phone down, breaking it) Oh-oh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think I broke it. But that’s all right, here’s the number you can call.ScenesMonica: (sarcastic) Oh.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Ultimate Fighting ChampionScenesStory by: Mark J. Kunerth & Pang-ni LandrumScenesTeleplay by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the whole gang minus Monica is there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Do you think that there’s a town in Missouri or some place called Sample? And ah, as you’re driving into town there’s-there’s like a sign, and it says “You’re in Sample.” (He says it like urine sample.)ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesRachel: How’d it go with Pete?!ScenesJoey: Tell us!ScenesMonica: You’re not gonna believe this. Okay, so I go over...Scenes[Two guys walk over and interrupt her. They’re both names you’ve already heard. One’s Billy Crystal. Yes, that Billy Crystal from City Slickers. The other one is Robin Williams. Yes, that Robin Williams from Mrs. Doubtfire.]ScenesBilly Crystal: I’m sorry. Ex-excuse us. I’m sorry, it’s a little crowded. Do you mind if we... (motions to the couch)ScenesRobin Williams: Yeah, could you scooch?ScenesBilly: Yeah, move over just a little bit.Scenes(Rachel, Chandler, Phoebe, and Joey all scooch over to let them sit down.)ScenesRobin: Keep on scooching.Scenes[cut to Monica telling the gang about what happened at Pete’s]ScenesMonica: So guys, listen, I go over there, and umm...Scenes(Robin interrupts her again by complaining loudly to Billy as the camera cuts to them.)ScenesRobin: Why? Why?! What’s wrong with me?!ScenesBilly: What’s the matter?ScenesRobin: I have a feelin’... I, my wife is sleeping with her gynaecologist.Scenes(The gang is now eaves dropping in on the conversation, and is shocked.)ScenesBilly: How do you know?ScenesRobin: Well y'know, he’s got access.ScenesBilly: Yeah.ScenesRobin: Y'know it’s that feeling you get, y'know?ScenesBilly: Like when you go bowling and you know you’re in somebody else’s shoes?ScenesRobin: That’s the one.Scenes[cut back to the gang.]ScenesPhoebe: All right, so, so you went to Pete’s...ScenesRoss: What happened?ScenesMonica: (Robin is speaking loudly again) I...Scenes[cut to Billy and Robin]ScenesRobin: Why is this happening to me?! I don’t know, maybe it’s my wound.Scenes[cut to the gang]ScenesMonica: Forget it. (they all turn and listen to Billy and Robin)ScenesBilly: So it’s-it’s not heeled yet?ScenesRobin: No-no, it’s ooozing, oozing. (to Rachel) Could you pass me the cream? Is there any—Oh, there’s the cream.ScenesBilly: Thomas, this is gonna be hard, but I wanted it to come from me, and nobody else.ScenesRobin: What is it, Tim?ScenesBilly: It’s me, I’ve been sleeping with your wife.ScenesJoey: (to Billy) So you’re the gynaecologist?ScenesBilly: (to Joey) Hey, I’m trying to have a private conversation! Is that okay?!ScenesRobin: (starting to cry) Ooh, (to Rachel) Can I have a napkin, please? Could you please hand me a napkin? (Rachel tries to grab one, but is to slow for his tastes.) Would you--Give me this thing (grabs the napkin holder from her.) all right!! Enough! (to Billy) And you are no longer my friend! We are finished! (gets up to leave) Nada!! No more! You are a bastard for doing this!! (Billy follows him) Get away from me!!ScenesBilly: Thomas, come back here! (they both leave)Scenes[cut to the gang, they’re all stunned]ScenesPhoebe: So Monica, what were you gonna tell us?ScenesMonica: (pause) I have no idea.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So, come on, what was the big news Pete wanted to tell you Mon?! Or should I say Mrs. Monica Becker?ScenesPhoebe: No-no-no oh, keep your name, don’t take his name.ScenesMonica: He didn’t ask me to marry him.ScenesAll: Ohh.ScenesPhoebe: Well then definately don’t take his name.ScenesMonica: He wanted to tell me he’s gonna compete is some ultimate fighting competition thingy.ScenesThe Guys: Pete?!ScenesRachel: Why?! What is it?ScenesMonica: I don’t know exactly. It’s-it’s sorta like wrestling.ScenesPhoebe: (intrigued) Oh?!ScenesMonica: Yeah, but without the costumes.ScenesPhoebe: (disappointed) Oh.ScenesJoey: And it’s not fake, it’s totally brutal.ScenesChandler: Yeah, it’s two guys in a ring, and the rules are: “They’re are no rules.”ScenesMonica: So you can like, bite, and pull people’s hair and stuff?ScenesRoss: Yeah, anything goes, except ah, eye gouging and fish hooking.ScenesMonica: What’s fish hooking?ScenesRoss: Huh, what’s fish hooking... (Joey sticks his finger in Ross’s mouth and pulls on his cheek, y'know like when you hook a fish.) (to Joey, sarcastic) Thanks man, that would have been really hard to describe. What is that taste?ScenesJoey: What? My hands are totally clean, I just gave the duck a bath.

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing a meeting with his boss.]
rows.Content: Doug: So thanks for the warm welcome. It’s good to have you guys on my team, and I come to play. I hope you do too. Now, let’s go out there and get ‘em! Huh? And remember, there is no ‘I’ in team.ScenesChandler: Yes, but there’s two in martini, soo everybody back to my office.ScenesDoug: (to Chandler) You! Chuckles! What’s your name?ScenesChandler: Oh it’s Bing, sir. I’m sorry , I was just ah...ScenesDoug: No-no, I heard what you said, funny. I like funny. (Chandler starts to leave) This team is about hard work, but it’s also about having fun. Good to have you aboard Bing! (smacks him on the butt, and Chandler leaves shocked.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is making reservations.]
rows.Content: Ross: (on phone) That’s right, Ryder. Wynona Ryder for six. (listens) Thank you. (hangs up) (to the gang) Yeah, we have the reservations.ScenesRachel: Yes!!ScenesChandler: All right buddy, way to go! (smacks him on the butt)ScenesRoss: (stunned) Dude, what are you doing?ScenesChandler: Thank you! Today, my boss keep slapping my butt and he was acting like it was no big deal.ScenesPhoebe: Yeesh, what’d you do about it?ScenesChandler: Well, I didn’t do anything. I didn’t want to be the guy who has a problem with his boss slapping his bottom.ScenesMonica: I gotta tell ya, I think it’s okay to be that guy.ScenesJoey: Yeah, maybe it’s like y'know, that jock thing. Y'know how football players pat each other after touchdowns. (pats Ross on the butt)Scenes(Ross throws his hands out in a “What are you doing?” gesture)ScenesRachel: Y'know I don’t, I don’t understand guys, I mean I-I would never congratulate Monica on a great stew by y'know, grabbin’ her boob.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know, for a really great stew you just y'know, stick your head in between ‘em.ScenesMonica: Okay, can we please go eat?ScenesJoey: Yeah. What are we getting?ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Anything but stew.ScenesRoss: All right so, Chandler, from now on, don’t give your boss a chance to get you. Y'know just ah, don’t turn your back to him.ScenesJoey: Yeah, or you can teach him a lesson. Y'know? What you could do is you could rub something that really smells on your butt, all right? Then, when he goes to smack ya, his hand will smell. (thinking aloud) Now what could you rub on your butt that would smell bad?ScenesChandler: (to Ross and Monica) What if Joey were president?Scenes(Monica, Ross, Chandler, and Joey exit.)ScenesPhoebe: Umm, hey Rach, can I ask you something?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, you can totally say no, but umm, would it be okay with you if I set Ross up on a date?ScenesRachel: Oh, ah with who?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, my friend, Bonnie. She just always thought Ross was really cute, and now that you two aren’t together, she asked if I could set it up, but if you’re not cool with it...ScenesRachel: Oh-oh-oh, which one is Bonnie again?ScenesPhoebe: You remember her from my birthday party two years ago. She’s yeah, like, average height, medium build, bald...ScenesRachel: Oh! (laughs) That’s fine.ScenesPhoebe: Great! Okay, good for you! (as they leave she slaps Rachel on the butt)

rows.Scenes: A Gym, Pete is training for the Ultimate Fighting Championship, with his trainer, Hoshi.]
rows.Content: Hoshi: You are iron. You are steel! Let me ask you something, how come when I call your computer support line, I have to wait an hour and a half?ScenesPete: I told you, we’re adding new operators all the time. Could we concentrate on my training?ScenesHoshi: It’s just hard when I know I have e-mail I can’t get!ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi!ScenesPete: Monica! (runs over and kisses her) Hi honey.ScenesHoshi: All right, on the table. (Pete gets on the table for his rubdown)ScenesMonica: Hey, umm, so listen umm, my friends were telling me a little about this ah, ultimate fighting thing and it, well it sounds really dangerous. I-I don’t want you to get hurt, ‘cause I kinda like you.ScenesPete: Oh, believe me, I don’t want to get hurt either. I’m being smart about this. See these guys? They’re the best trainers in the world, and Hoshi here used to be a paid assassin. (Hoshi yells at him in Chinese) A house painter! He used to be a house painter.ScenesMonica: Promise me you’ll be careful.ScenesPete: I promise.ScenesMonica: Hey, are we still on for tonight?ScenesPete: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Okay, good, ‘cause umm, well maybe we could have a little workout of our own...ScenesHoshi: No! No boom-boom before big fight!ScenesMonica: How ‘bout just a boom?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe is there with Bonnie, as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (to Phoebe) Well that was depressing, I think I just bought a soft pretzel from one of the kids from Fame. Ready to go to the movies?ScenesPhoebe: Um-hmm. Oh wait! This is Bonnie. (who has hair by the way)ScenesBonnie: Hi!ScenesRachel: This is Bonnie? (to Phoebe) This is Bonnie? (to Bonnie) You’re Bonnie?ScenesBonnie: I can show you an ID if you want?ScenesRachel: Oh no, I’m sorry, you look a lot different from the last time I-I saw you.ScenesBonnie: Oh yeah, well I just started wearing bras again.ScenesRachel: Oh, that must be it.ScenesPhoebe: (to Bonnie) Well I hope you have fun tonight.ScenesBonnie: Thanks! You too.Scenes(Phoebe starts to leave, Rachel slowly follows, shocked about how good Bonnie looks now.)Scenes[cut to outside of Central Perk]ScenesRachel: (to Phoebe) You said she was bald.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she was bald, she’s not now.ScenesRachel: How could you not tell me that she has hair?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, I hardly ever say that about people.ScenesRachel: (looks in the window) Ohh, well, this is just perfect!ScenesPhoebe: Well I’m sorry, I thought you said it was okay.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I said what was okay when I thought she was some weird bald chick. I mean, y'know, that girl has hair got all over head!ScenesPhoebe: Well, maybe it won’t work out. Maybe Ross won’t like her personality.ScenesRachel: Why, does she have a bad personality?ScenesPhoebe: Oh no, Bonnie’s the best!

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, Chandler is bent over getting some water as his boss approaches.]
rows.Content: Doug: Bing! (Chandler stands bolt upright and turns around to face him.) Read your Computech proposal, a real homerun. (He goes to slap his butt, but Chandler slides over making him miss.) Ooh. Barely got ya that time, get over here. Come on. (Chandler goes over) Wham! (slaps him on the butt) Good one. That was a good one. (to a couple of Chandler’s co-workers) Keep at it team. (goes into his office)ScenesChandler: (to his co-workers) What is with him?ScenesPhil: With him? You’re is favourite, you’re his guy!ScenesStevens: We never get smacked.ScenesChandler: Well, that’s not true, he-he smacked you once.ScenesPhil: Not on purpose, he ricocheted of you and got me.ScenesStevens: I’m telling you, I need some smacks. I got a kid starting Dartmouth in the fall.ScenesDoug: (coming out of his office) Dartmouth? Who went to Dartmouth? Dartmouth sucks. Did you go to Dartmouth Bing?ScenesChandler: No sir.ScenesDoug: There you go. (smacks him on the butt)

rows.Scenes: The Ultimate Fighting Championship, Ross and Monica are there watching Pete.]
rows.Content: Ross: (walking up with this huge tub-o-popcorn and drink) Hey!ScenesMonica: God Ross, what is that?ScenesRoss: Yeah, it’s the Ultimate Fighting Combo. Yeah, I saved thirty cents, plus I get to keep the cup. Yay!!ScenesAnnouncer: From New York City, New York! Appearing in his Ultimate Fighting Championship debut! He’s known for his confrontational business style. Ladies and Gentlemen, introducing Pete Beck-errrr!!Scenes[Pete enters with his entourage all pumped up, and Ross and Monica are the only ones who stand up and cheer.]ScenesMonica: I love you, Pete!!!ScenesAnnouncer: And his opponent, from Hunnington Beach, California! He’s a 300 pound street fighter, Tank Abbottttttt!!!!Scenes(The crowd goes wild, and Ross is the only one boo-ing him.)ScenesMonica: (going up to the ring) Pete! Pete!! That guy’s pretty huge!ScenesPete: Don’t worry, Hoshi taught me how to use an opponent’s strength and weight against him.ScenesRoss: Well, then that guy is in serious, serious trouble.Scenes(Pete and Monica kiss, and Monica mouths “I love you.” to him.)ScenesRoss: All right! You go get him! Let’s go!ScenesReferee: Here we go gentlemen, here we go! (to Tank Abbott) Are you ready? (He nods, and takes out his teeth) (to Pete) Are you ready? (Pete nods, “Yes.”) Let’s get it on!!Scenes(They both rush each other. Tank picks Pete up and carries him over and slams him into the fence surrounding the ring.)ScenesPete: Uh-oh.Scenes(Tank carries Pete over to the other side of the ring, and we see both Ross and Monica wince in pain.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The Arena, after the fight. Monica is walking up to a defeated Pete.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey! (she sits down next to him) It’s me. Mon-i-ca! Can I just tell you how proud I am of you.ScenesPete: It would be nice after hearing 20,000 people chant “You suck!”ScenesMonica: I mean I-I thought you were nuts at first, but you-you did it. And now you can just look back at this thing with no regrets.ScenesPete: What, look back?ScenesMonica: Well, you’re not gonna get going are you?ScenesPete: Well let me ask you a question. Am I the Ultimate Fighting Champion?ScenesMonica: Well, no. But...ScenesPete: Well I’m not gonna stop until I’m the Ultimate Fighting Champion.ScenesMonica: That guy stood on your neck until you passed out!ScenesPete: Let me tell you a story. When I set out to create Moss 865, do you think it just happened overnight? No. There was Moss 1, that burnt down my Dad’s garage, there was Moss 2 that would only schedule appointments in January, and 862 others that I learned from, just like I learned from this fight, never to let a guy stand on my neck.ScenesMonica: You didn’t know that already?ScenesPete: Look, I’m gonna get better. Okay? I promise you.ScenesMonica: Okay, just get a lot better. (pause) Fast.ScenesPete: Oh, one other thing. Hoshi thinks that you being ringside may have affected my concentration.ScenesMonica: Yeah. That-that was the problem.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's balcony, Ross and Phoebe are grilling some burgers and hot dogs.]
rows.Content: Monica: (joining them) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey! How long until Pete’s fight?ScenesMonica: Oh, about five minutes. Right now they’re interviewing his opponent. Apparently he trains by going to Iran and pulling the arms off thieves.ScenesRoss: Hot dog?ScenesMonica: Four, please. (Ross looks at her) I’m really nervous. (Ross gives her the four dogs) Thank you. (she grabs four buns, and heads back inside)ScenesPhoebe: So Ross, how umm, how did it go with Bonnie?ScenesRoss: What? Oh! I gotta tell you, I-I wasn’t expecting to like her at all, I mean I actually wasn’t expecting to like anyone right now, but she’s really terrific.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, that’s too bad!ScenesRoss: No, I-I’m saying I liked her.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, y'know what, there are other fish in the sea.ScenesRoss: Pheebs, I think she’s great. Okay? We’re going out again.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, I hear you! Are you capable of talking about any thing else?ScenesChandler: (joining them) Hey! Which one’s my turkey burger?ScenesRoss: Ahh, the one next to my foot. Sorry.ScenesJoey: (sticking his head out the window) Hey, the fight’s starting!ScenesRoss: Okay, we’ll be right in. (to Chandler) So ah, did your boss try to slap you again today?ScenesChandler: Nine times! Okay, I had to put on lotion! But, it’s gonna be okay, because as of tomorrow I’m conducting an experiment, and if all goes as planned, my butt will be smack free.ScenesJoey: (sticking his head out the window) Fight’s over!Scenes(Chandler, Ross, and Phoebe all stop dead in their tracks at the news.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, Chandler is confronting his boss about the butt smacking thing. His boss is writing on a white board.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Excuse me, Doug? (no reaction) Hey there sports fan!!ScenesDoug: (turning around) Bing! You got those numbers for me?ScenesChandler: No, I ah, I didn’t do them.ScenesDoug: Oh, you forgot?ScenesChandler: No, no I just ah, didn’t do them. Instead, I ah, hung out with a couple of friends and had a couple of beers so I certainly don’t deserve any praise, verbal or otherwise.ScenesDoug: Well, I got tanked myself last night. Pretty dicey drive home, Tapanzi Bridge never looked smaller. (laughs) That’s okay, you’re still my number one guy! (slaps him on the butt) Bing!ScenesChandler: Doug!!ScenesDoug: Hmm.ScenesChandler: I’m a little bit uncomfortable with the that way you express yourself.ScenesDoug: Oh, is it the swearing? I mean is it the constant swearing? Because I gotta tell ya, if it is, you can just... kiss my ass!ScenesChandler: No, no. It-it’s not about the swearing, it’s more about ah, the way, that you ah, occasionally, concentrate, your enthusiasm on my buttock.ScenesDoug: Oh?ScenesChandler: Oh, and don’t get me wrong, I appreciate the sentiment. It’s just that I, I have a rather, sensitive posterior, and ah, besides, it’s making all the other guys jealous.ScenesDoug: Well, say no more. Y'know it takes guts to bring this up. Bing! You’re okay.ScenesChandler: Okay. (he starts to leave)ScenesDoug: Ha! (goes to smack him on the butt, but stops, faking Chandler out) Ahhhhhhh!ScenesChandler: Ahhhhh! (walks out, imitating shooting himself in the head)

rows.Scenes: The street outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are talking and walking.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Okay. Would you rather live in the shirt pocket of a sweaty giant, or inside his shower drain?ScenesRachel: (seeing Ross and Bonnie inside Central Perk) Oh my God! Phoebe look, it’s Ross and that girl.Scenes(We see Ross and Bonnie laughing and having a good time.)ScenesPhoebe: No! No! Look at that! (drags her away from the window) It’s a line of ants! They’re working as a team!ScenesRachel: Phoebe! (goes back to the window)ScenesPhoebe: (looking in the window) Right, oh yeah. Wow, oh, it looks like Ross is breaking up with her. Uff, I hope he lets her down easy. Let’s go.ScenesRachel: Come on Phoebe, look at that! They are not breaking up, look at them. Okay that’s, you know what that is? That is a, that is a second date, that’s what that is! Look at that, she just put her hand on his thigh...ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! That really is nothing, she is very sexually aggressive.ScenesRachel: Ohh! (walking away from the window) Phoebe, this is all your fault! Now he loves her, he’s gonna marry her, and this is all your fault.ScenesPhoebe: You said it was okay!ScenesRachel: You said she was bald!!ScenesPhoebe: What?! What-what-what-what-what?!!ScenesRachel: Phoebe, we can’t, we just can’t just let it happen! Okay, we have to do something! We have to break them up! Okay? Just go in there and like, shave her head! You owe me one bald girl!!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, first of all, breathe. Second of all, I don’t get it. Aren’t you the one that decided that you didn’t want to be with Ross?ScenesRachel: (quietly) Yes.ScenesPhoebe: Well isn’t he your friend? Don’t you want him to be happy?ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesPhoebe: So?ScenesRachel: I just y'know, I didn’t expect him to be this happy so soon. Ufff. Ooo-ooh! (sits down on the curb)ScenesPhoebe: (sits down next to her and hugs her) Oh no.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, we killed them all.ScenesRachel: Oh!Scenes(They both jump up and wipe off their butts.)

rows.Scenes: A locker room, Pete is in a full upper-body cast. Monica enters, sees him, and gasps. Pete tries to turn around, and winces in pain.]
rows.Content: Pete: It’s okay, it’s not as bad as it looks, it’s a precaution. Ah, I’m not supposed to move my spine.ScenesMonica: Please tell me you’re stopping now.ScenesPete: I’m fine! I’d fight tonight, if they’d let me. (stands up and starts swinging his arms) See this circle I’m marking off here? This is my zone of terror.ScenesMonica: You are insane! You-you gotta give this up!ScenesPete: I can’t until I’m the ultimate fighter. I will do it. I’m telling you, the day will come when children will argue over who will win a fight, me or Superman. Now, I’m not saying I could beat Superman, but y'know, kids are stupid.ScenesMonica: Sit down. All right? Please, just listen to me. You are terrible at this! Okay? You are the worst ultimate fighter ever! Ever!!ScenesPete: Y'know I have a torn rotator cuff, a hairline fracture in my right forearm, and a severely bruised Adam’s Apple, but that really hurt.ScenesMonica: Well then, y'know what? I care about you to much to watch you hurt yourself like this. So if you have to do this, then you’re gonna have to do it without me.ScenesPete: Well if you’re asking me to quit, then you’re asking me to be someone I’m not. I’ve got to do this.ScenesMonica: Then I’ve gotta go. Bye. (kisses him and starts to walk out)ScenesPete: Mon-Monica?ScenesMonica: Yes?ScenesPete: Could you leave a note? ‘Cause I’m on a lot of pain killers now, and I don’t know if I’ll remember this tomorrow. (She leaves.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s office, he is just finishing up a meeting with his boss and the rest of his team.]
rows.Content: Doug: So, in conclusion, the lines all go up (points to the chart), so I’m happy. Great job team! Tomorrow at 8:30. (They start to leave) Phil! Nice job. (smacks him on the butt) Stevens! Way to go! (smacks him on the butt) Joel-burg, you maniac! I love ya! (smacks him on the butt) (Chandler walks up) Bing! Good job, couldn’t have done it without ya. (he shakes his hand)ScenesChandler: Thank you, sir.ScenesStevens: (coming back in) Oh, excuse me. I forgot my briefcase y'know, by accident.ScenesDoug: Of course, you did. Forgot something else too ya bastard! (smacks him on the butt) (to Chandler) Well, what about you? You’re not feeling left out or anything are ya?ScenesChandler: No. No, not at all, that’s-that’s ridiculous.ScenesDoug: Everybody else got one, and you want one too. Don’t you?ScenesChandler: Ye-ye-yeah, yes I do!ScenesDoug: Now get on out of here, you! (smacks him on the butt)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang is watching Pete fight on TV. Monica is hiding in the kitchen, not watching.]
rows.Content: TV Announcer: Pete Becker is circling the ring now. It looks like, he’s just trying to feel him out. Oh, Bruiser is just...ScenesChandler: Run! Run you crazy, rich freak!ScenesRachel: Oh, I can’t watch this. (turns her eyes away)ScenesJoey: Check it out, he’s winning! (to Monica) Pete’s winning!ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesJoey: No-o-o!!ScenesTV Announcer: Uh-oh, Bruiser has Becker on the canvas and is going for his favourite area.ScenesAll: Oh! Oh! (they all recoil in horror)ScenesPhoebe: Wait, if that’s his favourite area, why is he being so mean to it?ScenesRoss: Well, this is ironic. Of your last two boyfriends, Richard didn’t want to have kids, and from the looks of it, now Pete can’t.ScenesAll: Ohh!! (they all start pointing at the screen)ScenesEndScenesThe One At The BeachScenesStory by: Pan-ni Landrum & Mark J. KunerthScenesTeleplay by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, everyone except Phoebe is there. Bonnie is telling them of her sex-capades.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (to Bonnie) So ah, your first sexual experience was with a woman?!ScenesBonnie: All right, I was 15, it was my best friend, Ruth, and we got drunk on that hard cider, and then suddenly, I don’t know, we were, we were making out.ScenesChandler: Tell it again. (pause, we see Rachel is not amused.) Seriously.Scenes[cut to Rachel and Monica at the counter.]ScenesRachel: (to Monica) I mean is that woman capable of talking about anything else but sex?ScenesJoey: Yeah, sure. Well y'know, earlier she was talking about geography.ScenesMonica: Joey, she was listing the countries she’s done it in.ScenesJoey: Well, I think we all learned something.ScenesPhoebe: (entering, hurridly) Hey, you guys! Look what I found! Look at this! (She hands Chandler a picture) That’s my Mom’s writing! Look.ScenesChandler: (reading the back of the picture) Me and Frank and Phoebe, Graduation 1965.ScenesPhoebe: Y'know what that means?ScenesJoey: That you’re actually 50?ScenesPhoebe: No-no, that’s not, that’s not me Phoebe, that’s her pal Phoebe. According to her high school yearbook, they were like B.F.F. (Ross and Bonnie look at her quizzically) Best Friends Forever.ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesRachel: That is so cool.ScenesPhoebe: I know! So this woman probably could like have all kinds of stories about my parents, and she might even know like where my Dad is. So I looked her up, and she lives out by the beach. So maybe this weekend we could go to the beach?ScenesAll: Yeah! Yeah, we can!ScenesBonnie: (to Ross) Shoot! I can’t go, I have to work!ScenesRoss: That’s too bad.ScenesRachel: (sarcastic) Ohh, big, fat bummerrr.ScenesPhoebe: So great! Okay! Tomorrow we’re gonna drive out to Montauk.ScenesJoey: Hey, Bonnie had sex there!Scenes(Rachel turns and gives him a look, and Joey quickly apologises.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Outside Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are waiting for Phoebe to arrive with the cab.]
rows.Content: Monica: (watching a happy couple walk by, arm in arm) Would you look at them. Am I ever gonna find a boyfriend again? I gonna die an old maid.ScenesChandler: You’re not gonna die an old maid, maybe an old spinster cook.ScenesMonica: (sarcastic) Thanks!ScenesChandler: Hey now besides, if worst comes to worst, I’ll be your boyfriend.Scenes(At that suggestion Monica starts laughing.)ScenesMonica: Yeah right.ScenesChandler: Why is that so funny?ScenesMonica: You made a joke right? So I laughed.ScenesChandler: Ha-ha-ha. A little to hard. What am I not ah, boyfriend material?ScenesMonica: Well, no. You’re Chandler. Y'know, Chandler! (hits him on the arm)ScenesChandler: Okay, so we’ve established my name, and hit me. But theoretically y'know, I mean say we weren’t friends, say it’s a blind date. I show up at your door, and I’m like (in a fake voice) “Hey, nice to meet, ya. Hey, oh-hey.”ScenesMonica: Well I’d probably be scared of a guy using a fake voice.ScenesJoey: (walking up carrying a brown paper bag) Hey!ScenesMonica: Oh, hey! Oh good, you brought food!ScenesJoey: No, it’s just my luggage.Scenes(Phoebe drives up.)ScenesChandler, Monica, and Joey: Hey!!ScenesJoey: Woo-hoo! All right! Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I am having the best karma this week. First, I find this woman who knew my parents, and then my client with the fuzzy back gives me his beach house.ScenesRoss: Yeah? What about ah, that bike messenger you hit?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I wasn’t talking about his karma.ScenesRachel: (approaching) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, check out the hat!Scenes(She is wearing this giant straw hat, the brim on it must be at least, least foot wide.)ScenesChandler: What a minute, I know that hat! I was taken aboard that hat! They did experiments on me! I can’t have children!!ScenesMonica: Seriously, where did you get the hat?ScenesRachel: Ross gave it to me.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I think she looks good.ScenesRachel: Ohh, thank you.ScenesChandler: Buy it for ya, or win it for ya?ScenesRachel: Well excuse me, my fashion-impaired friends, I am here to tell you that hats are back.ScenesPhoebe: And this time, they’ve ganged up to form one giant, super hat.

rows.Scenes: At the Beach, it’s raining cats and dogs as the gang arrives. Chandler and Monica are taking shelter under Rachel’s hat.]
rows.Content: Ross: Go, go, go!ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, now everybody wants to be under this hat!Scenes(They get inside and notice on small problem.)ScenesPhoebe: Oy!!ScenesMonica: What’s with all this sand? (picking a handful of sand off of the floor, which is covered in sand)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, Bob said there might be flood damage.ScenesRoss: Yeah, either that, or he has a really big cat.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe Sr. house, she is a real estate agent and is trying to sell a house over the phone. By the way, it’s still raining outside.]
rows.Content: Phoebe Sr: Well, yes, it’s kind’ve an unusual house. It has umm, three beautiful bedrooms and ah, no baths. But y'know, the ocean is right there.ScenesPhoebe: (at the door) Knock, knock, knock.ScenesPhoebe Sr: (on phone) Ah, oh, hang on a second. (to Phoebe) Come in, come in. (on phone) All right, so think about it, and call me back. (hangs up)ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Are you ah, Phoebe Abott?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Ahh, yes.ScenesPhoebe: Hi Phoebe Abott, I’m your best friends daughter!ScenesPhoebe Sr: You’re Erwin’s daughter?!ScenesPhoebe: No, I-I mean your-your old best friend, here. (hands her the picture) Lily, from high school. Remember?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh gosh, Lily, yes. Of course I remember Lily. I... Then you must be?ScenesPhoebe: (points to herself) Phoebe. (points to her) Phoebe. Phoebe, yeah. She named me after you I guess.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Uh-huh. Wow! Well, look! There’s Frank. (points to the picture.)ScenesPhoebe: Yes!! Yes! Yes! Yes!! That’s my Dad, that’s Frank! Yeah! I’m sorry I’m getting all flingy.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Take it easy--if you want, there’s cookies on the counter, or, or--sangria! (jumps up) I can make sangria!ScenesPhoebe: No-no, sorry. Cookies are good, thanks.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh.ScenesPhoebe: (goes and gets some cookies) Well, so, umm, anyway umm, I’ve been, I’ve been looking for my Father, and umm, have you heard from him, or seen him?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Oh no, I-I’m sorry, I guess we lost track of everybody after high school.ScenesPhoebe: (disappointed) Oh, okay. Well, so tell me everything about my parents. Everything.ScenesPhoebe Sr: Ohh, well. Y'know we were always together, in fact the had a nickname for the three of us.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, what? What was it?ScenesPhoebe Sr: The three losers. Oh, poor Lily. (Phoebe notices a picture on the fridge, takes it, and puts it in her pocket.) Ohh, y'know I-I heard about what happened, that must have been just terrible for you, losing your mother that way.ScenesPhoebe: (happily) Yeah, no, it was great.

rows.Scenes: The beach house, it’s still raining. Chandler is building a sand castle, Rachel is doing Monica’s nails, and they’re all drinking margaritas, obviously bored.]
rows.Content: Joey: (getting an idea) Hey, y'know what a really good rainy day game is?ScenesMonica: What?!ScenesJoey: I mean naked game. Strip poker, we should totally play strip poker.ScenesAll: No, no!ScenesMonica: What are you crazy?!ScenesJoey: Come on! When you go away, you-you have to play, it’s like a law!ScenesRachel: (to Monica) Allll done!ScenesMonica: Aww, thank you.ScenesRachel: Okay, who’s next?! (She looks around the room, and stops when she comes to Ross.)ScenesRoss: No-o-o! (Rachel gives him a “Please?” look.) No way!ScenesRachel: Come on, please?! I’m boredddd! You let me do it once before.Scenes(Ross shoots Joey a look, who shoots Chandler a look, who gives Joey an “Oh my God.” look back.)ScenesRoss: Yeah well, if ah, if that’s the rule this weekend... (She gets up) No!ScenesRachel: Yes! (she starts creeping up on him)ScenesRoss: Get away!ScenesRachel: Just once!ScenesRoss: Stay away!ScenesRachel: Take it like a man, Ross!ScenesRoss: (he gets up and starts to run away from her) No! (in his escape attempt he crushes Chandler’s sand castle) No!ScenesRachel: Oh, come on!ScenesChandler: Big bullies!!Scenes(Ross dives over the couch, Rachel goes the other way, and lands up top of him.)ScenesRoss: Ow! Ow! Oh, no-no-no!Scenes(They get into a wrestling match, that ends with Ross making Rachel paint her forehead with the nail polish. They both end up lying next to each other, stop, and look at each other for a moment.)ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Oh, hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, so, how are we doing?ScenesChandler: Bored and bored!ScenesJoey: Hey, you know what naked card game is never boring?ScenesAll: Noo!!ScenesMonica: (to Phoebe) So what’s Phoebe like?ScenesPhoebe: I’m kind, caring, and sweet. What’s Monica like?ScenesMonica: Ah no, the other Phoebe, the one you went to go see.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, I think she knows where my Dad is.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesMonica: Oh well, where is he?!ScenesPhoebe: She was acting, she was pretending like she hasn’t heard from him on years, but I found this picture on her fridge, and look (shows Monica)! Isn’t this what he would look like now?ScenesMonica: (gasps) Totally familiar. (Phoebe shows the rest of them.)ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah.ScenesThe Guys: Yeah!ScenesMonica: Well, why would she lie to you?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know, but we’re having dinner tomorrow night, so I figured, she’s gonna tell me then. Y'know maybe she just wanted to give him time to, buy me presents, I don’t know! So, you’re all bored?ScenesAll: Ohh!!ScenesChandler: Yes!ScenesPhoebe: All right, I’m gonna close my eyes and point to someone, and you, whoever I point has to come up with something fun for us to do, and we have to do it.ScenesJoey: Okay, all right.ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesJoey: Fan out! Fan out!Scenes(They do so, and Phoebe gets in the middle, closes her eyes, and starts spinning in a circle.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (Starts to spin) Ooh, y'know we could just do this. (She stops at Chandler)ScenesChandler: Okay, umm, we all have to play strip poker.ScenesJoey: (jumping in triumph) OH YES!!!!!Scenes[cut to later]ScenesMonica: Strip Happy Days Game?ScenesJoey: Yeah, well, I couldn’t find any cards, so it was either this or Strip Bag Of Old Knitting Stuff.Scenes(Monica rolls, and Ross goes first.)ScenesRoss: Okay, (reading the card) Fonzy gives you two thumbs up, collect two cool points. Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: Monica, if you get five cool points, you get to make somebody take off one item of clothing. It hasn’t happened yet, but we’re all very excited.ScenesRoss: Okay, come on! (blows on the dice) Daddy needs a new pair of electromagnetic microscopes for the Prehistoric Forensics Department! (They all look at him, and he shuts up and rolls the dice.) (he moves his piece) Okay. (reading a card) Take Pinky Tuscadero up to Inspiration Point, collect three cool points!! Yeah! Which gives me five, and let’s see who is gonna lose their clothes. Ummmm, I think I pick our strip poker sponsor Mr. Joey Tribianni.ScenesThe Girls: Woo-hooooo!!!!ScenesJoey: All right, relax. It’s just a shoe.ScenesAll: Wooooo!!!!Scenes[cut to later in the game]ScenesRachel: (reading a card) Okay, your band is playing at Arnold’s, collect three cool points. Which means, I have five, and that means I get Joey’s boxers!ScenesJoey: Fine. Gang up on me! I got you all right where I want you.ScenesPhoebe: Come on, take ‘em off!!ScenesJoey: Actually, y'know it’s kinda cold, so how about I keep my boxers on, and give you all a peek at the good stuff?ScenesRachel: (getting up) All right, I’m gonna make more margaritas! (She pours the rest of the pitcher into Ross’s glass.)ScenesRoss: Whoa, hey! What are doing? Trying to get me drunk?ScenesRachel: I’m just making margaritas.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesMonica: I think I’ll help her out. (She gets up to go over and help Rachel, and reveals she has no pants.) (to Rachel) What is going on here?ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: You painting his toenails?ScenesRachel: Oh, come on!ScenesMonica: Chasing him all around the room?ScenesRachel: Monica, please?ScenesMonica: He’s totally flirting with you too.ScenesRachel: (pause) He is, isn’t he? I don’t know, I don’t know, I mean maybe it’s just being here at the beach together or, I don’t know. But it’s like something... (she’s interrupted by the sound of Bonnie entering)ScenesBonnie: Hey!ScenesRoss: Hey! (Rachel is shocked) Hi Bonnie!ScenesBonnie: Hi! My boss let me off early, so I took the train.ScenesRoss: Oh.ScenesBonnie: What are you guys doing?!ScenesJoey: We’re playing Strip Happy Days Game!ScenesBonnie: Cool! I’ll catch up! (She takes off her sweater.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The beach house, the next morning. Chandler and Monica are in the kitchen eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So, you still don’t think I’m boyfriend material?ScenesMonica: Huh?ScenesChandler: I saw you checking me out during the game last night.ScenesMonica: You didn’t even take off your pants.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, lucky for you.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesChandler: I don’t know.ScenesRachel: (entering) Well! Is everybody else having just the best time?!ScenesPhoebe: Shhh! Shhhh! Joey’s asleep.Scenes(Joey is sleeping on the floor and is buried in sand that has been carved into a mermaid complete with breasts.)ScenesPhoebe: After he passed out, we put the sand around him to keep him warm.ScenesRachel: Well I assume the ah, happy couple isn’t up yet. Did you guys hear them last night?ScenesChandler: Oh, yeah, I don’t know what they were doing, but at one point sea turtles actually came up to the house.Scenes(Ross and Bonnie enter)ScenesRoss: Good morning.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesBonnie: Hey! How did everybody sleep?ScenesRachel: Oh, great.ScenesMonica: Like a log.ScenesRoss and Bonnie: Us too.ScenesRachel: I’m going for a walk.Scenes(Joey finally wakes up.)ScenesRoss: (to Joey) Good morning. Nice breasts by the way.Scenes(Joey looks down and his look turns from shock to satisfaction.)

rows.Scenes: The porch, Bonnie is coming back from swimming, Rachel is reading.]
rows.Content: Bonnie: Hey, what happened to you?ScenesRachel: Oh, ah nothin’. I just felt like hangin’ out here and reading.ScenesBonnie: Oh, the water was sooo great! We jumped off this pier and my suit came off.ScenesRachel: Ohhhh, sorry I missed that.ScenesBonnie: Yeah, Joey and Chandler sure are funny.ScenesRachel: Ohh-ha-ha!ScenesBonnie: I think I brought back half of the beach in my hair. It was so much easier when I used to shave my head.ScenesRachel: Y'know, I gotta tell ya, I just loved your look when you were bald.ScenesBonnie: Really?!ScenesRachel: Ohh!ScenesBonnie: Because I think about shaving it all off again sometime.ScenesRachel: Really?!ScenesBonnie: Yeah!ScenesRachel: I mean you definitely should do that.ScenesBonnie: Y'know what, I should do it.ScenesRachel: Yeah!ScenesBonnie: Yeah, thank you Rachel, you are soo cool.ScenesRachel: Awww, stop. Come on. Now go shave that head!ScenesBonnie: All right.Scenes(As Bonnie goes to do just that, Rachel smiles to herself, proud of what she’s done.)

rows.Scenes: The beach house, at night. Phoebe is hangs up the phone, and gently pushes one of the stools over.]
rows.Content: Joey: What’s the matter, Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: She cancelled! My namesake cancelled on me!ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, she clamed she had to go out of town suddenly. She’s avoiding me, she doesn’t want to tell me where my Father is. She knows, and she won’t tell me.ScenesRachel: Aww Pheebs, that sucks!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well, don’t “Aww Pheebs, that sucks!” me yet. (she starts to leave)ScenesChandler: Where ya going?ScenesPhoebe: Well, she’s out of town so, there’s gotta be something in her house that tells me where my Father is.ScenesRoss: Uh, Pheebs, some people call that breaking and entering.ScenesPhoebe: Well, are any of those people here?!ScenesAll: Oh, no!! No, no!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, look I-I-I do something nice, okay? I’ll-I’ll fill her ice trays.Scenes(She exits just as Bonnie comes down the stairs, as bald as Michael Jordan.)ScenesBonnie: Hey, everybody!ScenesAll: Wow!! (they all recoil in shock and horror)ScenesRoss: Wh-haa-haa! Look what ‘cha did! (Rachel has her hand over her mouth to keep from laughing.)ScenesBonnie: You wanna touch it?ScenesRoss: Nooo, but it, but it’s great.ScenesBonnie: Come on, touch it!ScenesRoss: Okay. (He gently touches it.) You can feel all the bones in your skull.

rows.Scenes: Outside the beach house, Ross is coming out to talk to Rachel.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: I was having a little chat with ah, Bonnie, and ah, guess what, she-she happened to bring up y'know, who was behind the um, whole head shaving idea, and now, who was it? Oh, that’s right, that’s right, it was you!ScenesRachel: That was her idea, I just gave her a nudge.ScenesRoss: She said you gave her the razor!ScenesBonnie: (joining them) Hey guys.ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesBonnie: So, anyone up for a midnight dip in the ocean?ScenesRoss: Ahh, no, I’m good.ScenesBonnie: Okay, I’ll see you in a bit.ScenesRoss: Okay, have fun! Wooo!!ScenesRachel: Come on see, she doesn’t look that bad.ScenesRoss: You can see the moonlight bouncing off her head! What the hell were you thinking?!!ScenesRachel: I don’t know.ScenesRoss: You don’t know?! Rach, you balded my girlfriend!ScenesRachel: All right! Ross, do you think it’s easy for me to see you with somebody else?ScenesRoss: Y'know, hey! You’re the one who ended it, remember?ScenesRachel: Yeah, because I was mad at you, not because I stopped loving you!ScenesRoss: You still love me?ScenesRachel: Noo.ScenesRoss: You still love me.ScenesRachel: Oh, y-yeah, so, you-you love me!ScenesRoss: Noo, nnnnn. What does this mean? What do you, I mean do you wanna, get back together?ScenesRachel: Noo! Maybe! I, I don’t know. Ross, I still can’t forgive you for what you did, I can’t, I just, but sometimes when I’m with you I just, I feel so...ScenesRoss: What?!ScenesRachel: I just, I feel, I-I just...ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I feel...Scenes(Ross leans in and kisses her. They both look at each other for a moment, and then embrace in a more passionate kiss, only to be interrupted by Joey and Chandler coming outside.)ScenesChandler: (to Joey) Noo!! I don’t care! I’m not, I’m not gonna playing one-on-one strip poker with you for practice!Scenes(Rachel and Ross both stop kissing, and quickly step back from each other.)ScenesJoey: But I made cards!!ScenesRachel: Well! Good night. (to Ross) I’m going upstairs.ScenesJoey and Chandler: G’night.Scenes(Rachel walks inside, stops, and turns back to look at Ross for a moment then goes upstairs.)ScenesJoey: (to Ross) Wanna play strip poker for practice?

rows.Scenes: Phoebe Sr.’s house, Phoebe is breaking in through a window.]
rows.Content: (She throws her bag inside, and starts to climb through the window. She gets halfway in and the window slams shut on her butt.)ScenesPhoebe: Ow! My ass. Okay. Okay. (She manages to climb completely inside and the window slams shut.) Oh, shhh!Scenes(She starts walking across the darkened room and hits her head on a wind chime hanging from the ceiling, to stop it from making a noise she grabs it and “Shhh’s” it. She goes into the kitchen and finds Phoebe Sr.’s appointment book, to read it she opens the freezer. Just as she starts to read, Phoebe Sr. jumps out from her bedroom with a coat hanger, startling Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: No! No!! It’s me! It’s me! I-I didn’t want to make any noise!ScenesPhoebe Sr: Then don't break in!!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry.ScenesPhoebe Sr: What are you doing here?!ScenesPhoebe: I-I, came to fill your ice cube trays.ScenesPhoebe Sr: What?!ScenesPhoebe: Umm, okay, okay, look. I took this picture from your fridge. Okay, because I know that this is my Father. Yeah, this is Frank Buffay and you are standing right there next to him. Now, look I deserve to know where I came from. All right? So if you can help me find my Father then you should! Otherwise, you’re just mean! (pause) So, just tell me the truth!ScenesPhoebe Sr: All right, the man in the picture is Chuck Magioni.ScenesPhoebe: My Father is Chuck Magioni?ScenesPhoebe Sr: No, no, that’s just Chuck Magioni, I-I sold him a house last year! And I’m very sorry, but I don’t know where your Father is, and that’s the truth.ScenesPhoebe: Oh.ScenesPhoebe Sr: But umm, you’re right. I think that a person should know where they come from. Wh-which is why I ah, (pause) ahh, (pause) okay. I’m your mother.ScenesPhoebe: Heh?ScenesPhoebe Sr: Y'know I wanted to tell you yesterday, but I just, I kinda felt all floopy, and...Scenes(At that Phoebe’s eyes open in shock.)

rows.Scenes: Outside the beach house, Ross is telling Joey and Chandler what happened with Rachel.]
rows.Content: Joey: I’m telling ya, you guys are totally getting back together!ScenesRoss: That’s not true! Her, she doesn’t even know what she wants! Rachel’s still mad about the whole thing.ScenesChandler: Okay, then you gotta back away, all right? You don’t need that kind’ve hurt. Take it from a guy who’s never had a long term relationship......ScenesRoss: I know, but ahhhhhh!! I really wanna go up there and finish that kiss!ScenesBonnie: (coming back from her swim) Hey!ScenesChandler: Ahhhh! (Steps away from her.)ScenesBonnie: You guys, the water’s great. You should really go in.ScenesChandler: Oh, ahh, no thanks, I just had an M&M.ScenesBonnie: Okay, well g’night.ScenesRoss: Good night.ScenesBonnie: (kisses Ross) Don’t be too long.ScenesRoss: Okey-dokey!ScenesChandler: There is not one hair on that head.ScenesRoss: Hey, it’ll grow back, right? And she-she’s really fun, and she’s cool, and-and I’m finally moving on. Y'know? I mean getting over Rachel was so (makes an incoherent nasal sound), y'know? Y'know, and I’m finally feeling sane again. And now if I go up there, and-and I kiss her, and, Gooood I wanna kiss her, and-and-and it doesn’t work out, right? Do I really wanna put myself through that again?ScenesJoey: So let me get this straight. If you go with Bonnie tonight, you’re doing the smart, healthy thing and moving on.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Right, and you go with Rachel, Bonnie’s free tonight?

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the bedrooms. Ross is coming upstairs and stops between two doors. He looks at the one on the right, then he looks at the one on his left, thinks about it, and goes in the one on his right.]
rows.Content: Ross: (entering the bedroom) Hi. (closes the door)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The beach house, Chandler is simulating he’s coming to pick up Monica for a date. Chandler knocks on the door, and Monica answers it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (in a fake voice) Hi there.ScenesMonica: That’s that weird voice again.ScenesChandler: Okay! Okay! Let me try it again, you’re gonna wanna date this next guy, I swear!Scenes(Monica closes the door, Chandler knocks, and Monica opens it to reveal Chandler on his knees.)ScenesChandler: Hi! I’m Dorf! You’re date for the evening. (Monica walks away in disgust) Oh come on! Dorf on dating, that’s good stuff!!ScenesEndScenesThe One With the Princess Leia FantasyScenesWritten by: Michael Curtis and Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenes[Scene Central Perk, the whole gang is entering]ScenesJoey: I'm tellin' ya that girl totally winked at me.ScenesAll: Did not, she did not wink at you...(sees that their sacred couch is occupied by strangers).ScenesChandler: Huh. (They all leave, dejected)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Monica's, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Ross: I have to say Tupolo Honey by Van Morrison.ScenesRachel: Nooo Way! The most romantic song ever is The Way We Were.ScenesPhoebe: See, I-I think that one that Elton John wrote for, um, that guy on Who's The Boss.ScenesRachel: What song was that, Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: (singing) Hold me close, young Tony Dan-za.Scenes(Monica enters from her bedroom)ScenesPhoebe: Hi Monica!ScenesRoss: Hey Mon!ScenesRachel: Hey Mon!Scenes(she just walks straight into the bathroom)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, has she slept at all?ScenesRoss: Nope.ScenesRachel: No, it's been three nights in a row.ScenesRoss: Yeah, she finally stopped crying yesterday, but then she found one of Richard's cigar butts out on the terrace, so.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay that explains it. I got a call at two in the morning, but all I could hear was, like, this high squeaky sound, so I thought okay its like a mouse or a opossum. But then I realized where would a mouse or a opossum get the money to make the phone call.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is coming in from the bedroom]
rows.Content: Chandler: Morning.ScenesJoey: Morning, hey, you made pancakes?ScenesChandler: Yeah, like there's any way I could ever do that.ScenesJanice: (entering and singing) Monica and Rachel had syrup, now I can get my man to cheer up. (laughs hysterically) Good morning Joey.ScenesJoey: (sarcastically) Good morning.ScenesChandler: Hey, you know what, here's a thought. Why don't you stay home from work today and just hang out with me.ScenesJanice: Oh, I wish. Look, honey, you have that report to finish, and I gotta go see my lawyer.ScenesChandler: I can not believe that I am going out with someone that is getting divorced. I'm such a grown up.ScenesJanice: (laughs) I-I-I gotta go, I gotta go. Okay, not without a kiss.ScenesChandler: Well, maybe I won't kiss you, and then you'll have to stay.ScenesJoey: (under his breath) Kiss her! Kiss her!ScenesJanice: I'll see you later, sweetie. Bye Joey.ScenesJoey: B-bye Janice. So when ya' dumpin' her.ScenesChandler: Nope, not this time.ScenesJoey: Come on, quite yankin' me.ScenesChandler: I'm not yanking you.ScenesJoey: This is Janice.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I know. She makes me happy.ScenesJoey: Okay. All right. You look me in the eye and tell me, without blinking, that you're not breaking up with her. No blinking.ScenesChandler: (looks him in the eye) I'm not breaking up with her! (they stare at each other for a while, then Joey blows in his face)

rows.Scenes: Rachel and Monica's, Monica is entering from the bathroom.]
rows.Content: Monica: God, look what I found in the drain.ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesMonica: It's some of Richard's hair! (holds it close to Ross) What do I do with this?ScenesRoss: Getting it away from me would be job one.ScenesMonica: It's weird, but you know what I don't wanna throw this away. I mean this is like all I have left of him, gross, drain hair. Ooh! (drops it in Ross's cereal)ScenesPhoebe: Ooh. Oh. It looks like, like a tiny little person drowning in your cereal. (Ross gives her this look, like 'Yeah, doesn't it', and gets up to dump it down the drain.)ScenesMonica: God, what is wrong with me.ScenesRoss: You need to get some sleep.ScenesMonica: I need to get some Richard.ScenesRachel: Monica, you broke up with him for a reason.ScenesMonica: I know, I know. I'm just so tired of-of missing him. I'm tired of wondering why hasn't he called. Why hasn't he called!ScenesPhoebe: Maybe, because you told him not to.ScenesMonica: What are you the memory woman?ScenesJoey: (entering) Their not breaking up. Chandler and Janice. Their not breaking up. He didn't blink or anything.ScenesRachel: Well, you know I'm not surprised. I mean have you seen them together, they're really cute.ScenesJoey: Cute! This is Janice! You remember Janice?ScenesRachel: Yes, Joey, I remember, she's annoying, but you know what she's-she's his girlfriend now. I mean what can we do?ScenesJoey: There you go! That's the spirit I'm looking for! What can we do? Huh? All right who's first? Huh? Ross?ScenesRoss: Well I'm thinking that Chandler's our friend and Janice makes him happy, so I say we just all be adult about it and accept her.ScenesJoey: Yeah, we'll call that Plan B. All right?

rows.Scenes: Ross's bedroom, Ross is working and Rachel is reading a book in bed]
rows.Content: Rachel: (she leans over and kisses him on the cheek) Honey, I was wondering....ScenesRoss: Hmm?ScenesRachel: Do you still have that, um, Navy uniform?ScenesRoss: Nooo, I had to return it to the costume place.ScenesRachel: Hmm.ScenesRoss: I think I have an old band uniform from high school.ScenesRachel: You remember not having sex in high school, right?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Well honey, what about you?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I mean do you have any fun, you know, fantasy type things?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: Come on you gotta have one!ScenesRoss: Nope.ScenesRachel: Ross, you know what...ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: ...if you tell me, I might do it.ScenesRoss: Okay, umm. Did you ever see, um, Return Of The Jedi?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Do you remember the scene with, um, Jabba the Hut? Well Jabba had as, as his prisoner, um, Princess Leia.ScenesRachel: Oooh!ScenesRoss: Princess Leia, was wearing this, um, gold bikini thing. It was pretty cool.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Phoebe and Rachel are there]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Yeah, oh, Princess Leia and the gold bikini, every guy our age loved that.ScenesRachel: Really!ScenesPhoebe: Um, um. It's huge. Yeah, that's the moment, when-when, you know she stopped being a princess, and became, like, a woman, you know.ScenesRachel: Did you ever do the-the Leia thing?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, um-mm. Oh!ScenesRachel: Really! That-that great huh?ScenesPhoebe: No it's just that I got this new pager and I have it on vibrate. See ya!ScenesRoss: (entering with Monica in tow) Hey!ScenesRachel: Hi you guys!ScenesRoss: Look who I found standing outside of the Szechwan Dragon staring at a parking meter.ScenesRachel: Mon. Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRachel: Why aren't you at work?ScenesMonica: Oh, they-they sent me home.ScenesRachel: Why?ScenesMonica: Because I don't work at the Szechwan Dragon.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: You really, really need to get some sleep, honey.ScenesMonica: I know I do.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesRoss: Guess what?ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: They published my paper.ScenesRachel: Oh, really, let me see, let me see.ScenesPhoebe: Rach, look! (she holds two buns up to her ears to make her hair look like the Princess Leia 'do.) Oh, hi! Where is my strong Ross Skywalker to come rescue me. (Ross stands up horrified) There he is.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Wheel of Fortune, the puzzle is showing _oun_ Rush_ore.]
rows.Content: [Chandler enters]ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: Wheel!ScenesChandler: Of!ScenesJoey: Fortune! This guy is so stupid. (yelling) It's Count Rushmore!!ScenesChandler: You know, you should really go on this show. All right, listen, I got three tickets to the Rangers tonight. What'd ya' say?ScenesJoey: I say, 'I am there!' Cool! Aw, is Ross going to?ScenesChandler: No, Janice.ScenesJoey: Jan-ice. 'Cause I, just, I feel bad for Ross, you know, we-we always go together, we're like the three hocke-teers.ScenesChandler: You know, I may be way out on a limb here, but do you, do you, have a problem with Janice?ScenesJoey: No, Yeeees. God, how do I say this. (walks into the kitchen, Chandler follows closely, he turns around and gets startled). Oh, hi, you know that girl from the Greek restaurant with the hair (holds his hands up to signify she has big hair)?ScenesChandler: Ooh, that girl that I hate, eww, drives me crazy, eww, eww, oh!ScenesJoey: Look, I don't hate Janice, she's-she's just a lot to take, you know.ScenesChandler: Well, there you go.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey. Come on man, don't look at me like that, she used to drive you nuts before too, remember?ScenesChandler: Well, I'm crazy about her now. I think this could be the real thing. Capital 'R'! Capital 'T'! (Joey stares at him) Don't worry, those are the right letters.ScenesJoey: Look, what do you want me to say?ScenesChandler: I want you to say that you like her!ScenesJoey: I can't. It's like this chemical thing, you know. Every time she starts laughing, I just wanna (grimaces and tenses up) pull my arm off just so that I can have something to throw at her.ScenesChandler: Thanks for trying. (grabs the ticket and starts to leave) Oh, and by the way there is no Count Rushmore!ScenesJoey: Yeah, then-then who's the guy that painted the faces on the mountain? (Chandler gives him a look like 'You stupid idiot!')ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel and Ross are entering]
rows.Content: Ross: How could you have told her?ScenesRachel: Ross, I didn't think it would that big of a deal.ScenesRoss: Oh, she didn't think it would be that big of deal.ScenesRachel: Okay, who are you talking to when you do that?ScenesRoss: Look, that was supposed to be like a private, personal thing between us.ScenesRachel: Okay, Ross, Phoebe is my girlfriend, okay, we tell each other everything. You know, I mean, come on, guys do the same thing, I mean, what about all that locker room stuff.ScenesRoss: That's different, okay. That's like, uh 'Who dated a stripper?' or 'Who did it on the back of the Staton Island Ferry?'.ScenesRachel: Were both of those Joey?ScenesRoss: Yeah. Look, you don't, you don't talk about like, you know, your girlfriend and the intimate stuff you, you do with her.ScenesRachel: Not even with your best friend.ScenesRoss: Noo!ScenesRachel: That is so sad. Your missing out on so much, Ross. I mean, the bonding and the sharing, you know. And-and knowing that someone else is going through the same thing you are.ScenesRoss: Hmph. So what you, you tell each other everything?ScenesRachel: Pretty much.ScenesRoss: Did you talk about the night of five times? Do you tell people about the night of five times?ScenesRachel: Uh, honey, yeah that was with Carol.ScenesRoss: I know, but it's still worth mentioning, I think.

rows.Scenes: Monica's bedroom, Phoebe is trying to relax her.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: ( in a soothing voice) Relax every muscle in your body. Listen to the plinky-plunky music. Okay, now close you eyes, and think of a happy place. Okay, tell me your happy place.ScenesMonica: Richard's living room, drinking wine.ScenesPhoebe: All right. No, no, no, not a Richard thing, just put down the glass. And get out!ScenesMonica: I'm sorry, but that's my happy place.ScenesPhoebe: Well, okay, fine, use my happy place. Okay, I'm just gonna, I have to ask that you don't move anything.ScenesMonica: All right, I'll try not to.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, all right, so, your in a meadow, millions of stars in the sky....ScenesMonica: Do you think breaking up with him was a huge mistake?ScenesPhoebe: All right, there are no questions in the happy place.
