Y'know I’m just gonna go to bed, I think the fumes are giving me a headache.ScenesFrank: (starts laughing) Yeah!ScenesPhoebe: G’night, bro.ScenesFrank: G’night.ScenesPhoebe: Here. (gives him a fire extinguisher) Y'know, just in case.ScenesFrank: Oh, excellent. (starts to melt the fire extinguisher’s hose.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel’s, Phoebe is eating breakfast with Monica while Frank is playing with num-chucks on the balcony]
rows.Content: Monica: What kind of karate is that?ScenesPhoebe: No kind. He just makes it up.ScenesMonica: So how’s it going with you guys?ScenesPhoebe: So far, it kinda blows. I don’t know, I just thought y'know that he’d feel more like a brother y'know, like you and Ross, just like close and connected and....ScenesMonica: Oh honey, we’re close now but you-you wouldn’t believe the years of-of nugies, and wedgies, and flying wedgies, and atomic wedgies, and....(Phoebe shakes her head like she doesn’t understand) That’s where the waistband actually goes over your head.ScenesPhoebe: Ah!!ScenesMonica: Oh, we used to drive each other crazy playing the shadow game.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?ScenesMonica: Oh, how do you play the shadow game?ScenesPhoebe: I just asked you.ScenesMonica: I just asked you.ScenesPhoebe: I don’t have time for this.ScenesMonica: No, that is what the game is.ScenesPhoebe: Which you just gave up really quickly.ScenesChandler: (entering) Have you seen Joey?ScenesMonica: What’s the matter?ScenesChandler: Oh, just this! (turns around and has a paint lid stuck to the back of his pants.) Y’know what it’s my fault really, because the couch is usually where we keep the varnish.ScenesJoey: (yelling from bathroom) Hey, does somebody wanna hand me one of those tiles.ScenesChandler: What’s going on?ScenesMonica: He’s retiling my floor. (they both run to the bathroom)ScenesChandler: Yo!! Spackel boy! Get up!ScenesMonica: Ah-ah-ah, now you started this, you will finish it.ScenesChandler: He started mine first!ScenesPhoebe: Build the unit Cinderelly, lay the tile Cinderelly.

rows.Scenes: Phoebe’s, Phoebe and Frank are watching TV.]
rows.Content: Frank: Whoa! Big octopus.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. (phone rings and Phoebe answers it) ‘Hello. (listens) Oh my God, I totally forgot! (listens) Well can’t someone else do it. (listens) But, I have company. (listens) Yeah, no look, that’s all right I’ll come in.’ (hangs up phone) Um, Frank, I’m really sorry but I have to go to work. It’s-it’s one of my regulars and he’s insisting that I do ‘um.ScenesFrank: Hey, what kind of work do you do?ScenesPhoebe: Oh! I’m a masseuse. I give people massages and stuff.ScenesFrank: You-you work at one of those massage parlors?ScenesPhoebe: Well, y'know we don’t call it that, but yeah!ScenesFrank: (starts laughing) Wow! That’s wild! No, I had no idea.ScenesPhoebe: All righty. I’ll be back in-in a little bit. Unless you wanna come with me?ScenesFrank: You mean like watch?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, you can get one yourself. It’ll be on the house! Y'know what are big sisters for?ScenesFrank: Well, I don’t think this, y'know.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, I wouldn’t do you myself, I mean that would be weird. Yeah, no, I’ll get one of the other girls to do it. Oh, this will be so much fun! Hey! Are you excited?ScenesFrank: Yeah! Hey, do Monica and Rachel work there?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel’s bathroom, Joey and Monica are admiring the new floor.]
rows.Content: Monica: It’s beautiful! It’s like the first bathroom floor there ever was. (Chandler tries to go to the bathroom) Whoa! Are you going in there for?ScenesChandler: What, like a number?ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hi! Bye! (runs to the bathroom)ScenesRoss: Okay, I’m done with my choices, these are final. (holds up a little card)ScenesRachel: Well, it’s about time.ScenesJoey: Ooh, very official.ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, well y'know Chandler printed it up on his computer.ScenesMonica: And who laminated it?ScenesRoss: That would be me.ScenesRachel: All right let me see. (grabs the card) Uma Thurman, Winona Ryder, Elizabeth Hurely, Michelle Pfieffer, and Dorothy Hammel?ScenesRoss: Hey, it’s my list.ScenesRachel: Okay honey, you do realize she only spins like that on ice.

rows.Scenes: Healing Hands Inc. (Phoebe’s work), Frank is being ushered in, by the arm, to the room Phoebe is in by another girl.]
rows.Content: Frank: Ow!-Ow!-Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Ow! Y'know, ow!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!-Hey! What’s going on?ScenesFrank: She broke my arm.ScenesGirl: He touched my fanny.ScenesFrank: No, she touched mine first!ScenesGirl: That’s my job!ScenesFrank: So wait, what’s the deal here, I can have sex with you, but I can’t touch you?ScenesPhoebe and Girl: Ewww!!!ScenesPhoebe: You can’t have sex with her!ScenesGirl: What’d you think I was, a hooker?ScenesFrank: No, your a masseuse, it’s cool, I’m not a cop.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, Jasmine, can you, can you ask Mr. Whiffler if he can wait for like five minutes.ScenesJasmine: Fine. (starts to leave, and points at Frank) I don’t like you!! (leaves)ScenesPhoebe: (turns around and hits Frank) So that’s what you thought I did!! God! That’s not what I do!ScenesFrank: Wait that’s-that’s, what that’s not what you do?ScenesPhoebe: Nooo! Why would you think that?ScenesFrank: I don’t know, I mean, y'know, this is the city y'know, I just, I mean, I don’t know.ScenesPhoebe: Whatever, it’s the perfect end to the perfect weekend anyways.ScenesFrank: Oh, wait, no your right, no it was perfect and I can’t believe that I screwed it up so bad.ScenesPhoebe: You really thought it was perfect?ScenesFrank: Well, no, maybe-maybe it wasn’t perfect, but y'know it was pretty cool, y'know, ‘cause we had all those great talks y'know.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, um, which ones in particular were great for you?ScenesFrank: Well y'know about the tongue thing, y'know, and how I told you about my likes and my dislikes...ScenesPhoebe: I don’t....ScenesFrank: How-how I like to melt stuff, and how I dislike stuff that doesn’t melt.ScenesPhoebe: Right, okay, um-mm.ScenesFrank: Yeah, y'know I feel like I can really talk to you ‘cause y'know you’re my sister, y'know.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I guess I do, yeah.ScenesFrank: Then I go feel your friend up and make you mad at me.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I-I wasn’t hopping mad, y'know.ScenesFrank: You hopped a little bit. Yeah, I really sorry.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. All right, this is my favourite part of the weekend, right now, this.ScenesFrank: This?ScenesPhoebe: Uh-huh.ScenesFrank: Oh come on we went, we went to Time Square, we found ninja stars, I almost got arm broken by a hooker...ScenesPhoebe: She wasn’t a hooker.ScenesFrank: Well, when I tell my friends about her she will be.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey’s, everyone is there, helping to lift the entertainment center into place]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, on three. One....Two....ScenesJoey: Why don’t we just go on two.ScenesChandler: Why two?ScenesJoey: Because it’s faster.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I coulda counted to three like four times without all this ‘two’ talk.ScenesRachel: Oh!ScenesJoey: All right, but in the future...ScenesRoss: Okay!! Okay!!ScenesRachel: Come on!ScenesRoss: Heavy thing, not getting lighter!ScenesChandler: Okay, one...two...ScenesJoey: So we are going on two?ScenesAll: All right!! (they lift it into place, however there is one small problem, the unit is so long that it blocks some of both of their bedroom doors.)ScenesChandler: Oh, good job Joe.ScenesJoey: Wow, it’s big!ScenesChandler: Yeah-yeah, so big that it actually makes our doors look smaller!ScenesJoey: Maybe, my ruler’s wrong.ScenesPhoebe: Maybe all the rulers are wrong.ScenesJoey: Look it’s not that bad. So what, it blocks a little of your door, a little of my door.ScenesChandler: Yeah, y'know what I got a better idea. How-how ‘bout it blocks none of mine door and a lot of yours? (throws his shoulder into the center to try and move it, but it doesn’t move.)ScenesJoey: Yeah, listen, before I forget that side is still wet.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is serving some guy coffee.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay sir, um-mm, let see if I got this right. Ah, so this is a half-caf, double tall, easy hazel nut, non-fat, no foam, with whip, extra hot latte, right? (the guy nods) Okay, great. (she starts to walk away and under her breath) You freak.Scenes(Isabella Rosselini enters)ScenesRoss: (to Gunther) Thank you.ScenesIsabella: (to Gunther) Um, coffee to go, please.Scenes(Ross recognises her and goes over to the couch, mouthing ‘Oh my God’ScenesRoss: Isabella Rosselini. (points to her)ScenesMonica: Are you serious? (they all look) Oh my God.ScenesRoss: Damn! I can’t believe I took her off my list.ScenesMonica: Why? ‘Cause otherwise you’d go for it?ScenesRoss: Yeah, maybe.ScenesRachel: Oh-oh, you lie.ScenesRoss: What you don’t think I’d go up to her?ScenesRachel: Ross, it took you ten years to finally admit you liked me.ScenesRoss: Yeah, well missy, you better be glad that list is laminated.ScenesRachel: You know what honey, you go ahead, we’ll call her an alternate.ScenesRoss: Okay, hold my crawler.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: Rach, are you really gonna let him do this?ScenesRachel: Honey, he’s about to go hit on Isabella Rosselini. I’m just sorry we don’t got popcorn.ScenesRoss: (to Isabella) Hi! Hi, I’m Ross, you don’t know me, but I’m a big, big fan of yours. I mean, Blue Velvet, woo-oo hoo! Um, I was wondering if I could um, maybe buy you a cup of coffee? (Gunther hands her change) Or maybe reimburse you for that one?ScenesIsabella: Aren’t you with that girl over there? (points at Rachel, who waves back)ScenesRoss: Well, yeah, kinda. Um, but that’s okay, see we have an understanding, um, see we each have this list of five famous people, (gets his out) so I’m allowed to sleep with you. No, no, no, it’s flattery.ScenesIsabella: I’m sorry. (starts to leave)ScenesRoss: Oh no, no, no, wait, wait, Isabella. Don’t, don’t just dismiss this so fast. I mean this is a once in a lifetime opportunity...ScenesIsabella: Yeah, for you. Is that the list?ScenesRoss: Um, yeah.ScenesIsabella: May I see it?ScenesRoss: Um, no.ScenesIsabella: Come on! (grabs the list)ScenesRoss: But, okay.ScenesIsabella: (reading it) I’m not on the list!ScenesRoss: Um, see, but that’s not the final draft.ScenesIsabella: It’s laminated!ScenesRoss: Yeah, um, okay see, you were, you were on the list but my friend, Chandler (Chandler waves) brought up the very good point that you are international, so I bumped you for Wynona Rider, local.ScenesIsabella: Y'know it’s ironic...ScenesRoss: What?ScenesIsabella: ...because I have a list of five goofy coffee house guys and yesterday I bumped you for that guy over there. (points at a guy and leaves)ScenesRoss: (to the rest of the gang) We’re just gonna be friends.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey’s, they are admiring the entertainment center]
rows.Content: Joey: Y'know what?ScenesChandler: Umm?ScenesJoey: I bet ‘ya ya I could fit in there. (points to a hole in the center)ScenesChandler: I’ve got five bucks says you can’t.ScenesJoey: Get out your checkbook, mister.ScenesChandler: Oh, I think I have the cash.Scenes(Joey successfully enters the entertainment center, and Chandler closes the door on Joey.)ScenesJoey: You are dogged man! I totally fit!ScenesChandler: Yeah, you got me. (picks up a 2x4 and puts it through the handles so that the doors won’t open) I’m out five big ones! (puts the money in the crack between the door and frame) Here you go.ScenesJoey: Thank you. Cha-ching! (Chandler starts to leave) Oh, well hello Mr. Lincoln. Better luck next time buddy. (Chandler leaves and closes the door) And the drinks are on me!ScenesEndScenesThe One With The FlashbackScenesWritten by: Marta Kauffman & David CraneScenesTranscribed by: Eric AasenScenes{Transcriber's Note: Rachel has two friends that are not named, so I referred to them as Friend No. 1 and Friend No. 2.}

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the whole gang is there including Janice.]
rows.Content: Janice: Janice has a question. Who of the six of you has sleep with the six of you?ScenesPhoebe: Wow, it’s like a dirty math problem.ScenesRoss: I’m sorry the answer there would be...none of us.ScenesJanice: Come on over the years none of you ever y'know, got drunk and stupid.ScenesJoey: Well, that’s really a different question.ScenesJanice: I’m sorry I find it hard to believe that a group of people who spends as much time together as you guys do has never bumped uglies.ScenesJoey: Well, there was that one time that Monica and Rachel got together.ScenesMonica and Rachel: What?!!ScenesRachel: Excuse me, there was no time!ScenesJoey: Okay, but let’s say there was. How might that go?ScenesJanice: Okay, okay, well then answer me this. Has any of you ever.... almost?ScenesRachel: Does anybody need more coffee?ScenesRoss: Yeah, I’ll take some.ScenesJoey: Hey, there’s a dog out there!ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe’s, three years earlier, Phoebe, Monica, and Ross are there]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Oh, that is so unfortunate.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesPhoebe: Cute naked guy is really starting to put on weight.ScenesMonica: (entering from bedroom) Okay, I’ll be back in just a minute. Oh, Phoebe I’m sorry that I left lipstick marks on the phone.ScenesPhoebe: You didn’t leave lipstick marks on the phone.ScenesMonica: Oh, then it must’ve been you. Bye. (leaves)ScenesPhoebe: (angrily) Bye-bye! (to Ross) That’s why I moved out.ScenesRoss: Hey, y'know while we’re on that, when are you gonna tell my sister that you don’t live here anymore.ScenesPhoebe: I think on some levels she already knows.ScenesRoss: Phoebe, she doesn’t know that you sneak out every night, she doesn’t know that you sneak back every morning, and she doesn’t know that you’ve been living with your Grandmother’s for a week now.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well maybe not on those levels.ScenesChandler: (entering, with a goatee) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey.ScenesChandler: I’m never gonna find a roommate, ever.ScenesPhoebe: Why, nobody good?ScenesChandler: Well let’s see, there was the guy with the ferrets, that’s plural. The spitter. Oh-ho, and yes, the guy that enjoyed my name so much he felt the need to make a little noise every time he said it. Nice to meet you, Chandler Bing Bing! Great apartment Chandler Bing, Bing!ScenesRoss: So how many more do you have tomorrow?ScenesChandler: Two. This photographer, who seemed really dull. And this actor guy, who I’m not sure about, because when he called and I answered the phone ‘Chandler Bing,’ he said ‘Whoa-whoa, short message.’ScenesMonica: (entering) Ross (who has his foot on the coffee table), foot on the floor or come over no more!ScenesRoss: (to Phoebe) Sure, your dresser is missing but this she notices.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: I have to go. Yeah, Carol should be home by now, soo...ScenesChandler: Umm, how’s it going with you guys?ScenesRoss: Oh, better, actually. Y'know I-I-I think I finally figured out why we were having so much trouble lately.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, really?ScenesRoss: Yeah, y'know how I have you guys, well she doesn’t really have any close friends that are just hers, but last week she meet this woman at the gym, Susan something, and they really hit it off, and I-I-I think it’s gonna make a difference

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s, Chandler is interviewing a potential roommate.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Soo, ah, Eric, what kind of photography do ya do?ScenesEric: Oh, mostly fashion, so there may be models here from time to time, I hope that’s cool.ScenesChandler: Yes, that is cool. Because I have models here y'know......never.ScenesEric: Oh, yeah, during the summer, I spend most weekends at my sister’s beach house, which you are welcome to use by the way. Although, I should probably tell you, she’s a porn star. (Chandler breaks his pencil in half)ScenesChandler: Well, listen I ah, still have one more person to ah meet, but unless it turns out to be your sister, I think you’re chances are pretty good. (Eric offers to shake hands) All right. (Chandler hugs him.)

rows.Scenes: Chandler’s, Chandler is interviewing Joey.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (running around the apartment pointing out things) Bedroom. Bathroom. Living room. This right here is the kitchen, and thanks for coming by, (opens door) Bye-bye.ScenesJoey: Don’t you ah, don’t you wanna ask me any questions?ScenesChandler: Sure. Ummm. What’s up?ScenesJoey: Well, ah, I’m an actor. I’m fairly neat. I ah, I got my own TV. Oh, and don’t worry I’m totally okay with the gay thing.ScenesChandler: What gay thing?ScenesJoey: Ah, y'know just in general people being gay, thing. I’m totally cool with that.

rows.Scenes: the hallway, Monica is coming up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well okay Jerry, thanks for stopping by.Scenes(Joey is leaving and notices Monica, as Monica notices him)ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hey!Scenes(Joey leaves and Monica mouths to Chandler ‘Oh my God!’)

rows.Scenes: A bar, Chandler is entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey, Mon.ScenesMonica: Hey-hey-hey. You wanna hear something that sucks.ScenesChandler: Do I ever.ScenesMonica: Chris says they’re closing down the bar.ScenesChandler: No way!ScenesMonica: Yeah, apparently they’re turning it into some kinda coffee place.ScenesChandler: Just coffee! Where are we gonna hang out now?ScenesMonica: Got me.ScenesChandler: (to bartender) Can I get a beer.ScenesMonica: Hey, did you pick a roommate?ScenesChandler: You betcha!ScenesMonica: Is it the Italian guy?ScenesChandler: Um-mm, yeah right!ScenesMonica: He’s so cute.ScenesChandler: Oh yes, and that’s what I want a roommate that I can walk around with and be referred to as the funny one.ScenesMonica: Oh look, the pool table’s free. Rack ‘em up. I’ll be back in just a minute. Get ready for me to whip your butt.ScenesChandler: Okay, but after that, we’re shootin’ some pool.ScenesRachel: (sitting at a table with some of her friends) (to waitress) Oh, um, no, no, no, no excuse me, hello. Hi. My friend ordered an onion, not an olive, and uh I ordered a rum and Diet Coke, which I don’t think this is.ScenesWaitress: I am so sorry.ScenesRachel: That’s all right. (to her friends) I mean hard is it to get a couple drinks right, huh?ScenesFriend No. 1: Well, I would like to propose a toast to the woman, who in one year from today, become Mrs. Dr. Barry Farber DDSScenesRachel: Ummm, I think it’s time to see the ring again. (holds her hand out and they all scream)ScenesFriend No. 2: Oh, isn’t it exciting, I mean it’s like having a boyfriend for life.ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know.ScenesFriend No. 1: What?ScenesRachel: Oh, I don’t know. Well maybe it’s just the idea of Barry for the rest of my life. I don’t know I think I feel like I need to have one last fling, y'know, just to sorta get it out of my system. (Chandler is listening in very intensely)ScenesFriend No. 1: Rachel stop!ScenesFriend No. 2: You’re so bad!ScenesRachel: I’m serious, I really, I think I need just to have some...meaningless, sex y'know, with the next guy that I see.Scenes(Chandler throws the cue ball under there table.)ScenesChandler: Excuse, I seem to have dropped my ball.ScenesRachel: Yeah, so?ScenesChandler: (picks it up) And now I’ve picked it up again. (walks over to Monica.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, I went to high school with her. (to Rachel) Rachel! Hi!ScenesRachel: Monica! Look! Hi! What do ya think? (shows her, her ring)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, you can’t even see where the Titanic hit it.ScenesRachel: Yes, his name is Barry, he’s a doctor, thank you very much.ScenesMonica: Awww, just like you always wanted. CongratulationsScenesRachel: Thank you. So how-how ‘bout you, are-are you seeing anybody?ScenesMonica: Aww, not right now.ScenesRachel: Oh, but that’s okay.ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesRachel: Yeah.Scenes(An awkward silence)ScenesMonica: So, I’ll get-get back to my friend.ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, sure, sure, sure, sure. (points at Chandler, who holds up the cue ball as a ‘Remember me?’ thing) Listen, can we please have lunch the next time I’m in the city?ScenesMonica: Oh, that’d be great.ScenesRachel: Okay!ScenesMonica: Thanks.ScenesRachel: Bye!ScenesMonica: Bye! (to Chandler) Ten bucks says, I never see that woman again in my life.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe’s, Ross is on the phone, as Phoebe is walking by carrying a lamp.]
rows.Content: Ross: No real-, honey, really it’s fine, just g-go with Susan. Really, I, no, I think girls night out is a great idea. Okay, okay, byeScenesPhoebe: So what are they doing?ScenesRoss: I don’t know, something girlie.ScenesPhoebe: (to Monica, who’s entering) Hey, you’re early.ScenesMonica: What are you doing with the lamp?ScenesPhoebe: I’m just taking it to be re-wired.ScenesMonica: Oh, well don’t take it to the same place you took the stereo, ‘cause they’ve had that thing for over a week.Scenes(There is a knock on the door, Phoebe answers it, its Mr. Heckles)ScenesPhoebe: No, no, Mr. Heckles no one is making any noise up here.ScenesMr. Heckles: You’re disturbing my oboe practice.ScenesPhoebe: You don’t play the oboe!ScenesMr. Heckles: I could play the oboe!ScenesPhoebe: Then I’m gonna have to ask you to keep it down. (slams the door in his face.)Scenes(in the hallway, Eric is moving in)ScenesMr. Heckles: (to Eric) Who are you?ScenesEric: Hi, I’m Eric, I’m gonna be Chandler’s new roommate.ScenesMr. Heckles: I’m Chandler’s new roommate.ScenesEric: I-I-I don’t think so.ScenesMr. Heckles: I could be Chandler’s new roommate.ScenesEric: But, he told me over the phone.ScenesMr. Heckles: He told me in person.ScenesEric: That’s weird.ScenesMr. Heckles: Well, I’m going to go into my new apartment now. (goes over to the door and opens it) Ehh! (Eric leaves)Scenes(inside Chandler’s apartment, Chandler is coming in from his bedroom, sees Mr. Heckles, and screams.)

rows.Scenes: the hallway, Joey is moving in, Monica is leaving.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hi, again.ScenesJoey: Hey! (goes into the apartment)ScenesChandler: (leaving to go to work) Hey!ScenesMonica: Thank you soo, much.ScenesChandler: Oh, don’t thank me, thank the jerk that never showed up. Okay, I gotta get to get to work.Scenes(Joey comes back into the hallway and starts to pick up a heavy box)ScenesMonica: You want some help with that?ScenesJoey: Oh, no thanks, I got it. (picks it up) No I don’t!ScenesMonica: Whoa! Are you okay?ScenesJoey: Whew! Stood up to fast, got a little head rush.ScenesMonica: It’s the heat. (has her hand on his chest, and then pulls it away) And-and the humidity.ScenesJoey: That’s a uh, that’s a tough combination.ScenesMonica: Do you wanna come in for some lemonade?ScenesJoey: Like you wouldn’t believe. (they go into the apartment) Wow! This is a great place.ScenesMonica: Thank you. Just make yourself comfortable.ScenesJoey: Gotcha.ScenesMonica: This place is really my Grandmother’s. (Joey starts to take off all of his clothes, while Monica gets the glasses and pours the lemonade.) I got it from her when she moved to Florida, otherwise I could never afford a place like this. So if the landlord ever asks, I’m 87 year old woman, who’s afraid of her VCR. So are you thirsty?ScenesJoey: Oh, you bet I am!ScenesMonica: (turning around) Okay, here’s your penis!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: Oh my God!!! What are you doing?!!ScenesJoey: You said, you wanna come in for some lemonade?ScenesMonica: So?!ScenesJoey: Whoa, ah!! We’re you just gonna give me some lemonade?ScenesMonica: Yeah huh!! Cover yourself up!ScenesJoey: Oh right, right.ScenesMonica: I don’t believe this! When someone asks you in for lemonade, and to you that means they wanna have sex?ScenesJoey: Well usually...yeah! Well, not just lemonade, iced tea, sometimes juice. Well, sorry, I just, I thought you liked me. I’m such a jerk.ScenesMonica: It’s okay. I suppose it could happen to anyone, not anyone I know, but... By the way I can still see it.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Phoebe’s, Monica is vacuuming.]
rows.Content: Monica: Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Huh?ScenesMonica: Where’s your bed?ScenesPhoebe: It’s not in the apartment? (Monica gives a ‘Come on’ look) Oh no. I can’t believe this is happening again.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Okay, enough with the third degree! I-I’ve, I don’t live here anymore.ScenesMonica: What are you talking about?ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, I-I-I-I don’t live here anymore. I-I didn’t know how to tell you, but y'know everybody else knows!ScenesMonica: Everybody knows!ScenesPhoebe: That was supposed to be a good thing, I forget why. Just listen, Monica, I, do you know, okay, do you know, I couldn’t sleep for like a month because I got like a dot of ink on one of the sofa cushions.ScenesMonica: Well, you-you coulda just turned the cushion over.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I would’ve except I had a big spaghetti stain on the other side.ScenesMonica: What?!?!ScenesPhoebe: Okay, this is what I’m talking about, this. I-I need to live in a land where people can spill.ScenesMonica: You can spill. In the sink.ScenesPhoebe: Aw, honey it’s not your fault, y'know this is who you are, and I love you, and I want us to be friends, and if I keep living here I don’t see that happening.ScenesMonica: I love you, too.ScenesPhoebe: Aww, good. (they hug) What?ScenesMonica: What? I’m just said.ScenesPhoebe: No you’re not, you’re wondering which cushion it is.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, (now) Joey is watching Baywatch, as Chandler enters from his bedroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So ah, whatcha watching?ScenesJoey: Baywatch.ScenesChandler: What’s it about?ScenesJoey: Lifeguards.ScenesChandler: Well, it sounds kinda stupid... (looks at the TV) Who’s she?ScenesJoey: Nicole Eggert. You'll like her.Scenes(Baywatch goes into one of those running scenes.)ScenesChandler: Wow! Look at them run.ScenesJoey: They do that a lot. Hey, you want a beer?ScenesChandler: Yeah, I’ll go get one.ScenesJoey: No, no, no, don’t get up, I got a cooler right here.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s, Monica is coming out of the bathroom wearing nothing but a towel, as Chandler is entering.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well, hello!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesChandler: Do you have any beers? We’re out of beers.ScenesMonica: (all depressed) Help yourself.ScenesChandler: You okay?ScenesMonica: Phoebe moved out.ScenesChandler: Right.ScenesMonica: I don’t understand, I mean am I so hard to live, is this why I don’t have a boyfriend?ScenesChandler: Noo!! You don’t have a boyfriend because....I don’t, I don’t know why you don’t have a boyfriend. You should have a boyfriend.ScenesMonica: Well, I think so.ScenesChandler: Oh-ho, come here. (goes and hugs her) Listen, you are one of my favourite people and the most beautiful woman I’ve ever known in real life.

rows.Scenes: the bar, Ross is entering, Phoebe is at the bar, they are the only two in the place.]
rows.Content: Ross: (all depressed) Hi. Where is everybody?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s already closed, Chris gave me the keys to lock up-what is wrong?ScenesRoss: My marriage, I think my marriage is um, is kinda over.ScenesPhoebe: Oh no! Why?ScenesRoss: ‘Cause Carol’s a lesbian. (Phoebe is shocked) And, and I’m not one. And apparently it’s not a mix and match situation.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! I don’t believe it! Oh, you poor bunny.ScenesRoss: (sets out a bunch of shot glasses and starts to poor himself a drink, many drinks) I’m an idiot. I mean shoulda seen it, I mean Carol and I’d be out and she’d, she’d see some beautiful woman, and, and she’d be Ross y'know look at her, and I’d think, God, my wife is cool!ScenesPhoebe: Aw! Hey, do you think that Susan person is her lover?ScenesRoss: Well, now I do!!ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry.ScenesRoss: Seven years. I mean we’ve been together seven years, she’s the only woman who’s ever loved me, and the only woman I’ve-I’ve ever....ScenesPhoebe: Aw, God Ross. Oh.(goes over and hugs him)

rows.Scenes: Monica’s, Chandler and Monica are still hugging each other.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Umm, this is nice.ScenesMonica: I know, it is isn’t it?ScenesChandler: No, I mean it, this feels really good. Is it a hundred percent cotton?ScenesMonica: Yeah! And I got it on sale, too.ScenesChandler: Anyway, I should go, one of the lifeguards was just about to dismantle a nuclear device.ScenesMonica: Well, if you wanna get a drink later we can.ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, that sounds great. (starts to leave) Oh, and listen, it’s, it’s gonna be....ScenesMonica: I know. Thanks. (Chandler leaves)

rows.Scenes: the bar, Phoebe is still hugging Ross.]
rows.Content: Ross: Maybe this would’ve happened if I’d been more nurturing, or I’d paid more attention, or I... had a uterus. I can’t believe this!ScenesPhoebe: I know no, no, y'know you don’t deserve this, you don’t Ross. You’re, you’re really, you’re so good. (kisses him on the cheek)ScenesRoss: Thanks.ScenesPhoebe: And you’re so sweet. (kisses him on the other cheek) And you’re kind (kisses him on the lips)ScenesRoss: Thanks. (kisses her on the lips)Scenes(They pause, and they the start kissing passionately, and taking off each others clothes, and they start to lie down on the pool table.)ScenesRoss: Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait.ScenesPhoebe: Huh?Scenes(Ross tries to clear off the pool table by knocking the balls to the other end of the table, but they all bounce back, and he frantically starts to throw them into the pockets.)ScenesPhoebe: Okay, it’s okay.Scenes(Phoebe jumps on to the table and lays down, Ross follows her and hits his head on the light hanging over the pool table.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (they start kissing again)ScenesRoss: Wait, wait, wait.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRoss: My foot is stuck in the pocket.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRoss: No, I can’t get it out.ScenesPhoebe: Well, that’s not something a girl wants to hear.ScenesRoss: No, come on don’t start. (they start kissing again) Ouch!ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesRoss: Stupid balls are in the way. (holds up two balls)Scenes(They both look at each other and start laughing (Lisa almost lost it there), and sit up. Ross hits his head on the lamp again.)ScenesRoss: Oh well. It probably would’ve been the most constructive solution.ScenesPhoebe: You have chalk on your face.ScenesRoss: Huh? (the rest of the gang enters)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, Ross you’re right, I don’t know why I always thought this was real grass.ScenesMonica: Hey, are you okay?ScenesRoss: My wife’s a lesbian.ScenesJoey: Cool!!ScenesChandler: Ross-Joey, Joey-Ross. (they shake hands)ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: the bar, Chandler is playing pool, as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I can’t believe you came back.ScenesRachel: Don’t say anything. I don’t wanna speak, I don’t wanna think. I just want you to take me and kiss me and make love to me right here, right now.Scenes(She hits the jukebox Fonzy style, and It’s That Time of Season starts to play, as they start to kiss.)ScenesFriend No. 2: Rachel! Rachel! (stirs Rachel from her dream, she’s in her car driving back from the city)ScenesRachel: What?ScenesFriend No. 2: You missed the exit!ScenesRachel: Oh, sorry.ScenesFriend No. 1: My God, what were you thinking about?ScenesRachel: Um, (shyly) Barry.ScenesHer Friends: Awwww!!ScenesEndScenesThe One With the Race Car BedScenesWritten by: Seth KurlandScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the whole gang is there, Ross is telling a story about what happened at work and the rest of the gang are thinking to themselves, denoted by italics.]
rows.Content: Ross: So I told Carl, ‘Nobody, no matter how famous their parents are, nobody is allowed to climb on the dinosaur.’ But of course this went in one ear and out.....ScenesRachel: I love how he cares so much about stuff. If I squint I can pretend he’s Alan Alda.ScenesMonica: Oh good, another dinosaur story. When are those gonna become extinct?ScenesChandler: If I was a superhero who could fly and be invisible, that would be the best.ScenesGunther: What does Rachel see in this guy? I love Rachel. I wish she was my wife.Scenes(Joey is singing in his head.)ScenesPhoebe: Who’s singing?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang is there including Janice, they’re watching Happy Days.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey. When you guys were kids and you played Happy Days, who were you? I was always Richie.ScenesMonica: I was always Joanne.ScenesJoey: Question. Was ah, ‘Egg the Gellers!’ the war cry of your neighbourhood?Scenes(A commercial for the Mattress King, Janice’s ex-husband, comes on TV.)ScenesPhoebe: Ewww! Oh! It’s the Mattress King!ScenesJoey: Booo!!ScenesChandler: (to Janice) Don’t look honey. Change the channel! Change the channel!ScenesJanice: Wait! Wait! I wanna see this. After I divorce him, half of that kingdom is gonna be mine.ScenesMatress King: (on TV) ‘Despair fills the mattress showroom. My kingdom is suddenly without a queen. I’m so depressed I’m going to slash... my prices!! Check it out! Four ninety-nine for a pillow top queen set! I’m going medieval on prices!ScenesChandler: What a wank!ScenesJanice: Oh, I cannot believe he’s using our divorce to sell mattresses.ScenesMonica: I know! And four ninety-nine for a pillow top queen set, who cares about the divorce, those babies will sell themselves. (they all stare at her) And I’m appalled for you by the way.ScenesMatress King: (on TV) I’m close. I’m cheap. I’m the king.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is on the phone, everyone else is there except Joey.]
rows.Content: Rachel: ‘Okay. (listens) Okay, daddy we’ll see you tomorrow night. (listens) Okay bye-bye.’ (hangs up)ScenesRoss: We?ScenesRachel: Are ah, having dinner with my Dad tomorrow night, I hope that’s okay.ScenesRoss: Oh shoot, tomorrow’s not so good, I’m supposed to um, fall off the Empire State building and land on a bicycle with no seat. Sorry.ScenesRachel: Ross, my father doesn’t hate you.ScenesRoss: Please, he refers to me as ‘wethead’.ScenesRachel: But honey he calls everybody by a nickname! Okay, look, I know, all right, just one dinner, please, just one night for me, please. I just want him to love you like I do. (Ross looks at her) All right, well not exactly like I do, but, but, if you do come to dinner, I’ll love you like I do in that black thing that you like.ScenesChandler: (leaning in) I’ll go.ScenesRoss: Fine.ScenesRachel: Thank you.ScenesRoss: Hi Gunther.ScenesGunther: Yeah, we’ll see!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey, you guys!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesJoey: Guess what?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesJoey: I got a gig!ScenesAll: Yay!!ScenesChandler: See, that’s why I could never be an actor. Because I can’t say gig.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I can’t say croissant. (realises) Oh my God!ScenesMonica: What’s the part?ScenesJoey: Well, it’s not a part, no. I’m teaching acting for soap operas down at the Learning Extension.ScenesRoss: Come on! That’s great.ScenesAll: Wow!ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah. It’s like my chance to give something back to the acting community.ScenesRoss: Y’know your probably not allowed to sleep with any of your students.ScenesJoey: (glares at him) I know!

rows.Scenes: Mattress King, Monica and Phoebe are shopping for a new mattress.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Ugh! I don’t know Monica. It feels funny just being here. I mean if you buy a bed from Janice’s ex-husband, that’s like betraying Chandler.ScenesMonica: Not at these prices.ScenesPhoebe: (sees a little kid playing with a race car bed) (to kid) Hi. Y'know in England this car would be on the other side of the store. (the kid just stares at her, and she makes the ‘that went right over your head’ motion) Woo!ScenesMonica: (lying down on a mattress) Oh! Ohhhhh! Oh! Phoebe, come here. Aw, this is my new bed. You gotta feel this bad boy.ScenesPhoebe: Eh, Monica it, it feels so weird, y'know, Chandler’s your friend... (hops onto the bed) Oh! Oh my God! Aw, all right take this bed, you can make other friends.

rows.Scenes: Classroom. Joey is writing his name on the board, but turns around before he’s done which causes him to write his name with a downward curve, and he then underlines it, and draws the line right through his name.]
rows.Content: Joey: Good evening. I’m Mr. Tribbiani. And I will be teaching acting for soap operas. Now um, on my first day as (proudly) Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives, (looks for a reaction from his students, and gets none.) I learned that one of the most important things in soap opera acting is reacting, this does not mean acting again, it means, you don’t have a line, but someone else just did. And it goes like this. (looks all intense for a moment and then gasps, the students cheer him) Thanks, thanks, a lot. Oh, by the way, before I forget to work in soap operas some of you will have to become much more attractive. All right, moving right along.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey is entering, Phoebe is already there waiting for the delievery guy.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Hey! Ooh! How was teaching last night?ScenesJoey: Oh it was great. Yeah, you get to say stuff like, ’Hey, the bell doesn’t dismiss you, I dismiss you.’ScenesPhoebe: Ooooh, nice.ScenesJoey: Oh, and guess what, I got an audition for All My Children.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yay!ScenesJoey: Yeah, it’s this great part, this boxer named Nick. And I’m so, so right for it, y'know, he’s just like me. Except he’s a boxer, and has an evil twin.Scenes(There is a knock on the door.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh. (goes and answers the door and there is this huge black delievery guy.)ScenesGuy: Dom da-da dom! Here ye! Here ye! Delivery from the Mattress King. (to Phoebe) You Miss Geller?ScenesPhoebe: Okay.ScenesGuy: Sign here. (hands her a clipboard)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, do I have a middle name. All right Monica Velula Geller. It’s that bedroom there. (points to Monica’s room)ScenesJoey: Hey, Monica bought a bed from the Mattress King?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, so please, please, please, don’t say anything to Chandler.ScenesJoey: You want me to lie to Chandler?ScenesPhoebe: Is that a problem?ScenesJoey: No.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, hey, hey Nick the boxer let’s see what you got. All right ya, put ‘em up. Come on. (they start shadow boxing)ScenesJoey: Hey, you’re ah, pretty good at this.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well I had to learn, I was staying at the Y and some off the young men weren’t acting Christian enough.ScenesJoey: Ahh!Scenes(Joey throws a punch and just lightly taps her on the shoulder, Phoebe counters with a jab to the nose.)ScenesJoey: Hey now!Scenes(Phoebe throws another jab, and lands it on Joey’s nose, causing it to bleed.)ScenesJoey: Hey!!! Oww!! And I’m bleeding.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oh! Oh!ScenesJoey: Okay, great.ScenesPhoebe: Wow! And I’m a vegetarian! All right, all right, well I’m sorry, we’ll put some ice on it.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: ‘Kay, put your head back.ScenesJoey: All right. I can’t see.ScenesPhoebe: All right, I have ya. Oh God.ScenesGuy: Which bedroom do ya want it in Miss Geller?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, it’s the compulsively neat one by the window, okay.ScenesGuy: Gotcha. (he and his helper walk in carrying the racecar bed.)

rows.Scenes: Restaurant, Rachel and Ross and Dr. Green are having dinner.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Hi Daddy!ScenesDr. Green: This where they put it? What, there no table available in the kitchen! Hello, baby.ScenesRachel: You remember Ross.ScenesDr. Green: Um-hmm.ScenesRoss: Nice to see you again Dr. Green.ScenesDr. Green: So! (they both try to sit next to Rachel but Dr. Green is successful.) (to Ross) How’s the library?ScenesRoss: Ugh, museum.ScenesDr. Green: What happened to the library?ScenesRoss: There never was a library. I mean there are libraries, its just that I ah, I never worked at one.ScenesDr. Green: You know what’s really good here, the lobster. What do you say shall I just order three.ScenesRoss: Yeah, if you’re really hungry. (Dr. Green stares at him) It was a joke, I made a joke.ScenesRachel: Yeah, actually Daddy Ross is allergic to lobster.ScenesDr. Green: What kind of person is allergic to lobster? I guess the kind of person that works at a library.ScenesRoss: It’s not a library...ScenesDr. Green: (interrupting him) I know!! It’s a museum! What, you’re the only one around here who can make a joke! At least mine was funny. Ah, waiter, we will have two lobsters and a menu. (nods at Ross, and mouths I don’t know to the waiter.)

rows.Scenes: After dinner.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, Dr. Green, how’s the old boat.ScenesDr. Green: They found rust. You know what rust does to a boat?ScenesRoss: It gives it a nice antiquey look.ScenesDr. Green: (he stares at Ross) Rust, is boat cancer, Ross.ScenesRoss: Wow. I’m sorry, when I was a kid I lost a bike to that. (Rachel giggles at that)ScenesDr. Green: Excuse me for a moment, will you please, I want to say good night to the Levines, before we go.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay! (picks up a knife and pretends to stab his heart.)ScenesRachel: Aw honey stop! It’s not that bad.ScenesRoss: Yeah. (sees the bill) Op! Uh-oh! I think your Dad must’ve added wrong. He only tipped like four percent.ScenesRachel: Yeah. That’s Daddy.ScenesRoss: That’s Daddy?! But doesn’t it bother you? You’re a waitress.ScenesRachel: Yes, it bothers me Ross, but y'know if he was a regular at the coffee house, I’d be serving him sneezers.ScenesRoss: So?ScenesRachel: So. Ross, I’ve bugged him about this a million times, he’s not gonna change.ScenesRoss: You really serve people sneezers?ScenesRachel: Well um, I don’t.ScenesDr Green: You kids ready?ScenesRoss: Thanks again, Dr. Green.ScenesDr. Green: All right.Scenes(Ross takes a twenty and slips it underneath the bill when Dr. Green isn’t looking.)ScenesDr. Green: Oh, wait, wait, wait, wait, I think I forgot my receipt.ScenesRoss: Oh, ah, you don’t need that.ScenesDr. Green: Why not?ScenesRoss: The carbon, it’s messy, I mean it gets on your fingers and causes, the, the ah, night blindness.ScenesDr. Green: (gets his receipt and notices the twenty) What is this? Who put a twenty down here? Huh?ScenesRoss: Oh, yeah, that would be me, um, I have, I have a problem I-I tip way too much, way, way, too much, it’s a sickness really.ScenesRachel: Yeah it is, it is. (to Ross) We really, really have to do something about that.ScenesRoss: I know.ScenesDr. Green: Excuse me, you think I’m cheap?ScenesRachel: Oh Daddy, no he didn’t mean anything by that, he really didn’t.ScenesRoss: Nothing I do means anything, really.ScenesDr. Green: This is nice. I pay two hundred dollars for dinner, you put down twenty, and you come out looking like Mr. Big Shot. You really want to be Mr. Big Shot? Here, I’ll tell you what, you pay the whole bill, Mr. Big Shot, all right. (rips up the bill, and throws it at Ross, then leaves)ScenesRoss: Well Mr. Big Shot is better than ‘wethead’.

rows.Scenes: Classroom, Joey is lecturing on facial expressions.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, some tricks of the trade. Now, I’ve never been able to cry as an actor, so if I’m in a scene where I have to cry, I cut a hole in my pocket, take a pair of tweezers, and just start pulling. Or ah, or, let’s say I wanna convey that I’ve just done something evil. That would be the basic ‘I have a fishhook in my eyebrow and I like it’ (Does it by raising one eyebrow, and showing off the pretend fishhook.) Okay, let’s say I’ve just gotten bad news, well all I do there is try and divide 232 by 13. (looks all confused) And that’s how it’s done. Great soap opera acting tonight everybody, class dismissed.ScenesStudent: Hey, Mr. Trib.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey.ScenesStudent: Guess what, I got an audition!ScenesJoey: Awww, one of my students got an audition. I’m so proud.ScenesStudent: I was wondering if you would consider coaching me for it?ScenesJoey: You bet! What’s the part?ScenesStudent: Oh it’s great, it’s a role on All My Children, Nick the boxer.Scenes(Joey does the ‘232 divided by 13 bad news’ look.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Hallway, Ross and Rachel are returning from dinner.]
rows.Content: Rachel: You had to do it, didn’t you? You couldn’t just leave it alone.ScenesRoss: Four percent. Okay. I tip more than that when there’s a bug in my food.ScenesRachel: Ross, tonight was about the two of you getting along. (Ross groans and rubs his neck) Oh, would you just see my chiropractor, already.ScenesRoss: Yeah, I’m gonna go to a doctor who went to school in a mini-mall.Scenes(they go into Monica and Rachel’s, and see Phoebe hopping around.)ScenesRoss: Hey Pheebs, what are you doing?ScenesPhoebe: I’m, I’m freaking out! Monica kinda trusted me with something and she shouldn’t have! All right, I haven’t lived here in a while, so I have to ask you something. Does Monica still turn on the lights in her bedroom?ScenesRachel: Um. yeah.ScenesPhoebe: I am soo dead. (goes to Monica’s room)ScenesRachel: All right, look, here’s the bottom line Ross, this is fixable, if we act fast, okay. So, I’ll invite him to brunch tomorrow and you can make nice.ScenesRoss: Look, honey, I have tried to make nice, it doesn’t work.ScenesRachel: Okay, look, Ross, I realise that my Father is difficult, but that’s why you have got to be the bigger man here.ScenesRoss: Look sweetie, I could be the bigger man, I could be the biggest man, I could be a big, huge, giant man, and it still wouldn’t make any difference, except that I could pick your Father up and say ‘Like me! Like me tiny doctor!’ScenesRachel: Okay, well can’t you just try it one more time Ross? For me? For me?ScenesRoss: Rachel one brunch is not gonna solve anything. You gotta face it, okay we’re never gonna get along.ScenesRachel: Okay, well you are just gonna have too, okay. Because I already got a Mother and a Father who cannot stay in the same room together, okay, I don’t wanna have to have a separate room for you too!! (starts to cry)ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, okay. (hugs her) I’ll get the bagels.

rows.Scenes: Monica’s bedroom, Phoebe is trying to hide the bed from Monica.]
rows.Content: Monica: (sees the bed) What’s this?ScenesPhoebe: Isn’t it cool! Varoom! Varoom!ScenesMonica: This is not the bed I ordered!ScenesPhoebe: I know, you must’ve won like a contest or something!Scenes(Phoebe starts to make a sound like a car accelerating)ScenesMonica: Phoebe!Scenes(Phoebe makes a sound like a car screeching to a halt.)ScenesMonica: Why is this car in my bedroom?ScenesPhoebe: I’m sorry, okay, I-I wasn’t looking, and the store says that they won’t take it back because you signed for it...ScenesMonica: When did I sign for it?ScenesPhoebe: When I was you! Y'know what, it’s all Joey’s fault, ‘cause he left his nose open!ScenesMonica: Did you make brownies today?ScenesChandler: Knock, knock.ScenesMonica: (to Phoebe) Quick, take off your dress, he won’t notice the bed.ScenesChandler: Hey, I’m going for sushi does anybody want.. (enters and sees the bed) Whoa-whoa, somebody missed the off ramp.ScenesPhoebe: It’s Monica’s bed. What?ScenesChandler: Okay. (to Monica) It’s a racecar.ScenesPhoebe: So. This has always been Monica’s bed, what you’re just noticing now, how self-involved are you?ScenesChandler: Okay, well it this bed isn’t new, how come there is plastic on the mattress?ScenesMonica: Sometimes I have bad dreams. (starts to break down, and Phoebe offers her, her hand to comfort her.)

rows.Scenes: Classroom, Joey is coaching his student.]
rows.Content: Student: Look, I just saw my best friends brains smeared across the canvas, that’s not gonna be me, not me.ScenesJoey: Wow! That was good. That was...(points to his pocket) Tweezers?ScenesStudent: No.ScenesJoey: Whoa. That was really good.ScenesStudent: Thanks, any suggestions?Scenes(Joey gets the evil look on his face.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Monica, and Phoebe are there, yelling at Joey.]
rows.Content: Chandler: You told him to play the boxer gay!!ScenesJoey: Well, I-I might’ve said supergay.ScenesChandler: You totally screwed him over.ScenesMonica: Joey, you’re this guy’s teacher. I mean how could you do this?ScenesJoey: Because, Monica, the guy’s so good, and I really, really want this part.ScenesPhoebe: Well, if you really, really want it, then it’s okay.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is greeting her Father for their brunch.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (opening the door) Hi Daddy.ScenesDr. Green: Baby. Ross.ScenesRoss: Dr. Green. How are you? (offers his hand, and Dr. Green puts his scarf on it.)ScenesDr. Green: Thanks for dinner last night.ScenesRoss: Thank you for teaching me a valuable lesson.ScenesDr. Green: Nice hair. What’d ya do? Swim here?ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) Okay, that’s it, I can’t take it anymore.ScenesRachel: What? What? He’s interested in you. He-he likes your hair, he just wants to know how you got here.ScenesRoss: Oh, please. Sweetie it’s hopeless, okay, I’m just gonna go. (starts to leave rubbing his neck)ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesRoss: Look, look I’m sorry. It’s just that....ScenesDr. Green: Ross? What’s with the neck?ScenesRachel: He’s got this thing. And I keep telling him to go to my chiropractor...ScenesDr. Green: You’re still going to that chiropractor, that man couldn’t get into medical school in Extapa!ScenesRoss: Thank you! That’s what I keep saying.ScenesRachel: Excuse me, Dr. Bobby happens to be an excellent doctor.ScenesRoss: Uh.ScenesDr. Green: Wait a minute, his name is Dr. Bobby?ScenesRachel: Well that’s his last name.ScenesRoss: And his first name.ScenesDr. Green: He’s Bobby Bobby?ScenesRachel: It’s Robert Bobby.ScenesDr. Green: Oh.ScenesRachel: And um, excuse me, he helps me.ScenesRoss: Oh-ho please. Ask her how?ScenesDr. Green: What do you need help for?ScenesRachel: With my alignment. I’ve got one leg shorter than the other.ScenesDr. Green: Oh God!ScenesRoss: Argue with that.ScenesRachel: What? It’s true, my right leg is two inches shorter.ScenesDr. Green: Come on! You’re just titling! (to Ross) Her legs are fine!ScenesRoss: I know that!ScenesDr. Green: So, why do you let her go to a chiropractor for?ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, let her?ScenesRoss: What can I do, she doesn’t listen to me about renter’s insurance either.ScenesDr. Green: Wait a minute, you don’t have renter’s insurance?!ScenesRachel: No.ScenesDr. Green: Well what if somebody steals something? How are you gonna run after him with one leg shorter than the other?!Scenes(Both he and Ross start laughing)ScenesRoss: Hey, would you ah, would you like some juice?ScenesDr. Green: I’d love some juice. Thanks.ScenesRoss: Okay. (to Rachel) Wow! This is going so well. Did you see us? Did you see?ScenesRachel: Yeah honey, I’m standing right there! Why didn’t you just tell him about the mole I haven’t got checked yet.ScenesRoss: Excellent!

rows.Scenes: Classroom, Joey is talking to his students.]
rows.Content: Joey: (sadly) There will come a time in each of your careers when you’ll have a chance to screw over another soap opera actor. I had such an opportunity in the recent, present. And I’m ashamed to say that I took it, I advised a fellow actor to play a role, homosexually. Yeah, we both auditioned for the part, and uh, as it turned out, they ah, they liked the stupid gay thing and cast him. And now, he’s got a two year contract opposite Susan Luchhi, the first lady of daytime television, and me, me I’m stuck here teaching a bunch of people, most of whom are too ugly to even be on TV. I’m sorry, I’m sorry, I’m sorry. (he gets a huge round of applause from his students.) Thank you.

rows.Scenes: Mattress King, Monica is trying to return her bed.]
rows.Content: Jester: Uh, may I help you?ScenesMonica: Yeah, I talked to you on the phone, I’m the lady that got stuck with the racecar bed.ScenesJester: Look, it’s like I told you, there’s nothing I can do. You signed for it, Monica Velula Geller.ScenesJoey: All right, Jester man, look we wanna see the king.ScenesJester: Nobody sees the king!ScenesJoey: Oh-ho-kay, I’m talking to the king. (starts to go to a back room)ScenesJester: Hey! You can’t go back there!Scenes(Joey goes to the door, but stops and looks through the window at Janice and the Mattress King, her ex-husband, kissing.)ScenesJanice: Oh my God.Scenes(Joey fakes a scream.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica’s bedroom, Chandler is playing with the bed.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Varrrrrroom! Hey! Watch it lady! Varrrrrrrrrrom! (makes a screeching sound as he pretends to stomp on the brakes.) Hey-hey good lookin’! (honks the bed’s little horn on the steering wheel.) Varrrrrrrrroom. (notices Rachel and stops) All right, I’ll leave. My bed’s so boring.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The Giant Poking DeviceScenesWritten by: Adam ChaseScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe, Chandler, and Ross are there, Rachel is serving brownies.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Here you go Pheebs. Who else wants one of my special homemade brownies?ScenesChandler: I will have one. (Ross and him both take one.)Scenes(Phoebe takes a bite and spits it out and screams.)ScenesChandler: Okay, I’m not gonna have one.ScenesRoss: Neither will I. (they both put back the brownies.)ScenesPhoebe: No, no, it’s just my tooth.ScenesChandler: All right I’ll have one. (he and Ross take another brownie,)ScenesRoss: So what’s a matter, you need a dentist? I’ve got a good one.ScenesPhoebe: No thanks, I have a good one too. I just, I, I can’t see him.ScenesChandler: See that is the problem with invisible dentists.ScenesRoss: Why? Why can’t you go to him?ScenesPhoebe: Because, every time I go to the dentist, somebody dies.ScenesChandler: That is so weird, because every time I go to the dentist, I look down the hygienist’s blouse.ScenesRachel: Phoebe, what? Umm...what?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, yeah, first there was my aunt Mary, and then there was umm, John, my mailman, and then my, my cowboy friend ‘Albino Bob’.ScenesRachel: And all these people actually died?ScenesPhoebe: Yes, while I was in the chair! That’s why I take such good care of my teeth now, y'know, it’s not about oral hygiene, I floss to save lives!ScenesRoss: Pheebs, come on, you didn’t kill anybody, these people just happened to die when you went to the dentist. It’s, it’s, it’s just ah, a coincidence.ScenesPhoebe: Well tell that to them. Oh! You can’t, their dead.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Ross, Rachel, and Phoebe are there.]
rows.Content: Ross: Thanks, Gunther. (takes the plate Gunther serves him and Rachel comes up and kisses him) (to Rachel) Hey! (to Gunther) Umm, can I get a napkin too?ScenesGunther: Oh, like you don’t already have everything.ScenesPhoebe: (trying to bite into an apple) Ow! Ow! (drops the apple in disgust.)ScenesRachel: Phoebe, your in pain, would you just go to the dentist, just go.ScenesPhoebe: All right, fine, fine, but if you’re my next victim, don’t come back as a poltergeist and like suck me into the TV set.ScenesRachel: I promise.ScenesPhoebe: Although, don’t feel like you can’t visit.ScenesJoey: (entering with Monica) Hey, is, is, is Chandler here?ScenesRoss: (patting his clothes like he is looking for his wallet) No, no he’s not.ScenesMonica: You guys, Joey just saw Janice kissing her ex-husband.ScenesRoss: What? (to Joey) So what are you going to do? I mean how, how are you going to tell Chandler?ScenesJoey: Well, I was thinking about that and I, I think the best way would be, to not.ScenesRachel: Joey, you can’t keep this to yourself, if you know about this, you have to tell him.ScenesJoey: It’ll kill him. I mean it’ll, it’ll just kill him.ScenesPhoebe: Well, you could wait ‘til I go to the dentist, maybe I’ll kill him.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, All are there except for Chandler.]
rows.Content: Joey: (looking out the window) Ewww! Ugly Naked Guy is using his new hammock. It’s like a Play-Doo Fat Factory.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I’m going to the dentist, so listen, okay, just be on the look out for anything that, that, that you can fall into, or, or that can fall on you, or... All right, just look out! Okay, And um, I also just wanna, I just wanna tell you all that um...... (starts to cry and runs out)ScenesRoss: Okay, I have a problem I have to go into work for a few hours, some kids messed up the Homo Sapien display.ScenesJoey: What did they do?ScenesRoss: Well, they painted over the word ‘Sapien’ for one thing, then they rearranged the figures, let’s just leave it at that.ScenesMonica: So, do you want me to watch Ben for you?ScenesRoss: Yes, that’s what I was going to ask, thank you.ScenesRachel: Whoa! Wait! Hello! What about me?ScenesRoss: You? You! Want to watch Ben? (in the background Monica mouths ‘Don’t worry, I’ll be here the whole time.’ to Ross.) Yes! That’d be great, no, I just wanted to ask Monica, because I know how empty her life is. (Monica sarcastically mouths ‘Yeah!’ and holds up her thumb.)ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, Ross?ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesJoey: I’ve got a science question.ScenesRoss: Hmm?ScenesJoey: If the Homo Sapiens, were in fact ‘Homo-sapien’, is that why there extinct?ScenesRoss: Joey, Homo Sapiens are people.ScenesJoey: Hey-hey, I’m not judging.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are babysitting Ben.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (holding Ben) Look Benny, spoon. (moves it back and forth) Spoon. Come on! All right, y'know what I think he’s bored.ScenesMonica: Here. Ben, do you wanna play the airplane game, do you wanna show Rachel? Come here. (takes Ben) We’re gonna do something fun. Okay. (throws Ben up in the air a little bit and catches him) Weee!! (moves into the living room and does it again) Weee!! (starts to walk back into the kitchen as she does it again, and hits Ben’s head on that wooden beam across the ceiling.)Scenes[cut to later]ScenesMonica: (to Ben) Who’s so brave, you’re so brave, yes you are, you’re so brave.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay honey, he’s fine, he’s fine, let’s just put him down. Come here, Ben. (sets him on the couch) See that’s a good boy. (to Monica) How could you do that to him!! Ross trusted me, what is he going to say?!ScenesMonica: He’s not gonna say anything, because we’re not gonna tell him.ScenesRachel: We’re not?!ScenesMonica: No we’re not.ScenesRachel: All right, I like that.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesRachel: So we’re okay, we’re okay, we’re okay, (starts to exam Ben) aren’t we? No, we’re not okay, we’re not okay, there’s a bump, there’s a bump.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Well push it in! Push it in!ScenesRachel: I cannot push it in!ScenesMonica: Okay, we’re gonna need a distraction.ScenesRachel: Okay, okay, okay.ScenesMonica: I got it!ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesMonica: The second that Ross walks in that door, I want you take him back to your bedroom and do whatever it is that you do that makes him go, (high pitched) rweee!!ScenesRachel: Or. We could put a hat on his head.ScenesMonica: A hat! Yes! We need a hat.ScenesRachel: We need a hat..ScenesMonica: Where are we gonna find a tiny little hat?ScenesRachel: Oh, oh, oh, I’ll get ‘Rainy Day Bear’!! (runs to get him)ScenesMonica: Because he’ll know what to do? (Rachel comes out of her room with a bear that’s dressed in a rain suit.) Oh my God, you’re a genius!ScenesRachel: Oh God, oh God, it’s sowed on though.ScenesMonica: Give it. Give it.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(Monica takes the bear, grabs his hat, and rips off his head.)ScenesMonica and Rachel: Oh!!ScenesRachel: Oh, it’s just like a bloodbath in here today.

rows.Scenes: The street, Chandler and Joey are walking past a jewelery store.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Hey! Hold on a minute, hold on a second. Do you think these pearls are nice?ScenesJoey: I’d really prefer a mountain bike.ScenesChandler: Janice’s birthday is coming up, I want to get her something speacial. Come in here with me.ScenesJoey: Whoa, whoa, whoa, wait, whoa. Do you ah, want to get her something speacial, get her flowers, get her candy, get her gum, girls love gum.ScenesChandler: That’s a good idea, ‘Dear Janice have a Hubba-Bubba birthday’. I would like to get her something serious.ScenesJoey: Oh, you want something serious. Y'know what you should do, you should get her one of those um, barium enemas. Those are dead serious.ScenesChandler: All right. Look, I’m gonna go in here, and you don’t buy me anything ever. (starts to go into the store)ScenesJoey: (stopping him) No, no, you can’t, you can’t, okay, you can’t, you can’t buy her pearls, you just can’t, you can’t, you can’t.ScenesChandler: Why not?!ScenesJoey: Oh God. Uh, okay, here’s the thing, this is the thing, okay, the thing is...ScenesChandler: What is the thing?ScenesJoey: Okay. I went down to the ‘Mattress King’ showroom and, and I saw Janice, kissing her ex-husband.ScenesChandler: (shocked) What?ScenesJoey: They were in his office.ScenesChandler: Well she, she wouldn’t do that, she’s with, she’s with me.ScenesJoey: I’m telling you man, I saw it.ScenesChandler: Yeah, well, you’re wrong! Okay, you’re wrong.ScenesJoey: I’m not wrong! I wish I was. I’m sorry. Bet that barium enema doesn’t sound so bad now, huh?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are dressing up Ben in the entire rain suit from Rainy Day Bear.]
rows.Content: Monica: It just makes more sense as an ensemble.ScenesRachel: Right.ScenesMonica: Besides, it takes the focus off the hat.ScenesPhoebe: (running through the door) No! Oh! You’re alive! You’re alive!ScenesRachel: See Pheebs, I promised you no one would die, didn’t I?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, well, we’ll see about that. Can I use your phone? I just wanna call everyone I know.ScenesMonica: Sure, we have no money, go ahead.ScenesPhoebe: (on phone) ‘Hey! You’re not dead! Okay, see ya!’ScenesBen: Monica.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! He just said my name! Did you hear that?ScenesBen: Monica bang!ScenesRachel: Okay, I heard that.ScenesMonica: Did he just say ‘Monica bang’?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! He’s gonna rat me out!ScenesBen: Monica bang!ScenesMonica: Oh-ho-ho, sweetie, sweetie, you gotta stop saying that, now. It’s no big deal, it’s not even worth mentioning, you see we all do it all the time. See watch this, Ben, Ben, Ben. (goes over and starts hitting her head on the post) Ow, Monica bang! (does it again) Everybody bang. (repeats) Ben bang. (repeats) Rachel bang. (repeats) Bang, Rachel bang! Oh, isn’t that fun?ScenesRachel: (goes over and hits her head on the post) Look at that! (repeats) Look at that! (repeats) We all do it. (repeats) Okay, I’m stopping now.ScenesMonica: You okay?ScenesRachel: Oh yeah! Y'know, if it’s not a headboard, it’s just not worth it.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is waiting for Janice to arrive, and is angrily fllipping through a magazine.]
rows.Content: Janice: (entering) How’s my Bing-a-ling?ScenesChandler: Ah, I don’t know, you tell me. Anything you ah, wanna tell me, because, if you ah, you should, if you, you would, tell me.ScenesJanice: Why are your eyes so white?ScenesChandler: You tell me! Maybe, it’s because I was just fooling with my ex! Oh no-no-no-no, no-no-no-no, that was you!!ScenesJanice: Oh my God!!ScenesChandler: All right!ScenesJanice: How did you know?ScenesChandler: Joey told me, he saw you two kissing.ScenesJanice: In the park?ScenesChandler: No! In his office! How many kisses were there?ScenesJanice: Just those two!ScenesChandler: Wh-wh-why, wh-why, why, why was there kissing!? There should be no kissing!!ScenesJanice: Oh, I’m sorry honey, I’m so, so, (nasally) haaaaa! I’m so, so sorry, I just (nasally) haaaaaa! But I, oh what happened was, I-I-I can’t breathe. Can you get me a bag, or something?ScenesChandler: (giving her a bag) Here.Scenes(Janice starts to breath into it and sucks in the reciept, and then spits it out.)ScenesJanice: The receipt.ScenesChandler: I’ll take it! All right look, I gotta know. Are you finished with me? (Janice shakes her head no) Are you finished with him? (Janice shakes her head no) Do you still love him? (Janice shakes her head yes) Do you still love me? (Janice shakes her head yes) All right look, (grabs the bag) I’m gonna need an actual answer here okay, so which is it, him or me? (his phone starts to ring)ScenesJanice: I don’t know.ScenesPhoebe: (rushing in) Okay. If you’re alive you answer your phone!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Rachel, Phoebe, and Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay, Ben, I won’t tell your daddy that you had ice cream for dinner, if you don’t tell about our little bonking incident.ScenesRachel: Monica, number one, I don’t think Ben understands the concept of bribery, and number two, I... (Joey starts laughing in the background) (to Joey) What?!ScenesJoey: You said number two.ScenesRachel: I also said number one.ScenesJoey: I know. (giggles harder)ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey! Everyone.ScenesRachel: Hi!ScenesRoss: How’s my little boy?ScenesRachel: He’s perfect, he’s never been better.ScenesRoss: (noticing the outfit he is wearing) What’d you do, take him whaling?ScenesBen: Monica.ScenesRoss: Oh my God, he just said your name, that’s great! Good job Ben.ScenesBen: Monica bang!ScenesMonica: Oh that’s right, that’s what I’d sound like if I exploded.ScenesPhoebe: Woo-Hoo! The curse is broken! I called everybody I know, and everyone is alive.ScenesJoey: Uh.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesJoey: Ugly Naked Guy looks awfully still. (Phoebe runs to the window and gasps.)Scenes[Cut to later, all except Chandler are staring out the window at Ugly Naked Guy.]ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! I killed him! I killed another one! And this curse is getting stronger too, to bring down something that big.ScenesRachel: Well maybe he’s just taking a nap.ScenesJoey: I’m tellin’ ya, he hasn’t moved since this morning.ScenesMonica: All right, we should call somebody.ScenesRoss: And tell them what? The naked guy we stare at all the time isn’t moving.ScenesRachel: Well, we have gotta find out if he’s alive.ScenesMonica: How are we gonna do that? There’s no way.ScenesJoey: Well, there is one way. His window’s open, I say, we poke him.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is throwing darts, as Joey enters.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Y'know how we ah, save all those chopsticks for no reason we get when we get Chinese food?ScenesChandler: Yeah.ScenesJoey: Well, now we got a reason.ScenesChandler: What?ScenesJoey: Well, we’re fashioning a very long poking device.ScenesChandler: All right.ScenesJoey: Hey uh, what’s a matter?ScenesChandler: I talked to Janice.ScenesJoey: Oh my God, is she going back to him?ScenesChandler: She doesn’t know. Says she loves us both. Y'know I woke up this morning and I was in love, well I was happy. Y'know it serves me right for buying that twelve pack of condoms. And now I can’t even return them, because she choked on the reciept!ScenesJoey: What are you ah, what are you gonna do?ScenesChandler: I don’t know, y'know. What, what, would you do?ScenesJoey: Well, it doesn’t matter what I would do.ScenesChandler: Come on, tell me.ScenesJoey: All right, you’re probably not gonna want to hear this but ah, if it was me, and this is just me, (Chandler gets ready to throw another dart) I would ah, I would bow out.ScenesChandler: What? (turns around quickly still ready to throw the dart and Joey quickly ducks and hides behind the chair) What are you, what are you talking about?ScenesJoey: They have a kid together, y'know. They’re like, they’re like a family, and if, I don’t know, there’s chance they could make that work, I know I wouldn’t want to be the guy who stood in the way of that. Are you okay? Do you wanna ah, come poke a nude guy?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross has just finished putting Ben to sleep, and is entering from Rachel’s room.]
rows.Content: Ross: Well, he’s finally alseep. About that ah, bump on his head?ScenesRachel: Are you, are you, are you sure it’s ah, a new bump? I mean, no offense, I’ve always thought of Ben as a fairly bumpy headed child.ScenesRoss: It’s okay if he bumps his head, kids bump their heads all the time, y'know, it was your first time babysitting, I figured you did the best you could.ScenesRachel: (confidently) I did!ScenesRoss: I know! I’m saying you have to watch them all the time.ScenesRachel: I did!! I watched! I watched! I watched Monica bang his head against that thing!ScenesRoss: Monica did it?Scenes(Monica runs into the kitchen from the terrace.)ScenesRoss: Monica?ScenesMonica: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Umm, did you notice anything wierd about Ben today?ScenesMonica: No. Why?ScenesRoss: Well, I was just playing with him, and y'know we were doing the alphabet song, which he used to be really good at, but suddenly he’s leaving out ‘e’ and ‘f.’ It’s like they just ah, I don’t know, fell out of his head.ScenesMonica: Really?!ScenesRoss: Oh, and also, he’s, he’s walkin’ kind of funny, his left leg is moving a lot faster than his right leg, and he’s in there just sort of y'know... (walks around in a circle)ScenesMonica: Oh my God, I wrecked your baby!! (runs into the bedroom)ScenesRachel: I hope it’s still funny when you’re in hell.ScenesMonica: (coming out of the bedroom) You jerk! You know how much I love that kid! (starts to chase Ross around the living room)ScenesRoss: Monica bang! Monica bang! (runs into one of the posts) Ow!ScenesRachel: I’ll get the hat.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Janice are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Janice, I have something I need to tell you, and I want you to let me get through it, because it’s, it’s, it’s not gonna be easy.ScenesJanice: Okay.ScenesChandler: I think you should go back with Gary. I don’t wanna be the guy that breaks up a family, y'know when my parents split up, it was because of that guy. Whenever I would see him I was always think y'know ‘You’re the reason, you are the reason why their not together.’ and I hated that guy. And it didn’t matter how nice he was, or how happy he made my Dad.ScenesJanice: Wow!ScenesChandler: Yeah, well. It’s the right thing to do.ScenesJanice: Oh! You’re right. Oh God. But, before I can say ‘good-bye’, there’s something I really need you to know, Chandler. The way I feel about you, it’s like, I finally understand what Lionel Richie’s been singing about. Y'know, I mean what we have, it’s like movie love, you’re my soulmate, and I can’t believe we’re not going to be spending the rest of our lives together.ScenesChandler: Then don’t leave me!ScenesJanice: What?ScenesChandler: Forget what I said, I was babbling! Pick me!ScenesJanice: No, you were right, you were right. I mean, I-I-I’ve got to give my marriage another chance.ScenesChandler: No you don’t! No, no, no, I say you have to give your divorce another chance.ScenesJanice: (standing up) I’m sorry. (hugs him)ScenesChandler: Ohhh. Don’t go.ScenesJanice: No, I-I-I gotta go. (she starts to walk away, but Chandler doesn’t let her go.)ScenesChandler: No. No! No! No!ScenesJanice: Honey, honey, people are looking.ScenesChandler: I don’t care! (turns around and to the people watching them) I don’t care!!ScenesJanice: Yeah, um, I’m, I’m leaving now. (tries to get her leg out of Chandler’s grasp, she finally does, but Chandler takes off her shoe.)ScenesChandler: You can’t leave! I have your shoe!ScenesJanice: Good-bye Chandler Bing. (walks out with one shoe)ScenesGunther: Rachel has those in burgendy.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Joey, Rachel, Monica, Phoebe, and Ross are holding the giant poking device.]
rows.Content: Joey: All right now remember, something this big and long is going to be difficult to manuver, fortunately I have a lot of experience in that area.ScenesRoss: Can we please focus here, a naked man’s life hangs in the balance!ScenesPhoebe: I’m telling you he’s dead. What we are about to have here is a dead fat guy on a stick.ScenesJoey: All right, ladies and gentlemen, let’s poke. (they start to advance the giant poking device) Steady. Steady. Okay, a little higher. Careful of the angle. Okay, okay, we’re approaching the window (as he says this the camera cuts to their view of Ugly Naked Guy, so that we actually see him!) Thread the needle. Thread the needle.Scenes(They thread the needle and start poking him, he then stirs.)ScenesPhoebe: He’s alive! He’s a-live!!!ScenesMonica: And yet, we’re still poking him.ScenesJoey: Okay, retract the device, retract the device.ScenesRoss: He does not look happy.ScenesRachel: Hey-hey, now he’s showing us his poking device.ScenesJoey: Hey, that’s never gonna make it all the way over here, buddy!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is listening to a Lionel Richie album]
rows.Content: Chandler: (singing) I’ll hold you close in my arms. (Phoebe enters) I can’t resist your charms. And love....ScenesPhoebe: (joining him) Love....ScenesChandler and Phoebe: I’ll be a fool for you. I’m sure, you know I don’t mind.ScenesChandler: (high pitched) No you know I don’t mind.ScenesChandler and Phoebe: Yes! You mean the world the world to me. Oh...ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesPhoebe: I know.ScenesChandler: I’ve found.ScenesPhoebe: I’ve found....ScenesChandler and Phoebe: ...in you, my endless (Phoebe goes high pitched, Chandler goes low pitched) love. (they both look at each other.) My endless love. (once again they don’t match tones, and they just look at each other)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The FootballScenesWritten by: Ira UngerleiderScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the whole gang is there, the guys are watching football, the girls are cooking Thanksgiving dinner.]
rows.Content: The Guys: (reacting to a play) Yes! Yes! Yes! Yes! Awww!ScenesPhoebe: Hey, it’s your Thanksgiving too, y'know, instead of watching football, you could help.ScenesThe Guys: We will. (they don’t move)ScenesMonica: Okay, Rachel, you wanna put the marshmellows in concentric circles.ScenesRachel: No Mon, you want to put them in concentric circles. I want to do this.Scenes(Rachel sticks a marshmellow into Monica’s nose. Monica takes it out of her nose by closing one nostril, and blowing.)ScenesMonica: Every year.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Y'know, for once, I am going to sit down and try to watch one of these things. (just as she sits down).ScenesRoss: Halftime.ScenesJoey: Hey, who wants to ah, throw the ball around a little, maybe get a little three on three going?ScenesRachel: Oh! That would be sooo much fun!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, can I play too? I’ve never played football, like ever.ScenesJoey: Great, you can cover Chandler.ScenesChandler: No, no, no, I don’t, I don’t really wanna play.ScenesJoey: Come on man! You never want to do anything since you and Janice broke up.ScenesChandler: That’s not true! I wanted to wear my bathrobe and eat peanut clusters all day. I wanted to start drinking in the morning. Don’t say that I don’t have goals!ScenesJoey: Chandler, you have to start getting over her. All right, if you play, you get some fresh air, maybe it’ll take your mind off Janice, and if you don’t play, everyone will be mad at you ‘cause the teams won’t be even. Come on.ScenesChandler: Yeah, all right, I’ll play.ScenesPhoebe: Yay!!ScenesRachel: Let’s do it! Ross?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: Do you wanna play football?ScenesRoss: Um, Monica and I aren’t supposed to play football.ScenesJoey: Says who? Your mom?ScenesMonica and Ross: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Well, every, every Thanksgiving um, we used to have a touch football game called the ‘Geller Bowl.’ScenesChandler: No, no, no, you say that proudly.ScenesMonica: Anyway, Ross and I were always captains, and um, it got kind’ve competitive and one year, Geller Bowl VI, I accidentally broke Ross’s nose.ScenesRoss: It was soo not an accident. She saw I was about to tag her, so she threw her big fat grandma arm elbow right into my face. And just keep running.ScenesMonica: To score the winning touchdown, by the way.ScenesRoss: Whoa, whoa, whoa, ho, ho, ho, you did not win the game, the touchdown didn’t count, because of the spectacularly illegal, oh and by the way savage nose breaking.ScenesMonica: (to Chandler and Joey) I won the game.ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! Then how come you didn’t get the Geller Cup?ScenesRachel: Um, there was a Geller Cup?ScenesRoss: Yes, it was the trophy you got if you won the game. But our Dad said, ‘nobody won that game, ‘ and he was sick of our fighting, so he took the trophy and.... (pauses to collect himself, as he is on the verge of tears saying this) threw it in the lake.ScenesChandler: And was the curse lifted?ScenesRoss: Anyway. That’s when our Mom said we were not to play football ever again.ScenesMonica: Y'know what, I think we should play a game. I mean come on, it’s been twelve years.ScenesRoss: Can I see you for a second?Scenes(they walk over to the sink and discuss it for a moment)ScenesMonica: (shouting) Once!!ScenesRoss: All right, we’re gonna play.ScenesChandler: But wait a minute though, how are we gonna get there, though, because my Mom won’t let me cross the street.

rows.Scenes: The Park, the gang is warming up for their football game.]
rows.Content: Monica: Okay. Let’s bring it in.ScenesRachel: Wait no, honey, honey throw it to me, throw it to me.ScenesRoss: Here you go. (throws her the ball)ScenesRachel: (knocking it down instead of catching it) That almost hit me in the face.ScenesJoey: All right, we have to pick captains.ScenesChandler: And then Tineals.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so how do we decide that?ScenesMonica: Well, why don’t we just bunny up.ScenesRachel, Chandler, and Joey: What?ScenesMonica and Ross: (holding both of their hands above their heads making rabbit ears with their fingers.) Bunny!ScenesMonica: Okay, looks like Ross and I are captains. Okay, so um, I bunnied first so that means I get to pick first. Joey.ScenesJoey: Thank you.ScenesRachel: Monica, I’m your best friend.ScenesRoss: Sweetie, don’t worry you’ll get picked. Chandler.ScenesRachel: Ross!ScenesMonica: Phoebe.Scenes(Phoebe kisses Rachel on the cheek, then joins her team.)ScenesRoss: Sweetie, now I pick you.ScenesRachel: You don’t pick me! You’re stuck with me!ScenesRoss: Okay. All right. So let’s see, let’s play from the trash can, to the lightpost. Right. Two hand touch, we’ll kick off.ScenesMonica: All right people listen, I’ve got exactly twenty-eight minutes before I have to baste again.ScenesChandler: Wow! Just like in the pros.ScenesMonica: Huddle up.ScenesJoey: (to his team) All right, huddle up, right over here.ScenesPhoebe: Wait for me! Wait for me! Wait for me! Oh cool, this is my first huddle.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, so what do you guys really think of Chandler?ScenesMonica: Okay, Phoebe you know what you’re doing right?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Okay, Joey’s gonna catch it, and you and I are gonna block.ScenesPhoebe: What’s block?ScenesMonica: Phoebe, I thought you said you know what you’re doing?ScenesPhoebe: I thought you meant in life.ScenesMonica: Break.Scenes(Chandler is getting ready to kick off, Ross is holding the ball between his foot and finger.)ScenesChandler: The ball is Janice. The ball is Janice. (goes to kick the ball but kicks Ross’s foot instead.)ScenesRoss: Oww!! Son of a...!! Ow! Come on!ScenesChandler: Sorry. I’m sorry. Y'know what, we’re just gonna throw it.Scenes(Chandler throws the ball to kick-off.)ScenesJoey: I got it. (catches the ball)ScenesPhoebe: Go! Go! Go!Scenes(Joey runs up field and fakes out Ross and scores a touchdown. His team all celebrates the touchdown.)ScenesMonica: Score!! 7 to nothing!ScenesRachel: (coming over to Ross, who is just getting up) Are you okay?ScenesRoss: Come on, let’s go!ScenesMonica: Losers walk!ScenesRoss: Yeah, losers talk!ScenesChandler: No, no, no, actually losers rhyme.Scenes[cut to later, Ross’s team has the ball.]ScenesChandler: (coming up under center, just like a real quarterback does, and puts his hands between Ross’s legs.) Twenty-three!! Seventy-four!! (Ross stands up and looks at him) You wanna go shotgun?ScenesRoss: Yeah!ScenesChandler: (from the shotgun) Hike!ScenesMonica and Joey: One-Mississippi. Two-Mississippi.
