Three-Mississippi.Scenes(Rachel runs a quick slant.)ScenesRachel: Over here!Scenes(Chandler throws her the ball, which she drops.)ScenesRachel: (proud of her self) I almost caught that one!ScenesChandler: Great! Now, the score is 7 to almost 7.ScenesRoss: Okay, (to Chandler) this play, I want you to do a down and out to the right. Okay. Break!ScenesRachel: Wait, what am I gonna do?ScenesRoss: You, you go long.ScenesRachel: Wait, how long?ScenesRoss: Until we start to look very small.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Break!!Scenes[cut to later, Monica’s team has the ball.]ScenesJoey: Set....hike!ScenesRoss: One-Mississippi, two-Mississippi, switch! Switch! Switch!!ScenesChandler: No, no, no, no, no!Scenes(Monica throws the ball over Joey’s head, it’s stopped from rolling away by a very beautiful woman.)ScenesJoey: Haaaaa! Hey-hey, thanks for stopping our ball.ScenesWoman: (in a foreign accent) You are playing American football?ScenesJoey: Yeah! Wow, your like from a whole other country.ScenesWoman: I’m Dutch.ScenesJoey: Hi-hi, I’m Joey.ScenesWoman: I’m Margha.ScenesJoey: I’m sorry Dutch, I didn’t get that last little bit.ScenesChandler: (running up) Hey Joey, do you wanna play football or you wanna.. (sees Marhan) Hi, I’m Chandler.ScenesMargha: Hello, Chandler.ScenesJoey: Her name is Dutch, and also Marklan.ScenesMargha: Margha.ScenesJoey: Mar-klan.ScenesMargha: Mar-gha.ScenesChandler: Mar-haaaan.Scenes[cut to Ross and Monica.]ScenesMonica: Come on guys! Let’s go! Come on, it’s second down.ScenesRoss: Uh, hello, it’s third down.ScenesMonica: No it’s not, it’s second.ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesMonica: Wow, what?ScenesRoss: It just amazes me that your still pulling stuff like this.ScenesMonica: Pulling what? It’s second down.ScenesRoss: Okay, it’s second down. (turns away) Take all the second downs you need.ScenesMonica: I heard that!ScenesRoss: Well, I said it loud.Scenes[cut to Chandler, Joey, and Margha.]ScenesMargha: It is okay, if I stay and watch?ScenesChandler and Joey: Yeah! Why don’t you stick around. You can sit right there.Scenes(she goes and sits down)ScenesChandler: Well, that went well.ScenesJoey: I think so.ScenesChandler: Y'know, I was thinking about ah, asking her for her number.ScenesJoey: Thanks man, but I think it makes a stronger statement if I ask for it myself, y'know.ScenesChandler: Whoa-ho, whoa! No, I was thinking about y'know for me, as a part of that whole getting over Janice thing you were talking about.ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, that. All right, means that much to ya, I’ll let you have her.ScenesChandler: Thanks. What, let me have her?! What do mean? Like if you didn’t I wouldn’t have a shot?ScenesJoey: Well I don’t like to say it out loud, but, yeah! Don’t feel bad man, we all have our strengths. You’re better with numbers and stuff.ScenesChandler: Math!! You’re giving me math! All right, look y'know what, forget about it, you go for the girl, we’ll see who gets her.Scenes[cut to later, in Ross’s huddle.]ScenesRoss: Chandler, I want you to run a post pattern to the left, okay. And sweetie..ScenesRachel: Yeah, I know, go long. Y'know, it’s like all I’m doing is running back and forth from the huddle.ScenesRoss: Well ah, you wanna just stay out there?ScenesRachel: Can I see that for second.ScenesRoss: Yeah.Scenes(Rachel takes the ball from his hands and bounces it off of Ross’s forehead and Chandler catches the rebound.)ScenesRoss: Okay. Hut! Hike!Scenes(Chandler runs around behind Ross, who pitches him the ball. Chandler runs upfield, and Joey knocks the ball out of his hands.)ScenesJoey: Fumble!Scenes(Joey starts to return the fumble and Chandler grabs Joey’s shirt and rips it off of his back.)ScenesJoey: What the hell’s the matter with you?! This is my favourite jersey.ScenesChandler: Well now you have two. Hey, I am good at math.ScenesJoey: All right, that’s it. Y'know I was still gonna let you have her. But now, forget about it. Prepare to feel very bad about yourself.ScenesChandler: Hey! Well, I’ve been preparing for that my entire life! Or something about you that’s mean!ScenesMonica: All right, come on guys, let’s go! Tie score, and we’re runnin’ out of time. Forty-two!! Thirty-eight!! Hike! (the timer sounds as Monica throws the ball to Phoebe.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh I got it!! (catches the ball) Oh! Ew! Broken boob! Ow!ScenesJoey: Pheebs, run!ScenesMonica: Run, Phoebe, run!Scenes(Phoebe runs and scores a touchdown.)ScenesPhoebe: Touchdown!! Touchdown!!ScenesRoss: Uh, hello, the buzzer buzzed. It doesn’t count.ScenesMonica: After the snap!ScenesRoss: Before the snap!ScenesJoey: After!!ScenesChandler: Before!!ScenesRachel: Now, does it really matter?ScenesAll: Yes!!ScenesPhoebe: Well, okay, I made a touchdown. It was my first touchdown. So?ScenesRoss: Oh Pheebs, that’s great. It doesn’t count.ScenesMonica: Does so count!ScenesRoss: Cheater, cheater, compulsive eater.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God!ScenesMonica: Y'know what, that’s fine, maybe you haven’t grown up, but I have.ScenesRoss: Oh-ho, okay.ScenesMonica: Dead leg!! (kicks him in the thigh.)ScenesRoss: Ow! Ow! Okay, okay, fine, fine! All right, you wanna win by cheating, go ahead, all right. Phoebe the touchdown does count, you win.ScenesPhoebe: Woo-yay!!ScenesMonica: No! Listen, I’m not gonna go through this with you again, okay. Just once I wanna beat when you can’t blame it on the broken nose, the buzzer, or the fact that you thought you were getting mono. Let’s just call this, tie score and it’s halftime.ScenesRoss: Okay, first of all, I don’t play with cheaters, and second of all, you know I had swollen glands!!ScenesMonica: Y'know what? I’ll think you’ll play.ScenesRoss: Oh really! Why is that?Scenes[cut to Monica and Rachel’s.]ScenesMonica: Because the winner gets this!ScenesRoss: The Geller Cup.ScenesChandler: Is everybody else seeing a troll doll nailed to a two by four?ScenesAll: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Okay, good.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: The park, the gang is returning to play the second half of the game.]
rows.Content: Ross: Okay, where in the hell did you get that?!ScenesMonica: When Mom and Dad drove you to the hospital to get your nose fixed, I swam into the lake and fished it out.ScenesRoss: That cup is mine!ScenesMonica: No it’s not! You want it, you’re gonna have to win it!ScenesRachel: All right, so are we not having dinner at all?ScenesMonica: Come on Phoebe, let’s go! Come on, it’s time to get serious, huddle up. Joey, keep your head in the game.ScenesJoey: It’s hard, y'know, his huddle is closer to Dutch girl.ScenesMonica: All right look, if I take Chandler out of the running will you be able to focus?ScenesJoey: What are you gonna do?ScenesMonica: All right, you just make sure that Chandler catches the ball, I’ll take care of the rest.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesMonica: Break!ScenesJoey: Here you go!Scenes(Joey throws the ball to Chandler)ScenesRoss: Chandler! Chandler!Scenes(Chandler catches the ball and starts to run upfield.)ScenesChandler: (to Margha) Hi.Scenes(just as he gets in front of Margha, Monica comes up and tackles him)ScenesMonica: Whoa! Whoa!! Tackled by a girl! Bet ya don’t see that everyday, do ya?ScenesRoss: Whoa! Whoa! Whoa! What’s with the tackling?ScenesMonica: What?! I just touched him and he went over.ScenesRoss: Okay, you wanna play rough, we can play rough.Scenes(They both stare each other down as we hear ‘Let’s get ready to r-r-r-rum-ble!!!’)Scenes(A long football sequence follows.)Scenes[Sequence 1: Monica throws the ball over Chandler’s head to Joey who catches it for a touchdown, and starts to dance in celebration. Chandler then tackles him, and he starts to dance in celebration.]Scenes[Sequence 2: Monica runs upfield and stops, waiting for a pass. Ross runs over and pulls her pants down, steps in front of her and intercepts the pass.]Scenes[Sequence 3: Chandler throws a pass to Ross, who catches it. Phoebe starts screaming and runs up to him and tries to tackle him. But all she ends up doing is running around his waist and screaming.]Scenes[Sequence 4: Ross hikes the ball to Chandler, and the camera pans down to show Rachel standing deep in the end zone, playing with her gum. Something hits her on the head and she looks up to see where it came from.]Scenes[Sequence 5: Monica hands the ball off to Phoebe, who runs up field and delivers a fore-arm shiver to Chandler, knocking him over and scores the touchdown, and she yells...]ScenesPhoebe: I love this game!!Scenes[cut to Ross who walks up to Rachel who is eating a baked pretzel.]ScenesRoss: Hey, where’d you get that?ScenesRachel: I went really long.ScenesMonica: Forty-two to twenty-one! Like the turkey, Ross is done!ScenesRoss: It’s no surprise that your winning, ‘cause you got to pick first, so you got the better team.ScenesMonica: You’re so pathetic! Why can’t you just accept it, we’re winning because I’m better than you.Scenes(Ross makes a ‘Yeah. Right.’ sound.)ScenesMonica: Oh, what a great argument, exhaling! All right, y'know what, I’ll prove it to you, okay. I’ll trade you Joey for Rachel, and I’ll still win the game.ScenesRoss: What?! The guys against the girls? See, that’s ridiculous Monica, because I’m only down by three touchdowns.ScenesMonica: Oh, then bring it on! Oh, unless of course your afraid you might lose to a bunch of girls.ScenesRoss: Fine, fine, Rachel your with Monica, Joey you’re with me.ScenesRachel: I can not believe your trading me!!ScenesMonica: Come on Rach, come on. Let’s see what’s it like to be on a winning team for a change.ScenesRachel: Are you gonna let me play?ScenesMonica: All right then.Scenes[cut to the guys’ team.]ScenesMargha: (coming over) The game is over, we eat now?ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, the game’s not over, we’re just switching teams.ScenesJoey: Yeah, Chandler finds me so intimdating that it’s better if we’re on the same team.ScenesRoss: Right. Okay, let’s play. Let’s go.ScenesChandler: No ah, hold on a second Joe, where do Dutch people come from?ScenesJoey: Ah well, the ah, Pennsylvania Dutch, come from Pennsylvania.ScenesChandler: And the other ah, Dutch people, they come on from somewhere near the Netherlands, right?ScenesJoey: Nice try. (to Margha) See the Netherlands is this make believe place where Peter Pan and Tinker Bell come from.ScenesMargha: Oh, my.ScenesRoss: Enough with geography for the insane, okay? Let’s play some ball, guys.ScenesJoey: Whoa, whoa, no, no, I-I’m not playing with this guy, now.ScenesChandler: Fine with me.ScenesRoss: Okay, y'know what, let’s just cut to the chase here. Okay? Heidi, which of my boys do you like?ScenesChandler and Joey: What are you doing? What are you doing? What are you doing?ScenesMargha: Which do I like?ScenesRoss: Yeah, y'know for dating, general merriment, taking back to your windmill...ScenesMargha: Well, if I had to chose right now, which by the way I find really weird, I would have to say, Chandler.ScenesChandler: Yes!!ScenesJoey: Wait a minute! Wait a minute! She obviously didn’t understand the question.ScenesChandler: Well, you don’t you have Captain Hook explain it to her.ScenesMargha: I’m sorry, Joey, that is my chose.ScenesChandler: You hear that! That is her chose, mister I’ll let you have her! I win! You suck! I rule all! A mini-wave in celebration of me!! (does the wave.)ScenesMargha: I’m now thinking I would like to change my answer to, no one.ScenesChandler: Wh-what?ScenesMargha: I now find you shallow and um, a dork. All right, bye.ScenesJoey: Nice going. You just saved yourself a couple months of sex.ScenesChandler: Y'know what, it doesn’t matter, ‘cause she picked me. Me! From now on I get the dates and you have to stay home on Saturday nights watching Ready, Set, Cook!ScenesRoss: Save the breakthroughs for therapy, okay. The clock is ticking. We have no time, and we are losing, we are losing to girls.ScenesChandler: We’re not gonna lose to girls.ScenesRoss: Hey! It’s 42-21!ScenesJoey: This sucks, I was just up by that much!ScenesMonica: Are we playing football or what? Come on you hairy-backed Marries.Scenes[cut to the girls huddle.]ScenesMonica: We have to do this. We are playing for women everywhere. Okay, just think about every lousy date that you ever had, okay, every guy who kept on the TV while you’re making out...ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God! You dated someone with a glass eye too?!ScenesMonica: Come on, okay, come on this is for all womankind. Let’s kill ‘um!ScenesRachel: Yeah!!! Kill ‘um!!!ScenesPhoebe: All right, no, well I want to kill them to, but their boys, y'know how are we gonna beat three boys?Scenes(Another football sequence follows)Scenes[Sequence 1: Chandler is running past Phoebe with the ball, Phoebe flashes him, he stops and stares dumbfounded at her. Phoebe then runs up and takes the ball away.]Scenes[Sequence 2: Phoebe throws the ball, and it’s intercepted by Joey, who starts to run up field. Rachel jumps on his back in order to try and tackle him, but she doesn’t slow him down. Monica and Phoebe then both grab her legs in order to stop Joey, who still manages to fight through the tackle and score the touchdown.]Scenes[Sequence 3: Chandler is running with the ball, Phoebe flashes him again, but Chandler covers his eyes, and keeps running. He then runs into a tree at the end of the field.]Scenes[cut to the girls huddle]ScenesMonica: All right, we still have a minute and a half to go, and we’re down by two points. Two points.... (she gets interrupted by the guys, who are doing a slow-motion high five.) Phoebe you do a button-hook again. Rachel, you go long.ScenesRachel: No! Come on! Don’t make me go long. Use me. They never cover me.ScenesMonica: Honey, there’s a reason.ScenesRachel: God, I’m not lame, okay. I can do something. I can throw, would you let me throw, come on this is my game too.ScenesPhoebe: Come on Mon, let her throw the ball.ScenesMonica: All right Rachel, you sweep behind, I’ll pitch it to you, you throw it down field to Phoebe. All right. Break.ScenesRachel: Thank you! Break!ScenesMonica: Thirty-two! Seventy-one! Hike!Scenes(Phoebe snaps the ball to Monica, who pitches back to Rachel.)ScenesThe Guys: One-Mississippi! Two-Mississippi! Three-Mississippi!Scenes(They all rush toward Rachel, who panics and runs away. She runs out of the park and up along the fence, she then comes back into the park and runs past Monica, as she gets to Monica, she throws the ball at Monica, and it hits her in the eye.)ScenesRachel: I’m so sorry! Are you okay?ScenesMonica: No! I’m not okay!ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, they were just all coming at me, and I didn’t know what to do.ScenesJoey: (looking at the timer) Thirty seconds left on the timer!ScenesChandler: Okay, okay, so we get to take that stupid troll thing home!ScenesMonica: Come on! Come on! Hurry! We’re running out of time! Huddle up!ScenesPhoebe: Okay. Oooh! Oh, this is our last huddle, yeah.ScenesMonica: All right, Phoebe get open. Rachel, go long.ScenesRachel: (on the verge of tears) Okay.ScenesMonica: Break!Scenes(In slow motion, Phoebe snaps the ball, Rachel goes long. Joey and Chandler and all over Phoebe, leaving Rachel wide open. Ross starts to rush Monica, who sees Phoebe is double covered, in desperation she throws to Rachel. We see flying through the air, and then Rachel running underneath it, then the ball, then Rachel again, then the ball, then Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey staring at it in shock. Then with the grace of Jerry Rice (no offense to Jerry Rice), Rachel catches the ball, and she stops and spikes the ball. Both Phoebe and Monica erupt in celebration.)ScenesRachel: (in triumph) I got a touchdown! We did it!!ScenesChandler: Hey-hey-hey Rachel, funny thing. Actually, the ah, end zone starts at that pole, so you’re five feet short, so we win!ScenesPhoebe: Wait-wait-wait-wait! So, explain something to me though, if, if nobody tagged Rachel, then isn’t the play still going.Scenes(they all start to dive for the ball and Monica and Ross grab it at the same time.)ScenesRoss: Let go! Let go!ScenesMonica: Let go! I’m a tiny little woman!!ScenesChandler: Guys! Guys! Come on! It’s Thanksgiving, it’s not important who wins or loses. The important thing is, (to Joey) the Dutch girl picked me! Me! Not you! Holland loves Chandler! Thank you, Amsterdam! Good night!!ScenesMonica: Ow!!ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel, Phoebe, Chandler, and Joey are eating Thanksgiving dinner.]
rows.Content: Rachel: We should defiantly play football more often. Maybe there’s a like league we could join or something.ScenesPhoebe: Isn’t there a national football league.ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes, there is, they play on Sundays and Monday nights.ScenesRachel: Oh shoot! I work Monday nights.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, this stuffing is amazing. Do you think we should bring them some?ScenesJoey: When they’re hungry enough, they’ll come in.

rows.Scenes: The park, it’s dark outside and Monica and Ross are still fighting over the ball.]
rows.Content: Monica: Let go!ScenesRoss: No! You let go!ScenesMonica: No!ScenesRoss: How come it’s always us left in the field holding the ball?ScenesMonica: I don’t know. I guess the other people just don’t care enough.Scenes(It starts snowing.)ScenesRoss: Hey! It’s starting to snow.Scenes(They both look up, and watch it start to snow. Then they both start fighting for the ball again.)ScenesRoss: Gimme the this!ScenesMonica: Let go!ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Rachel QuitsScenesWritten by: Michael Curtis and Gregory S. MalinsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are sitting on the couch.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (reading the comics) Eh..., I don’t, I don’t know.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesChandler: Well, as old as he is in dog years, do you think Snoopy should still be allowed to fly this thing?ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: Do you remember when you first came here, how you spent two weeks getting trained by another waitress?ScenesRachel: Oh, sure! Do you need me to train somebody new?ScenesGunther: (laughs) Good one. Actually, ah, Terry wants you to take the training again, whenever.ScenesRachel: (to Chandler) Eh, do you believe that?ScenesChandler: (thinks about it) Yeah?ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway of Ross’s building, there is a Brown Bird girl selling cookies, as Ross and Chandler come up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Sarah: So that’s two boxes of the Holiday Macaroons. On behalf of the Brown Birds of America, I salute you. (Does the Brown Bird salute, she blows on a bird call, then holds her hand, palm facing out, next to her face, and then waves it like a bird flapping it’s wings.)ScenesRoss: Just admit it Chandler, you have no backhand.ScenesChandler: Excuse me little one, I have a very solid backhand.ScenesRoss: Shielding your face and shrieking like a girl... is not a backhand.ScenesChandler: I was shrieking... like a Marine.Scenes(they both start up the stairs.)ScenesRoss: All right here. Watch me execute the three ‘P’s of championship play. Power. (swings the racquet) Precision. (swings the racquet.) and penache. (does a backswing and hits Sarah who’s started up the stairs, knocking her down, they both watch in horror.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, the gang’s all there discussing the incident.]
rows.Content: Monica: You broke a little girl’s leg?!!ScenesRoss: I know. I feel horrible. Okay.ScenesChandler: (reading the paper) Says here that a muppet got whacked on Seasame Street last night. (to Ross) Where exactly were around ten-ish?ScenesRoss: Well, I’m gonna go see her. I want to bring her something, what do you think she’ll like?ScenesMonica: Maybe a Hello Kitty doll, the ability to walk...Scenes(Rachel starts to laugh, and Ross notices her.)ScenesRachel: I’m gonna get back to retraining. (gets up)ScenesRoss: All right, see you guys. (starts to leave)ScenesChandler: Look out kids, he’s coming! (Ross continues to leave with his head down in shame.)ScenesJoey: And I gotta go sell some Christmas trees.ScenesPhoebe: Have fun. Oh wait, no, don’t! I forgot I am totally against that now.ScenesJoey: What? Me having a job?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, I am against innocent trees being cut down in their prime, and their, their corpses grotesquely dressed in like tinsel and twinkly lights. (to Joey) Hey, how do you sleep at night?ScenesJoey: Well, I’m pretty tired from lugging the trees around all day. Hey, Phoebe listen, you got this all wrong. Those trees were born to be Christmas trees, their fulfilling their life purpose, by, by making people happy.ScenesPhoebe: Really?Scenes(Phoebe turns and looks at Monica, while Joey frantically motions to Chandler to help him out.)ScenesChandler: Yes. Yes, and ah, ah, the trees are happy too, because for most of them, it’s the only chance to see New York.Scenes[cut to Gunther retraining Rachel.]ScenesGunther: ...and after you’ve delivered the drinks, you take the empty tray....ScenesRachel: Gunther, Gunther, please, I’ve worked here for two and a half years, I know the empty trays go over there. (points to the counter.)ScenesGunther: What if you put them here. (sets the empty tray on another stack of empty trays on the back counter.)ScenesRachel: Huh. Well, y'know that’s actually a really good idea, because that way they’ll be closer to the mugs. Y'know what, you should have the other waitresses do that too.ScenesGunther: They already do. That’s why they call it the ‘tray spot.’ScenesRachel: Gee, I always heard them talk about that, I just always thought that it was a club they went to. Oh God, I’m, I’m sorry. (walks away)ScenesGunther: It’s all right. Sweetheart.

rows.Scenes: Sarah’s bedroom, her room is decorated with a space motif.]
rows.Content: Ross: So, this must be kinda neat for ya, huh? I mean, your Dad tells me that you get a couple of days off school, and you, you ah, don’t have to sell those cookies anymore.ScenesSarah: Well, I kinda wanted to sell the cookies. The girl who sells the most wins a trip to Spacecamp, and gets to sit in a real space shuttle.ScenesRoss: Wow, you ah, you really like all this space stuff, huh?ScenesSarah: Yeah. My Dad says if I spend as much time helping him clean apartments, as I do daydreaming about outer space, he’d be able to afford a trip to the Taj Mahal.ScenesRoss: I think you would have to clean a whole lot of apartments to go all the way to India.ScenesSarah: No. The one in Atlantic City, Dad loves the slots. He says he’s gonna double the college money my Grandma left me.ScenesRoss: Huh. Well, good luck to Dad. Say, how many more boxes would you have to sell in order to win?ScenesSarah: The girl who won last year sold four hundred and seventy-five.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesSarah: So far, I’ve sold seventy-five.ScenesRoss: Four hundred, huh? Well, that sounds do-able. (starts to get out his wallet) How much are the boxes?ScenesSarah: Five dollars a box.ScenesRoss: (puts away his wallet) And what is second prize?ScenesSarah: A ten speed bike. But, I’d rather have something my Dad couldn’t sell.ScenesRoss: Well, that makes sense.ScenesSarah: Could you do me one favor, if it’s not too much trouble?ScenesRoss: Yeah, Sarah, anything.ScenesSarah: Could you pull open the curtains for me? The astronauts from the space shuttle are gonna be on the news, and since we don’t have a TV, the lady across the alley said she’d push hers up to a window, so I could watch it.

rows.Scenes: A hallway, Ross is selling Brown Bird cookies for Sarah, he stops and knocks on a door.]
rows.Content: Woman: (looking through her peephole, we see Ross standing in the hallway.) Yesss?ScenesRoss: Hi, I’m selling Brown Bird cookies.ScenesWoman: You’re no Brown Bird, I can see you through my peephole.ScenesRoss: No, hi, I’m, I’m an honorary Brown Bird (does the Brown Bird salute.)ScenesWoman: What does that mean?ScenesRoss: Ah, well, it means that I can sell cookies, but I’m not invited to sleep-overs.ScenesWoman: I can dial 9-1-1 at the touch of a button, y'know. Now, go away!ScenesRoss: No, please, please, um, it’s for a poor little girl who wants to go to Spacecamp more than anything in the world.ScenesWoman: I’m pressing, a policeman is on his way.ScenesRoss: Okay, okay! I’m going. I’m going. (goes across the hall to knock on another door.)ScenesWoman: I can still see you!ScenesRoss: All right!!

rows.Scenes: Joey’s work, selling Christmas trees.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (walking up to Joey) Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey. What, what are you doing here?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I-I thought a lot about what you said, and um, I realilized duh, all right maybe I was a little judgmental. Yeah, (looks at the tree) oh, but oh...ScenesJoey: Look now, Phoebe remember, hey, their just fulfilling their Christmas....ScenesPhoebe: Destiny.ScenesJoey: Sure.ScenesPhoebe: Yes.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (One of Joey’s co-workers, walks by with a dead tree.) Yikes! That one doesn’t look very fulfilled.ScenesJoey: Oh, that’s, that’s ah, one of the old ones, he’s just taking it to the back.ScenesPhoebe: You keep the old ones in the back, that is so ageist.ScenesJoey: Well we have to make room for the fresh ones.ScenesPhoebe: So, what happens to the old guys?ScenesJoey: Well, they go into the chipper.ScenesPhoebe: Why, do I have a feeling that’s not as happy as it sounds? (Joey points out one going into the chipper to her, as this haunty, demonic music starts to play in the background) No! Nooooo!!! (she winces in horror and hides her face against Joey’s shoulder, as she sees the tree spit out from the chipper.)ScenesJoey: (to the guy operating the chipper) Hey! Hey!! (makes the ‘cut it’ motion with his hands)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, all except Phoebe are there, Ross is telling the gang, minus Rachel who’s still being retrained, about the different cookie options.]
rows.Content: Ross: ...and these come in the shapes of your favourite Christmas characters, Santa, Rudolph, and Baby Jesus.ScenesJoey: All right, I’ll take a box of the cream filled Jesus’s.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, one box! Come on, I’m trying to send a little girl to Spacecamp, I’m putting you down for five boxes. Chandler, what about you?ScenesChandler: Ahh, do you have any coconut flavoured deities?ScenesRoss: No, but ah, there’s coconut in the Hanukkah Menoreoes. I tell you what, I’ll put you down for eight boxes, one for each night.Scenes(Chandler mouths ‘Okay.’)ScenesRoss: Mon?ScenesMonica: All right, I’ll take one box of the mint treasures, just one, and that’s it. I-I started gaining weight after I joined the Brown Birds. (to Ross) Remember, how Dad bought all my boxes and I ate them all?ScenesRoss: Ah, no Mon, Dad had to buy everyone of your boxes because you ate them all. But ah, y'know I’m sure that’s not gonna happen this time, why don’t I put you down for three of the mint treasures and just a couple of the Rudolph’s.ScenesMonica: No.ScenesRoss: Oh, come on, now you know you want ‘em.ScenesMonica: Don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t, don’t do this.ScenesRoss: I’ll tell you what Mon, I’ll give you the first box for free.ScenesMonica: (she reaches out for it and stops) Oh God! I gotta go! (runs out)ScenesRoss: Come on! All the cool kids are eating ‘em! (chases after her.)Scenes[cut to Gunther retraining Rachel.]ScenesGunther: And when you have a second later, I wanna show you why we don’t just trap spiders under coffee mugs and leave them there.ScenesRachel: (sitting down next to Chandler) I’m training to be better at a job that I hate, my life officially sucks.ScenesJoey: Look Rach, wasn’t this supposed to a temporary thing? I thought you wanted to do fashion stuff?ScenesRachel: Well, yeah! I’m still pursuing that.ScenesChandler: How... exactly are you pursuing that? Y'know other than sending out resumes like what, two years ago?ScenesRachel: Well, I’m also sending out.... good thoughts.ScenesJoey: If you ask me, as long as you got this job, you’ve got nothing pushing you to get another one. You need the fear.ScenesRachel: The fear?ScenesChandler: He’s right, if you quit this job, you then have motivation to go after a job you really want.ScenesRachel: Well then how come you’re still at a job that you hate, I mean why don’t you quit and get ‘the fear’?Scenes(Chandler and Joey both laugh)ScenesChandler: Because, I’m too afraid.ScenesRachel: I don’t know, I mean I would give anything to work for a designer, y'know, or a buyer.... Oh, I just don’t want to be 30 and still work here.ScenesChandler: Yeah, that’d be much worse than being 28, and still working here.ScenesGunther: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesGunther: Remind me to review with you which pot is decaf and which is regular.ScenesRachel: Can’t I just look at the handles on them?ScenesGunther: You would think.ScenesRachel: Okay, fine. Gunther, y'know what, I am a terrible waitress, do you know why I’m a terrible waitress? Because, I don’t care. I don’t care. I don’t care which pot is regular and which pot is decaf, I don’t care where the tray spot is, I just don’t care, this is not what I want to do. So I don’t think I should do it anymore. I’m gonna give you my weeks notice.ScenesGunther: What?!ScenesRachel: Gunther, I quit.ScenesChandler: (to Joey) Does this mean we’re gonna have to start paying for coffee? (Joey shrugs his shoulders.)ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler is entering numbers on a calculator as Ross reads off how much he’s sold.]
rows.Content: Ross: ....and 12, 22, 18, four... (Chandler starts laughing) What?ScenesChandler: I spelled out boobies.ScenesMonica: (comes up and starts looking through Ross’s cookie supply) Ross, but me down for another box of the mint treasures, okay. Where, where are the mint treasures?ScenesRoss: Ah, we’re out. I sold them all.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: Monica, I’m cutting you off.ScenesMonica: No. No, just, just, just a couple more boxes. It-it-it’s no big deal, all right, I’m-I’m cool. You gotta help me out with a couple more boxes!ScenesRoss: Mon, look at yourself. You have cookie on your neck.ScenesMonica: (covers her neck) Oh God! (runs to the bathroom)ScenesChandler: So, how many have you sold so far?ScenesRoss: Check this out. Five hundred and seventeen boxes!ScenesChandler: Oh my God, how did you do that?ScenesRoss: Okay, the other night I was leaving the museum just as ‘Laser Floyd’ was letting out of the planetarium, without even trying I sold 50 boxes! That’s when it occurred to me, the key to my success, ‘the munchies.’ So I ah, started hitting the NYU dorms around midnight. I am selling cookies by the case. They call me: 'Cookie Dude!'ScenesRachel: (entering) Okay, stop what you’re doing, I need envelope stuffers, I need stamp lickers.....ScenesRoss: Well hey, who did these resumes for ya?ScenesChandler: Me! On my computer.ScenesRoss: Well you sure used a large font.ScenesChandler: Eh, yeah, well ah, waitress at a coffee shop and cheer squad co-captain only took up so much room.ScenesRachel: Hey-hey-hey that’s funny! Your funny Chandler! Your a funny guy! You wanna know what else is really funny?!ScenesChandler: Something else I might have said?ScenesRachel: I don’t know, I don’t know, weren’t you the guy that told me to quit my job when I had absolutely nothing else to do. Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha! Ha!!ScenesRoss: Sweetie, calm down, it’s gonna be okay.ScenesRachel: No, it’s not gonna be okay Ross, tomorrow is my last day, and I don’t have a lead. Okay, y'know what, I’m just gonna, I’m just gonna call Gunther and I’m gonna tell him, I’m not quitting.ScenesChandler: You-you-you don’t wanna give into the fear.ScenesRachel: You and your stupid fear. I hate your fear. I would like to take you and your fear....ScenesJoey: (entering, interrupting Rachel) Hey! I got great news!ScenesChandler: Run, Joey! Run for your life! (runs out)ScenesJoey: What? Rachel, listen, have you ever heard of Fortunata Fashions?ScenesRachel: No.ScenesJoey: Well my old man is doing a plumbing job down there and he heard they have an opening. So, you want me to see if I can get you an interview?ScenesRachel: Oh my God! Yes, I would love that, oh, that is soo sweet, Joey.ScenesJoey: Not a problem.ScenesRachel: Thanks.ScenesJoey: And now for the great news.ScenesRoss: What, that wasn’t the great news?ScenesJoey: Only if you think it’s better than this... (holds up an aerosol can) snow-in-a-can!! I got it at work. Mon, you want me to decorate the window, give it a kind of Christmas lookie.ScenesMonica: Christmas cookie?

rows.Scenes: Joey work, Joey is showing a guy a tree.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, and ah, this one here is a Douglas Fir, now it’s a little more money, but you get a nicer smell.ScenesGuy: Looks good. I’ll take it.ScenesPhoebe: (running up carrying a tree) Wait, wait, wait, wait, wait! No, no, you don’t want that one. No, you can have this cool brown one. (points to the almost dead tree she has)ScenesGuy: It’s-it’s-it’s almost dead!ScenesPhoebe: Okay but that’s why you have to buy it, so it can fulfil it’s Christmas destiny, otherwise there gonna throw it into the chipper. Tell him, JoeyScenesJoey: Yeah, the ah, trees that don’t fulfil their Christmas destiny are thrown in the chipper.ScenesGuy: I-I think I’m gonna look around a little bit more.ScenesJoey: Pheebs, you gotta stop this, I working on commission here.ScenesMonica: (entering) Hey, guys. I’m here to pick out my Christmas tree.ScenesPhoebe: Well look no further, (shows her the dead one) this one’s yours! Ahhh.ScenesMonica: Is this the one that I threw out last year?ScenesPhoebe: All right y'know what, nevermind! Everyone wants to have a green one! I’m sorry, I’m sorry, I didn’t mean to get so emotional, I guess it’s just the holidays, it’s hard.ScenesMonica: Oh honey, is that ‘cause your Mom died around Christmas?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I wasn’t even thinking about that.ScenesMonica: Oh. (turns and looks at Joey, who gives a ‘way-to-go’ thumbs up and smile.)

rows.Scenes: A Brown Bird meeting, Ross is there with the other Brown Birds to see who won the contest.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to the girl sitting next to him) Hi there. How many, how many ah, did you sell?ScenesGirl: I’m not gonna tell you! You’re the bad man who broke Sarah’s leg.ScenesRoss: Hey now! That was an accident, okay.ScenesGirl: You’re a big scrud.ScenesRoss: What’s a scrud?ScenesGirl: Why don’t you look in the mirror, scrud.ScenesRoss: I don’t have too. I can just look at you.ScenesLeader: All right girls, and man. Let’s see your final tallies. (all the girls raise their hands) Ohhhh, Debbie, (looks at her form) 321 boxes of cookies, (to Debbie) Very nice.ScenesRoss: (to himself) Not nice enough.ScenesLeader: Charla, 278. Sorry, dear, but still good.ScenesRoss: (to himself) Good for a scrud.ScenesLeader: Oh, yes Elizabeth. Ah, 871.ScenesRoss: That’s crap!! Sister Brown Bird. (to Elizabeth) Good going. (does the salute)ScenesLeader: Who’s next? (goes over and stands behind Ross, who’s feverishly writing on his form, and clears her throat to get his attention.)ScenesRoss: Hi there!ScenesLeader: Hi. And batting for Sarah, Ross Geller, 872. Although, it looks like you bought an awful lot of cookies yourself.ScenesRoss: Um, that is because my doctor says that I have a very serious.... nuget.... diffency.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Phoebe, and Ross are there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Tell us what happened, Brown Bird Ross.ScenesRoss: Well, I lost. Some little girl loaned her uniform to her nineteen year old sister, who went down to the U.S.S. Nimitz, and sold over 2,000 boxes.ScenesChandler: (to Rachel, who’s entering) Hey! How’d the interview go?ScenesRachel: Oh, I blew it. I wouldn’t of even hired me.ScenesRoss: Oh, come here sweetie, listen, you’re gonna go on like a thousand interviews before you get a job. (she glares at him) That’s not how that was supposed to come out.ScenesPhoebe: This is the worst Christmas ever.ScenesChandler: Y'know what Rach, maybe you should just, y'know stay here at the coffee house.ScenesRachel: I can’t! It’s too late! Terry already hired that girl over there. (points to her) Look at her, she’s even got waitress experience. Last night she was teaching everybody how to make napkin.... (starts to cry) swans.ScenesRoss: That word was swans.

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the two apartments, Chandler, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are coming up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Well seeing that drunk Santa wet himself, really perked up my Christmas.Scenes(They start to go into Monica and Rachel’s, their apartment is filled with all of the old Christmas trees from Joey’s work.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Oh my God!ScenesJoey and Monica: (jumping up from behind the couch) Merry Christmas!!ScenesPhoebe: You saved them! You guys! Oh God, you’re the best!ScenesChandler: It’s like ‘Night of the Living Dead Christmas Trees.’Scenes(phone rings)ScenesRachel: (answering the phone) Hello? (listens) Yeah, this is she. (listens) Oh! You’re kidding! You’re kidding! (listens) Oh thank you! I love you!ScenesChandler: Sure, everybody loves a kidder.ScenesRachel: (hanging up the phone) I got the job!ScenesAll: That’s great! Hey! Excellent!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, God bless us, everyone.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Rachel is serving her last cup of coffee.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Here we go. I’m serving my last cup of coffee. (the gang starts humming the graduation theme) There you go. (hands it to Chandler) Enjoy. (they all cheer)ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Should I tell her I ordered tea?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesRachel: Um, excuse me, everyone. Ah, this is my last night working here, and I ah, just wanted say that I made some really good friends working here, and ah, it’s just time to move on. (at the counter Gunther starts to cry and runs into the back room) Ah, and no offence to everybody who ah, still works here, you have no idea how good it feels to say that as of this moment I will never have to make coffee again.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s new job, Rachel’s boss is telling her what to do.]
rows.Content: Rachel’s Boss: Now Mr. Kaplan Sr. likes his coffee strong, so your gonna use two bags instead of one, see. Now pay attention, ‘cause this part’s tricky, see some people use filters just once.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: The hallway between the apartments, Ross is bringing Sarah to Joey and Chandler’s.]
rows.Content: Ross: I’m, I’m sorry you didn’t get to go to Spacecamp, and I’m hoping that maybe somehow, this may make up for it. Presenting Sarah Tuttle’s Private Very Special Spacecamp!! (opens the door and Chandler and Joey jump up, their apartment is decorated like outer space, one of the leather chairs is covered in tinfoil.)ScenesSarah: Really Mr. Geller, you don’t have to do this.ScenesRoss: Oh come on! Here we go! (picks her up and puts her in the chair) Stand by for mission countdown!ScenesJoey: (simulating an echo) Ten, ten.., nine, nine, nine...., eight, eight, eight... (Chandler hits him in the back of the head) Okay, Blast off!Scenes(They start shaking the chair likes it’s flying into outer space. Ross picks up a soccer ball and starts spinning it in his hand and runs around the chair beeping like a satellite. Chandler also starts running around the chair and saying...)ScenesChandler: I’m an alien. I’m an alien.ScenesRoss: Oh no! An asteroid! (throws the soccer ball off the back of Joey’s head.)Scenes(The camera zooms in on Sarah and she has a big smile on her face.)ScenesEndScenesThe One Where Chandler Can’t Remember Which SisterScenesWritten by: Alexa JungeScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, Joey, and Rachel are there, Joey is demonstrating a card trick.]
rows.Content: Joey: Okay, pick a card, any card. (Monica picks one) All right, now memorize it. Show to everybody. Got it?ScenesMonica: Um-mm.ScenesJoey: All right, give it back to me. (takes the card back, but he looks at the card before he puts it back in the deck, he holds the deck to his forehead, and thinks a little while) 5 of hearts.Scenes(Monica is sarcastically amazed.)ScenesRoss: Real magic does exist.ScenesRachel: Wow.ScenesMonica: Wow. Joey, (sarcastically) how do you do it?ScenesJoey: I can’t tell you that, no.Scenes(We hear some knocking coming from the ceiling.)ScenesRoss: Ah, somebody’s at the door on the ceiling.ScenesRachel: Noo, that’s our unbelievably loud upstairs neighbor.ScenesMonica: He took up the carpet, and now you can hear everything.ScenesPhoebe: Why don’t you go up there and ask him to ‘step lightly, please?’ScenesMonica: I have like five times, but the guy is so charming, that I go up there to yell and then I end up apologizing to him.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, that is silly. (gets up) I’ll go up there, I’ll tell him to keep it down.ScenesMonica: All right, be my guest.ScenesRachel: Good luck.Scenes(Phoebe exits)ScenesJoey: All right, all right, all right, all right, all right, you really wanna know how I did it, I’ll show ya. When you handed me back the card, what you didn’t see was, I looked at it so fast that it was invisible to the naked eye. (picks up a card and quickly looks at it) I just did it. (does it again) I just did it, again. Here, I’ll slow it down so that you guys can see it. (looks and the card in slow motion)ScenesAll: Oh, I got it.Scenes(We hear Phoebe knock at the door upstairs, and the guy answer it.)ScenesPhoebe: (muffled through the floor) Yeah, look I was with my friend downstairs and we hear everything up here that you do, and I am sick and tired... (I tired but the rest is unintelligible).ScenesGuy: (muffled) Whoa, you are very beautiful.ScenesPhoebe: (muffled) Oh, thank you.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (entering) Hey, anybody got a length of rope about six feet long with a little nouse at the end?ScenesMonica: Honey, what’s the matter?ScenesChandler: I just saw Janice.ScenesAll: Oh.ScenesChandler: Yeah, she was at Rockefeller Center skating with her husband, she looked so happy. I almost feel bad for whipping that kid’s pretzel at them.ScenesJoey: Man, I remember the first time I saw that girl Katherine, after we broke up. She was just walking with her friend Donna, just laughing and talking. God, it killed me.ScenesChandler: Yes, but you ended up having sex with both of them that afternoon.ScenesJoey: Sorry, I just, any excuse to tell that story y'know....ScenesRoss: Hey Chandler, there’s a party tomorrow, you’ll feel better then.ScenesChandler: Oh, y'know what, I’m gonna be okay, you don’t have to throw a party for me.ScenesMonica: It’s Joey’s birthday.ScenesChandler: Oh, well then, if anybody should have a party it should be him.Scenes(We hear Phoebe’s muffled voice through the ceiling.)ScenesMonica: Sush!! I cannot believe she is still up there.Scenes(We hear the guy telling a joke, and Phoebe laughing.)ScenesChandler: Okay, well he totally screwed up the punch line. Y'know, it’s supposed to be arrghh-eh og-errigh.

rows.Scenes: Fortunata Fashions, Rachel’s new job.]
rows.Content: Mr. Kaplan: (entering) How’s that coffee comin,’ dear?ScenesRachel: (jumping up from reading her magazine) Yeah, right away Mr. Kaplan.ScenesMr. Kaplan: I’m not supposed to drink coffee, it makes me gassy.ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesMr. Kaplan: I’ll bet your thinking, ‘What’s an intelligent girl who wants to be in fashion, doing making coffee?’ Eh?ScenesRachel: Op.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Eh.ScenesRachel: Oh, you got me.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Well, don’t think I haven’t noticed your potential. Well, I’ve got a project for you that’s a lot more related to fashion. How does that sound?ScenesRachel: Oh, that sounds great.ScenesMr. Kaplan: Come on over here, sweetheart. (they walk over to a storage closet)ScenesRachel: Oh thank you so much Mr. Kaplan, thank you so much.ScenesMr. Kaplan: (opening the closet door revealing that it’s full of tangled up hangers.) I need these hangers separated ASAP. (she is stunned) You’re welcome.

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner, Rachel is talking to Monica about her job.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh God, I hate my job, I hate it, I hate my job, I hate it.ScenesMonica: I know honey, I’m sorry.ScenesRachel: Oh, I wanna quit, but then I think I should stick it out, then I think why would such a person stay in such a demeaning job, just because it’s remotely related to the field they’re interested in.ScenesMonica: (gives her a look) Gee, I don’t know Rach. Order up!! I got a Yentel soup, a James Beans, and a Howdy hold the Dowdy!ScenesRachel: Oh honey, come on, I’m sorry, I didn’t.... I don’t mind paying my dues, y'know, its just how much am I gonna learn about fashion by walking Mira, the arthritic seamstress, to the bathroom.Scenes(A guy at the end of the table starts laughing.)ScenesRachel: (to him) Hi! Is my misery amusing to you?ScenesGuy: I’m sorry, I wa, I wa, I was just ah.... (starts to laugh again)ScenesRachel: It’s not funny, this is actually my job.ScenesGuy: Oh believe me, I-I-I’ve been there. I had to sort mannequin heads at that Mannequins Plus.ScenesRachel: Oh well then, so I’m just going to go back to talking to my friend here. And you can go back to enjoying your little hamburger.ScenesGuy: Ah, just one other thing.ScenesRachel: Yes?!ScenesGuy: I ah, I work at Bloomingdale’s and I might know of a job possibility if your, if your interested?ScenesRachel: (looks at Monica) (to him) Do you want my pickle?

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, it’s Joey’s party.]
rows.Content: Gunther: (to Monica and Phoebe) Hey guys.ScenesMonica: Hey Gunther. Hi. (to Phoebe) I mean you’re going out on a date with the noisy guy upstairs?ScenesPhoebe: Well, he’s very charming.ScenesMonica: I know, he’s too charming, but if you two start going out, then it’s just gonna make it so much harder for me to hate him.ScenesPhoebe: Well, you’re just gonna have to try.ScenesMonica: Joey, where are the Jell-o shots?ScenesJoey: I don’t know, Chandler is supposed to be passin’ ‘em around...Scenes(Camera cuts to show Chandler giving a Jello shot to the ceramic dog and holding an empty tray of Jello shots.)ScenesJoey: Chandler!ScenesChandler: Hello-dillillio!!ScenesRoss: Oh, somebody’s feeling better.ScenesMonica: (to Chandler) Stick out your tongue.ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Take off your shirt!Scenes(Chandler sticks out is tongue and it’s a horrible shade of green.)ScenesMonica: Oh my!!ScenesJoey: Oh my God! How many of these things did you have? These are pure vodka.ScenesChandler: Yeah, Jell-o just like Mom used to make.ScenesRachel: (entering, to Ross) The most unbelievable thing happened to me today.ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: Hi! So I’m out having lunch at Monica’s and this guy starts talking to me, and it turns out he works for a buyer at Bloomingdale’s and there happens to be an opening in his department. So I gave him my phone number and he’s gonna call me this weekend to see if he can get me an interview!ScenesRoss: Wow!ScenesRachel: I know!ScenesRoss: What, so this guy is helping you for no apparent reason?ScenesRachel: Uh-huh!ScenesRoss: And he’s, he’s a total stranger?ScenesRachel: Yeah! His name is um, Mark something.ScenesRoss: Huh. Sounds like Mark Something wants to have some sex.ScenesRachel: What!?ScenesRoss: Well, I’m just saying, I mean why else would he just, y'know, swoop in out of nowhere for no reason.ScenesRachel: To be nice.ScenesRoss: Hey, Joey. Are men ever nice to strange women for no reason?ScenesJoey: No, only for sex.ScenesRoss: Thank you. (to Rachel) So did you ah, did you tell Mark Something about me?ScenesRachel: I didn’t have to, because I was wearing my ‘I heart Ross’ sandwich board and ringing my bell.ScenesRoss: Uh-huh.ScenesJoey’s Sisters: (entering) Joey!!! Happy Birthday!! (all 7 of them look almost identical)ScenesJoey: Hey!! Hey-hey-hey!ScenesChandler: (to Monica) Okay, how many of that girl are you seeing?ScenesMonica: How hammered are you? Huh? These, these are Joey’s sisters.ScenesChandler: Hi Joey’s sisters!ScenesPhoebe: (to one of his sisters, Cookie) Hey!ScenesCookie: Hey. What are we drinkin’ over here.ScenesPhoebe: Well, I have ah, vodka and cranberry juice.ScenesCookie: No kiddin,’ that’s the exact same drink I made myself right after I shot my husband.ScenesPhoebe: Wow. Okay, I don’t know how to talk to you.Scenes(Cut to Chandler)ScenesSister 1: (to Chandler) What ‘cha doing?ScenesChandler: Oh, I’m taking my ex-girlfriend of my speed dialer.ScenesJoey’s Sisters: Oh!!ScenesChandler: No-no-no-no, no, it’s a good thing. Why must we dial so speedily anyway? Why must we rush through life? Why can’t we savor the precious moments? (to one of Joey’s sisters) Those are some huge breasts you have.Scenes(Cut to Ross and Monica)ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesMonica: Hi.ScenesRoss: Yeah. So um, I-I heard about this ah, Mark guy that ah, Rachel met today.ScenesMonica: Isn’t that great?ScenesRoss: Oh yeah! So ah, kinda pretty, pretty good. He sounds like a nice, good guy.ScenesMonica: Oh, he is. And he is so dreamy. I mean, y'know what, when he left I actually used the phrase, ‘Hummina-hummina-hummina.’ (walks away)ScenesRoss: That’s excellent.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica, Phoebe, Ross, and Rachel are eating breakfast.]
rows.Content: Ross: (to Rachel) So, he’s just a nice guy. You really think this Mark doesn’t want anything in exchange for helping him?ScenesRachel: Well, I assume I’ll have to take showers with him, but y'know, that’s true of any job.Scenes(Chandler enters hungover and groaning)ScenesMonica: How ya feelin’?ScenesChandler: Well, my apartment isn’t there anymore, because I drank it.ScenesPhoebe: Where’d you get too? We lost you after you opened up all the presents.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesChandler: Yeah, I ended up in the storage room, and not alone.ScenesAll: Woooo hoooo!!!ScenesChandler: Ow, no ‘woo-hooing,’ no ‘woo-hooing.’ScenesPhoebe: Why, what happened?ScenesChandler: Ah, I fooled around with Joey’s sister. (Phoebe gasps) Well, that’s not the worst part.ScenesMonica: What is the worse part?ScenesChandler: I can’t remember which sister.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel) You see what men do! Don’t tell me men are not nice! (points to Chandler) This is men!!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, continued from earlier.]
rows.Content: Monica: Are you insane? I mean Joey, is going to kill you, he’s actually going to kill you dead.ScenesChandler: Okay! You don’t think I thought of that?ScenesPhoebe: How can you not know which one?ScenesRachel: I mean that’s unbelievable.ScenesMonica: I mean, was it Gina?ScenesRoss: Which one is Gina?ScenesRachel: Dark, big hair, with the airplane earrings.ScenesMonica: No, no, no, that’s Dina.ScenesChandler: (to Monica) You see you can’t tell which one is which either, dwha!!ScenesPhoebe: We didn’t fool around with any of them. Dwha! Dwha!ScenesChandler: Veronica. Look, it’s got to be Veronica, the girl in the red skirt. I definitely stuck my tongue down her throat.ScenesMonica: That was me.ScenesChandler: Look, when I’ve been drinking, sometimes I tend to get overly friendly, and I’m sorry.ScenesMonica: That’s okay.ScenesRachel: That’s all right.ScenesRoss: That’s okay.ScenesJoey: (angrily entering, to Chandler) Can I talk to you for a second?!ScenesRoss: Hey, Joey.ScenesRachel: Hey. (they all walk away from Chandler)ScenesJoey: Come on!! (motions for Chandler to come with him)ScenesChandler: Why can’t we talk in here? With, with, witnesses.ScenesJoey: I just got off the phone with my sister.ScenesRoss: Ah, which, which one?ScenesJoey: Mary-Angela.ScenesRoss: Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesMonica: Y'know which one was she again?ScenesJoey: Why don’t you ask Chandler, ‘cause he’s the one that fooled around with her. She told me you said you could really fall for her. Now is that true? Or are you just gettin’ over Janice by groping my sister.ScenesChandler: It’s gotta be the first one.ScenesJoey: Really? That’s great! You and my sister, sittin’ in a tree.ScenesChandler: Yep, I’m in a tree.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is writing letters as Rachel enters.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Did he call? Did Mark call?ScenesMonica: No honey, I’m sorry, but the weekend’s not over yet.ScenesRachel: Oh. (we hear laughing from the upstairs apartment) Oh my God, is that Phoebe?ScenesMonica: I guess they’re back from their date.Scenes(He starts to play music.)ScenesRachel: Music. Very nice.Scenes(We hear them start making out upstairs.)ScenesMonica: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: So, how are you?ScenesMonica: I am good. I finished my book.Scenes(Things start to get really hot upstairs.)ScenesRachel: Oh yeah, what’s it about?ScenesMonica: I don’t remember. Do you wanna take a walk?ScenesRachel: Yeah, I do. (they both run out)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross is reading a letter that Chandler wrote.]
rows.Content: Ross: Dear Mary-Angela. Hi. How’s it going. This is the hardest letter I’ve ever had to write. (to Chandler) What the hell’s a matter with you? How do you think Joey’s going to react when he finds out that you blew off his sister with a letter?ScenesChandler: Well, that’s the part where you tell him that I moved to France. When actually I’ll be in Cuba.ScenesRoss: All right, look, look, you’ve got to do this yourself, okay in person. At least you know her name. You just go to the house and you ask for Mary-Angela, okay, when which ever one she is comes to the door, you take her for a walk, you let her down easy.ScenesChandler: What if Mary-Angela comes to the door and I ask for Mary-Angela?ScenesRoss: Where in Cuba?

rows.Scenes: Joey’s sister’s house, Chandler hits himself on the head three times and knocks on the door three times. Joey answers it.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (shocked) Joey, what-wh-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-wh-wha-what are you doing here?ScenesJoey: Waiting for my Grandma to finish my laundry. What about you?ScenesChandler: I’m here to see Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: You are so the man! (motions him to come in, and he does) Now look, listen, listen, you got to be cool, ‘cause my Grandma doesn’t know about you two yet, and you do not want to tick her off. She was like the sixth person to spit on Mussolini's hanging body. Yeah.ScenesChandler: Where’s Mary-Angela?ScenesJoey: She’s right in there. (motions to the living room)Scenes(Chandler walks into the living room, and sees all of Joey’s sisters, all wearing red.)ScenesJoey’s Sisters: Hey, Chandler!

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica, Ross, and Rachel are there.]
rows.Content: Rachel: I can’t believe Mark didn’t call. It’s Sunday night, and he didn’t call.ScenesRoss: Bummer.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Yeah, right. Look at you, you’re practically giddy.ScenesRoss: No, I’m genuinely sorry the Mark thing didn’t work out. Look, Rach, I want only good things for you.ScenesMonica: Wait a minute, why don’t you just call Mark. (they both look up in shock) I mean, who says you have to sit here and wait for him, you’ve got to make stuff happen.ScenesRoss: But, you, you don’t want to seem too pushy.ScenesMonica: (to Ross) Honey, it’s not pushy, he gave her his home number.ScenesRoss: (to Rachel, as she gets his number) What, he gave you his home number? As in like, to, to his home?ScenesRachel: Yeah, and you don’t mind if I call, because you only want good things for me.ScenesRoss: That’s right good things, that-that is what I said. (glances at Monica)ScenesRachel: (on phone) Hello, Mark? Hi, it’s Rachel Green. (listens) Oh no, don’t you apologize. (listens) Yeah, I’ll hold. (to Monica and Ross) He left my number at work, but he was helping his niece with her report on the pioneers.ScenesRoss: That is so made up!ScenesRachel: (on phone) Yeah, oh my God, tomorrow! That, no, it’s perfect. Oh God, thank you soo much. Great! Bye! (hangs up phone) I got the interview!ScenesMonica: Yay!ScenesRoss: There you go.ScenesRachel: He even offered to meet me for lunch tomorrow to prep me for it.ScenesMonica: Oh, that is amazing!ScenesRoss: Yeah well, if I know Mark, and I think I do, I’d expect nothing less.ScenesRachel: I got to figure out what I’m going to wear.ScenesRoss: High collar and baggy pants say I’m a pro.ScenesRachel: Yeah! Right! Okay, I’ll see you guys later. (starts to leave) Woo hoo!ScenesRoss: You go get ‘em. (to Monica) What did I do to you? Did I hurt you in some way?ScenesMonica: What?ScenesRoss: ‘Why don’t you call him?!’ Well, thank you very much! Y'know now he is going to prep her, y'know prep her, as in what you do when you surgically remove the boyfriend!ScenesMonica: Are you crazy?!ScenesRoss: Am I! Am I! Am I out of my mind! Am I losing my senses!! This dreamy guy is taking my girlfriend out for a meal.ScenesMonica: What?! Ross y'know this isn’t even about you! I mean this is about Rachel and something wonderful happening for her. I mean you know even if you’re right, what if he wants to sleep with her, does it mean he gets too?ScenesRoss: No.ScenesMonica: I mean don’t you trust her?ScenesRoss: Well, yeah!ScenesMonica: Then get over yourself! Grow up!ScenesRoss: (shyly) You grow up.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s sister’s house, they’re finishing up dinner.]
rows.Content: Chandler: This teramisu is, is excellent. Did you make it Mary-Angela?ScenesJoey’s Grandmother: No! I did!ScenesChandler: Well, it’s, it’s yummy. So Mary-Angela do you like it?ScenesJoey’s Grandmother: Of course! It’s her favorite.ScenesChandler: So um, Mary-Angela, what’s your second favorite?ScenesJoey’s Grandmother: More of Grandma’s teramisu.ScenesChandler: Would you just please....give me the receipt ‘cause this is great. It’s top notch.ScenesJoey’s Grandmother: That dies with me.ScenesChandler: So will I.ScenesJoey’s Sister: Excuse yourself, and go to the bathroom.ScenesChandler: Oh no-no-no I was just squinting. That doesn’t mean anything.ScenesJoey’s Sister: (whispering in his ear) Just do it.ScenesChandler: Will you excuse me I have to um..... (walks to the hall)Scenes[Cut to the hall, Joey’s sister runs up and grabs Chandler’s butt.]ScenesChandler: (startled) Hey!ScenesJoey’s Sister: Finally, I thought we’d never be alone. Can I just tell you something, I have not stopped thinking about you since the party. (kisses him)ScenesChandler: Look, I may have jumped the gun here. (she tries to kiss him, but he ducks it and moves away) Um, I just got out of a relationship and I’m not really in a, in a commitment kind of place.ScenesJoey’s Sister: So! Me neither! God, Mary-Angela was right you do have the softest lips.ScenesChandler: Ahhhh, you’re not Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey’s Sister: No, I’m Mary-Theresa.ScenesChandler: This is so bad. If-if you’re not Mary-Angela, then-then who is?ScenesMary-Angela: (standing behind Chandler) I am!ScenesChandler: Oh, this is soo bad. (doesn’t see Mary-Angela)ScenesMary-Angela: Joey!!!ScenesChandler: No Joey! No Joey! Don’t Joey! Joey!ScenesJoey: What’s goin’ on?ScenesChandler: (pats him on the shoulder) You’re it! Now run and hide!ScenesMary-Theresa: It’s no big deal. Chandler was just kissin’ me because he thought I was Mary-Angela.ScenesJoey: What?! How could you do that, how could you think she was Mary-Angela?ScenesChandler: I wasn’t sure which one Mary-Angela was. (all of Joey’s sisters gasp) Look, I’m sorry okay, I was really drunk, and you all look really similar.ScenesJoey’s Sister: I say, punch him Joey.ScenesAll: Yeah! Punch him!!ScenesChandler: Y'know what, we should all calm down because your brother’s not going to punch me. (to Joey) Are ya?ScenesJoey: Well, that is usually what I would do. But I just never thought you’d be on the receiving end of it. How could you do this?!ScenesChandler: Joey if you wanna punch me, go ahead, I deserve it. But I just want you to know that I would never soberly hurt you or your family, you’re my best friend. I would never do anything like this ever again.ScenesCookie: So what. I say, punch him.ScenesAll: Yeah! Punch him! Punch him!ScenesJoey: No! No! No! No, I’m not going to punch Chandler.ScenesCookie: I’ll do it.ScenesJoey: No you won’t. Look he knows he did a terrible thing and I believe him, he’s sorry. But, (to Chandler) you’ve got one more apology to make, all right, you’ve got to apologize to Mary-Angela.ScenesChandler: Okay, absolutely!ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesChandler: You’ve got it. (he starts to look at his sister’s, but he still doesn’t know which one is Mary-Angela.)ScenesJoey: Cookie, now you can punch him!ScenesChandler: What?! (Cookie punches him)

rows.Scenes: A lobby, Ross is waiting for Rachel, after her interview.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (getting of the elevator and noticing Ross) Hey!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: What are you doing here?ScenesRoss: Ah y'know, this building is on my paper route so I... (gives her a flower)ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesRoss: Hi. (kisses her)ScenesRachel: Hi.ScenesRoss: How’d did it go?ScenesRachel: Oh well, the woman I interviewed with was pretty tough, but y'know thank God Mark coached me, because once I started talking about the fall line, she got all happy and wouldn’t shut up.ScenesRoss: I’m so proud of you.ScenesRachel: Me too!ScenesRoss: Listen, I’m ah, I’m sorry I’ve been so crazy and jealous and, it’s just that I like you a lot, so...ScenesRachel: I know.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesMark: Rachel?ScenesRachel: Yeah. (turns around) Hi Mark!ScenesMark: Hi. I just talked to Joanna, and she loves you. You got it, you got the job.ScenesRachel: Oh, I did!ScenesMark: Yes.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Oh my God!! (she turns around and hugs Mark, not Ross)ScenesRoss: Congratu!! (sees her hug Mark) -lations-lations.ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, The entire gang is there.]
rows.Content: Monica: So ah, Phoebe, how was your date?ScenesPhoebe: Oh well y'know. (laughs)ScenesMonica: Yeah, I do know.ScenesPhoebe: Ick, you were eavesdropping.ScenesRachel: Eavesdropping. Pheebs, the ceiling tiles were falling down.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I’m sorry. But I really like this guy. And I think he really happens to like me.Scenes(We hear the sound of a bed creaking through the ceiling, and him moaning.)ScenesRoss: Maybe he’s just jumping on a pogo-stick and really likes it?Scenes(We hear a women start moaning.)ScenesRoss: Maybe the pogo-stick likes it too?ScenesJoey: All right, that’s it! He cannot do this to Phoebe. (gets up) This guy is going to get the butt kicking of a lifetime! (stops and turns around and asks Rachel) But, is he a big guy?ScenesRoss: Ah, we’ll all go. (motions to Chandler) Come on. (the guys leave)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks you guys! Thank you.ScenesChandler: Don’t worry.ScenesPhoebe: God, I hope they kick his ass!ScenesRachel: Honey, I’m sorry.ScenesMonica: Y'know if it’s any consolation, he really did sound like he was having more fun with you. (Rachel nods in agreement)Scenes(We the guys knock on the door upstairs, and the guy answering it.)ScenesGuy: (muffled) May I help you?Scenes(We hear the guys start to attack him, but the guy manages to calm them down and gets them to agree to what he did. Monica throws up her hands in disgust.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With All The JealousyScenesWritten by: Doty AbramsScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is getting ready for her first day.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (running in from her bedroom, wearing only a towel) Okay. Hey. Umm. Does everybody hate these shoes?ScenesChandler: Oh yeah, but don't worry. I don't think anybody's gonna focus on that as long as your wearing that towel dress.ScenesRachel: (to Ross) Tell him.ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) It's her first day at this new job. Your not supposed to start with her!ScenesChandler: All right, I suppose I can wait a day. Hey, what are you doing Friday?ScenesRoss: Why?ScenesChandler: I need you to come to this bachelor party for my weird cousin Albert, y'know he's the botanist.ScenesRoss: Oh God. Y'know, botanists are such geeks.ScenesChandler: Yeah. Is that a dinosaur tie?ScenesRoss: Hmm? Oh, yeah. (he makes a growling sound)ScenesPhoebe: (entering, with about 20 purses hanging around her neck) Morning. Rach, I'm here with the purses!ScenesChandler: (to Phoebe) It must take you forever to find your keys.ScenesRachel: (running into the living room) Thank you, thank you, thank you, Pheebs.ScenesPhoebe: Your welcome, oh please not the one with the turtles.ScenesRachel: No, no, no, no turtles scare me. I don't need that today.ScenesRoss: Honey, just relax, it's gonna be fine. Hey, umm,. why don't I come down there and I'll take you out to lunch?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, thank you, but Mark's taking me out.ScenesRoss: Mark is that ah, the same Mark that helped you get the job?ScenesRachel: Yeah, it's kinda like a 'good luck on your first day' sort of thing. (to Phoebe) Is this actually a lunchbox?ScenesPhoebe: Umm, no, it's a purse. And there's a thermos in it.ScenesRachel: Oh.ScenesChandler: (to Ross) Hey, so can you make it on Friday?ScenesRoss: What? Oh yeah, yeah I think so. Why am I invited to this again?ScenesChandler: Well apparently Albert has no friends. He's very excited about the bachelor party though. I think actually the only reason he's getting married is so he can see a stripper.ScenesPhoebe: A stripper at a bachelor party, that is so clich�. Why don't you get a magician?!ScenesChandler: Well, if the magician can open my beer with his but cheeks, then all right.ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Ross and Chandler are entering, Joey is on the phone.]
rows.Content: Ross: She's having lunch with him. She's having lunch with him. And you should of seen the hug she gave him when she got the job. And, and, and, (to Joey) he's really good looking. (Joey gives an enthusiastic thumbs up) What am I gonna do?ScenesChandler: Don't do anything. Keep it inside. Learn how to hide your feelings! (pause) Don't cry outloud.ScenesJoey: (hanging up the phone) Yes! Guess who's in an audition for a Broadway musical?ScenesChandler: I want to say you but, that seems like such an easy answer.ScenesJoey: It is me! It's a musical version of Tale of Two Cities. So I think I'm gonna sing New York, New York, and ah, oh I left My Heart in San Francisco.ScenesRoss: Ah Joey, I don't think you get to pick the cities.ScenesJoey: What?ScenesRoss: Mr. Dickens gets to pick 'em.ScenesJoey: Who?ScenesChandler: I'll get you the Cliff Notes.ScenesJoey: The what?ScenesChandler: The abridgment.ScenesJoey: Oh, okay. (to Ross) The what?

rows.Scenes: Rachel's office, Mark is training Rachel.]
rows.Content: Mark: ...and the style number, and the invoice number, and the shipping date. Good. Any questions so far?ScenesRachel: Yeah. What kind of discount do we get?ScenesMark: Twenty percent.ScenesRachel: Oh!! I love this job! (her phone rings) Wow! My first call.ScenesMark: Here, let me. (answers phone) Rachel Green's line, how may I help you?ScenesRoss: (on phone) Hi, is Rachel there?ScenesMark: And who may I say is calling?ScenesRoss: This is Ross?ScenesMark: Ross of.....ScenesRoss: Of Ross and Rachel.ScenesMark: Oh hi. It's, it's Mark.ScenesRoss: Oh hey, hey Mark.ScenesMark: Hey, hold on a second.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: Hi honey!ScenesRoss: Hi! What's ah, what's Mark doing answering your phone?ScenesRachel: Oh, he's just goofing around.ScenesRoss: Ohhhhh yeah, that's, that's funny. Why ah, why isn't he goofing around in his own office?ScenesRachel: Oh honey, this is his office too. I told you we're Joanna's two assistants.ScenesRoss: Why does Joanna need two assistants, how, how lazy is she?ScenesRachel: Oh! Oh my God! What did I just do?ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I think I just shipped 3,000 bras to personnel. Oh honey, I gotta go. (to Mark) Mark, I need you!ScenesRoss: Okay, bye-bye. (starts slamming the receiver down in anger.)ScenesRachel: Ow! Ross!!ScenesRoss: Oh, oh, I'm, I'm, I'm sorry sweetie, I was just trying to ah, I'm dialing another number. (hangs up)

rows.Scenes: The Moondance diner, Monica is cleaning up with one of the waiters, with her back turned to him she removes her fake breasts and hides them under her wig.]
rows.Content: Jeannine: (to Monica) All right, I just got changed in thirty seconds so you can be alone with him. You'd better go for it.ScenesMonica: Please, I'm not going for anything.ScenesJeannine: Well, if you don't, I will.ScenesMonica: Would you please go?ScenesJeannine: Night Mon. Night Julio.ScenesJulio: (to Jeannine) Adios.Scenes(Monica starts wiping down the stools, as Julio follows along behind her replacing the napkin holders.)ScenesMonica: Look Julio, someone left their book here.ScenesJulio: Ah actually, that is mine.ScenesMonica: Oh yeah, what are you reading?ScenesJulio: Flowers of Evil, by Beaudalire. Have you read it?ScenesMonica: Have I read it? (pause) No, are you enjoying it?ScenesJulio: I thought I would, but the translation's no good.ScenesMonica: Your a poet and don't know it. (she turns away and makes a face like 'I can't believe I just said that.')ScenesJulio: Actually I ah, I am a poet.ScenesMonica: Oh, then you do know it. (pause) So um what kind of things do you write about?ScenesJulio: Things that move me. The, the shadow of a tree, a child laughing, or this lip. (points to her lip)ScenesMonica: Mine? (points to her lower lip) Right here?ScenesJulio: I can write an epic poem about this lip. (grabs her lower lip)ScenesMonica: How would that go? (they kiss) Well, it didn't rhyme, but I liked it.

rows.Scenes: Joey's audition.]
rows.Content: Joey: (singing) You've got to pick a pocket or two. Boyyyyssss, (picks a handkerchief from the pianist's pocket) you've got to pick a pocket or two..........ScenesDirector: Lovely, just lovely.ScenesJoey: Really? Thanks.ScenesDirector: Listen Joey, we definitely want to see you for the callback on Saturday.ScenesJoey: Excellent, I'll be there.ScenesDirector: Okay, and listen don't forget to bring your jazz shoes for the dance audition.ScenesJoey: Ahhh! My ah, my agent said it wasn't a dancing part.ScenesDirector: Joey, all the roles got to dance a little. But believe me with your dance background it'll be a piece of cake.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is reading Joey's resume.]
rows.Content: Chandler: ....three years of modern dance with Twila Tharp! Five years with the American Ballet Theater?!ScenesJoey: Hey, everybody lies on their resume, okay. I wasn't one of the Zoom Kids either.ScenesPhoebe: Well, can you dance at all?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I can dance, y'know. (starts to dance really, really, really badly)ScenesChandler: Oh no, no, no, no.ScenesPhoebe: (covering her mouth in shock) What, what is that?ScenesJoey: Sure, it looks stupid now, there's no music playing.Scenes(phone rings)ScenesChandler: All right, I have to get that, but no-no. (answering phone) Hello? (listens) (happily) Hi! Yeah listen, I'm, I'm in need of a stripper and I was told that you do that. (listens) Let me ask you this, what, what do you do for the extra hundred? (listens) So would I, would I have to provide the grapes?ScenesMonica: (entering) Hi!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, how was last night with Julio, senorita?ScenesMonica: It was soo amazing, he is so sexy, and smart, which makes him even sexier. Oh gosh, I gotta so you this. Last night, we were fooling around and he stops to write a poem.ScenesJoey: Get out! I couldn't stop if a meteor hit me.ScenesChandler: Okay, we have our stripper. A miss Crystal Chandelier.ScenesJoey: Well sure, you name a kid that, what do you expect them to grow up to be?ScenesMonica: Anyway um, when he left he forgot to take the poem with him. Now, I am like totally dense about poetry, but I think it's pretty good all right. Check it out. (hands them the poem)ScenesJoey: (reading) The Empty Vase. Translucent beauty...ScenesChandler: To yourself. (finishing) Hey-hey-hey, y'know what that's pretty good.ScenesMonica: Oh good, I think so too. Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Oh yeah.ScenesMonica: Oh, I'm so glad you guys like it. Yay! All right I gotta go to work. (tries to take the poem)ScenesJoey: Whoa, I'm not done.ScenesMonica: All right, just give it back to me when your done. See you guys.ScenesChandler: Bye-bye.Scenes(Monica leaves)ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, oh my God! Poor Monica!ScenesChandler: What, what, what?!ScenesPhoebe: What?! He was with her when he wrote this poem. Look, (reading) 'My vessel so empty with nothing inside. Now that I've touched you, you seem emptier still.' He thinks Monica is empty, she is the empty vase!ScenesChandler: You really think that is what he meant?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, totally. Oh, God, oh, she seemed so happy too.ScenesJoey: Done.

rows.Scenes: Rachel's office, her desk is covered with stuff Ross has sent her.]
rows.Content: Mark: (reaching through the flowers) Do you have the, the Ralph Lauren file?ScenesRachel: Oh, yeah, sure, it's umm... (she picks up this bug and it starts to play the theme from Love Story)ScenesMark: Wh-what's that?ScenesRoss: It's from Ross, it's a love bug.ScenesMark: Wow! Somebody wants people to know you have a boyfriend.ScenesRachel: Oh no, no-no-no, that's not, not, not, what he is doing. He's just, he's just really romantic.ScenesMan: (to Rachel) Ah, excuse me, are you Rachel Green?ScenesRachel: Yes.ScenesMan: (being joined by the rest of the barbershop quartet) One, two, three...ScenesQuartet: (singing) Congratulations on your first week at your brand new job! It won't be long before your the boss.ScenesThe Bass Barber: Omm-pah, omm-pah, omm-pah.ScenesQuartet: (singing) And you know who will be there to support... you?! Your one and only boyfriend...ScenesThe Bass Barber: It's nice to have a boyfriend.ScenesQuartet: Your loyal loving boyfriend Ross..... Ross!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Rachel are entering the living room from her bedroom.]
rows.Content: Ross: I'm hurt! I'm actually hurt, that you would think that I would send you any of those things out of any thing other than love. Hurt! Hurt!ScenesRachel: All right Ross!! I get it!!ScenesRoss: I mean my God...ScenesRachel: You're hurt!ScenesRoss: ...can't, can't a guy send a barbershop quartet to his girlfriend's office anymorrrrre!!ScenesRachel: Oh, please, Ross it was so obvious! It was like you were marking your territory. I mean you might have well have just come in and peed all around my desk!ScenesRoss: I would never do that!ScenesRachel: Look, I know what's going on here, okay, Mark explained it all to me. He said this is what you guys do.ScenesRoss: Yeah well if, if, if Mark said that, than Mark's an idiot.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler, Ross, Joey are there.]
rows.Content: Joey: Mark's a genius!ScenesRoss: Why?! How?! How is he a genius?ScenesChandler: Look, don't you see what's happening here. Instead of hitting on her right away, he's becoming her confidant. Now he's gonna be the guy she goes too to complain about you.ScenesRoss: What am I going to do?ScenesChandler: Well, why don't you send her a musical bug, op, no you already did that. All right look, you're going to have to go there yourself now, okay, make a few surprise visits.ScenesRoss: I don't know you guys.ScenesChandler: All right fine, don't do anything, just sit here and talk to us, meanwhile she is talking to him about you. And he's being Mr. Joe Sensitive, and she starts thinking 'Maybe this is the guy for me, because he understands me.'ScenesJoey: And before you know it, she's with him. And you'll be all, 'Ohh, man!' And he'll be all, 'Yes!' And us, we'll be like, 'Wh-whoa, dude.' And pretty soon you'll be like, (sadly) 'Hhiii,' and, and, and, 'I can't go, Rachel and Mark might be there.' And we'll be like, 'Man get over it, it's been four years!!'ScenesChandler: He paints quite a picture doesn't he?

rows.Scenes: Rachel's office.]
rows.Content: Woman: (walking up to Mark) Here's the Shelly Siegal stuff from December.ScenesMark: (turning around) And wait, I've got something for you. (kisses her)ScenesWoman: Mark!!ScenesMark: It's okay, Rachel knows.ScenesWoman: Yeah, but even soo.Scenes(Ross appears in the hallway just outside of Rachel's office.)ScenesMark: I can't help it, I'm just, I'm just crazy about you.ScenesRachel: Ohhh! That is soo sweet! (gets up to get herself a cup of coffee)Scenes(Ross is eavesdropping in the hallway.)ScenesMark: Okay, okay look, I know I'm being Mr. Inappropriate today, but it's just so tough, I mean see you walking around and I just wanna touch you and hold you, come on no one's around, just, just kiss me.Scenes(They start to kiss, and Ross rushes into the office to break it up.)ScenesRoss: All right that's, that's it!! Get off her!ScenesMark: What is going on?ScenesRoss: What's going on?! (throws the love bug at him) That's what's going on!!ScenesRachel: (now standing behind Ross) Ross!Scenes(Ross finally looks at the woman kissing Mark.)ScenesRoss: I have been down in your store for twenty minutes trying to get a tie! What do I have to do to get some service?! (turns to Rachel) Hi Rach. (He's puts his hand on her shoulder and she knocks it away.)

rows.Scenes: Joey's dance audition, Joey is warming up.]
rows.Content: Director: Ah Joey. Joey Tribbiani. Listen Joey, I got a problem, I just got a call from my dance captain, he's having a relationship crisis and can't get out of Long Island.ScenesJoey: So, does that mean the audition is off?ScenesDirector: Listen Joey, seeing as you've got the most experience, I want you to take these dancers and show them the combination.ScenesJoey: What?!ScenesDirector: Aw come on Joey, it's easy. Y'know, it's hand, hand, head, head, (very quickly, Joey watches stunned) up, pas de bouree, pas de bouree, big turn here, grand sissone, sissone, sissone, slide back, step, step, step, and jazz hands!ScenesJoey: It's ah, step-ity, step and jazz hands.ScenesDirector: Have fun.ScenesJoey: Bye. (does the jazz hands)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is tying a ribbon to a vase.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey.ScenesPhoebe: What are you wrapping?ScenesMonica: Oh-ho, look what I got Julio.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, it's a vase.ScenesMonica: Yeah, just like the one in the poem.ScenesPhoebe: Well not exactly like the one in the poem.ScenesMonica: What do you mean?ScenesPhoebe: Remember how you said you were really dense about poetry? Oh. (hugs her)

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Julio) So! I'm just an empty vase, huh?ScenesJulio: What?ScenesMonica: Y'know, so I don't read as many important books as you do, and I don't write trick poems that seem to be about one thing but are actually about something else. And y'know what, I get excited about stupid stuff, like when I my People magazine comes on Saturday, and the new Hold Everything catalog. Y'know but that does not mean that I'm empty, I care about things. I care about my friends and family. You have no right to make that kind of judgment about me.ScenesJulio: Whoa, whoa, whoa.ScenesMonica: You don't even know me...ScenesJulio: Whoa, whoa, whoa, the poem is not about you.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesJulio: The Empty Vase is not about you. My baby, you make me so sad that you would think this.ScenesMonica: I'm sorry, my friend Phoebe...ScenesJulio: No, it's about all women. Well, all American women. You feel better now?ScenesMonica: (sarcastically) Oh yeah.

rows.Scenes: Joey's audition, the director has returned and wants to see the combination.]
rows.Content: Director: All right, let's do it!Scenes(The group does the same horrible dance that Joey did earlier in the show, except they're all out of sync and they do the jazz hands at the end.)ScenesDirector: No, no, no. What was that?ScenesJoey: I know, it was the best I could get out of them.ScenesDirector: Well, people!ScenesJoey: People, people, people.ScenesDirector: Let's try it again, and this time let's watch everybody watch Joey. (to Joey) Show 'em how it's done. (to the pianist) Count it off.Scenes(The pianist starts to play, and Joey readies himself, and then runs out of the audition.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Rachel are there.]
