(hands him the catalogue)ScenesChandler: That’s the stuff! (quickly grabs it)Scenes[Rachel’s boss, Joanna, enters]ScenesJoanna: Rachel, I need the Versachi invoice. (to Chandler) Hello! You don’t work for me.ScenesRachel: (introduces them) Joanna, this is my friend Chandler Bing (to Chandler) Joanna.ScenesJoanna: Bing! That’s a great name.ScenesChandler: Thanks, it’s ah, Gaelic, for ‘Thy turkey’s done.’ So ah, I’m gonna go, nice, nice meeting you.ScenesJoanna: Me too.ScenesRachel: Bye, Chandler.ScenesJoanna: (to Rachel) So ah, what’s wrong with him?ScenesRachel: Oh, nothing, he’s just goofy like that, I actually, hardly notice it anymore.ScenesJoanna: Oh no, no-no-no, is he ah, married, or involved with anyone?ScenesRachel: No!! No! He’s not married, or involved, with anyone!ScenesJoanna: Oh, Rachel, (pause) actually, y'know what, forget it.ScenesRachel: Well, I’ll ask him for you, if you want me too?ScenesJoanna: Would you? Or, is it just to sad and desperate, and y'know something that Sophie would do?ScenesSophie: Uh, uh, uh, I am here.ScenesJoanna: I know that.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is showing off her new dollhouse. It’s a huge dollhouse, that takes up the entire living room table.]
rows.Content: Monica: Look at it! Ohhh! Wallpaper’s a little faded, that’s okay. Carpet’s a little loose. Hardwood floors!!ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hello.ScenesPhoebe: Oh! Ooh! Oh Monica! It’s so beautiful.ScenesMonica: I know!!!ScenesPhoebe: So, I’m here, ready to play.ScenesMonica: Okay.ScenesPhoebe: I brought a bunch of stuff for the house, so check it out. Ha-ha. (She removes this large ceramic dog that comes up to the second floor and places it next to the house.)ScenesMonica: What’s this?ScenesPhoebe: That’s a dog, every house should have a dog.ScenesMonica: Not one that can pee on the roof.ScenesPhoebe: Well, maybe it’s so big because the house was built on radioactive waste.ScenesChandler: (holding a tissue) And is this in case the house sneezes?ScenesPhoebe: No, no, that’s the ghost for the attic.ScenesMonica: I don’t want a ghost.ScenesPhoebe: Well, nobody wants a ghost. But you’ve got one, because the house is sitting on an ancient Indian burial ground.ScenesRoss: Wait a minute, the house was built on radioactive waste, and an ancient Indian burial ground? That would never happen.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, obviously you don’t know much about the U.S. government.ScenesRachel: (entering) Hey!ScenesAll: Hello.ScenesRachel: I need to talk to you!ScenesRoss: Sure, what’s up?ScenesRachel: Oh, sorry. I meant Chandler.ScenesRoss: I-I know. Well if something comes up... (walks away)ScenesChandler: Oh, I'm glad you guys are past that little awkward phase.ScenesRachel: Okay, my boss, Joanna, when you left, she started asking questions about you...ScenesChandler: Oh-ho, liked what she saw, huh? Dug my action, did she? Checkin’ out the Chan-Chan man!ScenesRachel: (looks at him) That was (pause) surreal. Okay, what do think? Are you interested at all?ScenesChandler: Yeah, she seemed cool, attractive. I’ll do it.ScenesRachel: Oh thank you, Chandler, this is so great, she’s gonna love me.ScenesPhoebe: (holding a dinosaur) Okay, dinosaur attack!! Quick, everybody into the house!! Ahh-ahh! (the dinosaur starts attacking the house. She starts to bark like a dog.) Roof! Rrroof-roof-roof!ScenesMonica: Okay, Phoebe, y'know what? That-that’s it, that’s it, all right? No dinosaurs, no ghosts, no giant dogs, okay? They’re not the right size, they’re not Victorian, and they just don’t go.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, (starts to pack up her stuff) fine. Come dinosaur, we’re not welcome in the house of no imagination.ScenesRoss: Uh, Pheebs, while we’re hovering around the subject. I just have to say dinosaurs, they-they don’t go, rrroof!ScenesPhoebe: The little ones do.

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are getting ready to rehearse the play.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey, Kate!ScenesKate: Morning.ScenesJoey: Listen, I ah, went to that restaurant that you were talking about last week...ScenesThe Director: Hey, lovely! Come, talk to me a minute! (she goes over to him)ScenesJoey: (to himself) And I ate the food, I had the fish, it was good, yeah. It was good, yeah...ScenesWoman: Hi, oh, I’m Lauren, Kate’s understudy.ScenesJoey: Oh, hey! Joey Tribbiani.ScenesLauren: I know! I-I’m a big fan of yours.ScenesJoey: (looks at her, shocked) What?!ScenesLauren: I used to umm, schedule my classes so I could watch Dr. Drake Remoray on Days of Our Lives.ScenesJoey: Get out of here, really?!ScenesLauren: Absolutely!ScenesJoey: Yeah?ScenesLauren: Oh but then, they went and dropped you down that elevator shaft.ScenesJoey: They gave me the shaft all right.ScenesLauren: (laughing) Oh, you’re so funny. Listen, umm, what are you doing after rehearsals? Do you want to get a drink, or something?ScenesJoey: Well Ahh, (he sees Kate and the director kissing) yeah! Yeah, sure, a drink sounds great.ScenesLauren: Cool! I-I’ll see you then.ScenesJoey: All right.ScenesThe Director: All right, it’s time to act, my talking props. (Both Joey and Kate just look at each other.)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is entering with her own dollhouse, that she made herself.]
rows.Content: Phoebe: Hey!ScenesAll: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Look everybody, look at my new dollhouse!!ScenesRachel: Wow!!ScenesPhoebe: Look, look! (She lifts up the roof, and the front panel falls revealing the interior.)ScenesRoss: Hey, what’s this?!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, it’s the slide instead of stairs. Watch this. (She slides a doll down the slide)ScenesMonica: It’s very interesting, Phoebe.ScenesRachel: What’s this?ScenesPhoebe: The Licorice Room, you can eat all the furniture. And, when guests come over, they can stay on the tootsie roll-away bed.ScenesRoss: This is the coolest house ever!!Scenes(Monica is looking on with a hurt expression on her face.)ScenesPhoebe: Hey, does anybody want to join me in the aroma room? (lights some incense)ScenesRachel: All right!ScenesRoss: I would!ScenesMonica: Hey, guys, guys, did you see my new, china cabinet?!ScenesRoss and Rachel: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: Watch, watch. (She turns a strand of Christmas lights strung around the house.)ScenesRoss and Rachel: Ooohhhh!!ScenesPhoebe: And, and! (She turns on a bubble maker.)ScenesRoss and Rachel: Ahhhh!!ScenesChandler: (entering) Hey, my Father’s house does that!ScenesRachel: (to Chandler) O-o-o-okay, how did it go? Tell me everything.ScenesChandler: Well, the movie was great, dinner was great, and there’s nothing like a cool, crisp New York evening.ScenesRachel: Hmm.ScenesChandler: Of course, I didn’t get to enjoy any of that, because Joanna’s such a big, dull dud!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, Joanna’s telling Rachel, her side of the story.]
rows.Content: Joanna: Chandler is fantastic!!ScenesRachel: What?!ScenesJoanna: Oh God, we just clicked! Y’know how people just click? Like he came by to pick me up, and I opened the door, and it was just like, click! Did he tell you?ScenesRachel: Oh, I....ScenesJoanna: Oh, and he’s got such a good heart! Doesn’t he have a good heart?ScenesRachel: Oh, I know...ScenesJoanna: Oh, I know and he’s soo sweet! Listen, he said he was going to call, so put him straight through.ScenesSophie: Isn’t this great?!ScenesJoanna: Don’t spoil it.

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, Joey and Kate are rehearsing.]
rows.Content: Joey: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?Scenes[A phone rings.]ScenesThe Director: (answering the phone) Hello. Oh! It’s you. Just ah, just one-one sec. (to Joey and Kate) I am going to take this call. When I continue, I hope that there will appear on stage this magical thing that in the theatre we call, committing to the moment! (He goes to take the call.)ScenesJoey: (to Kate) That guy’s like a cartoon. What do you see in him anyway?ScenesKate: He happens to be brilliant. Which is more than I can say for that sweater you’re dating.ScenesJoey: Hey, I’m not interested in her sweater! It’s what’s underneath her sweater that counts. And besides, since ah, since when do you care who I’m going out with?ScenesKate: I don’t care. Why, do you want me to care?ScenesJoey: Do you want me to want you to care?ScenesKate: Do you?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesThe Director: (returning) Okay, I’m afraid to say this, but let’s pick it up where we left off.Scenes[They resume rehearsing.]ScenesJoey: Come on baby, don’t go. Please? What do you say?ScenesKate: I’ve got no reason to stay.Scenes(Joey grabs her and kisses her.)ScenesThe Director: Stop!! Stop it! You must stop! You are bad actors! This is a terrible play! I’ll see you in the morning. (exits)ScenesKate: I can’t believe we go on in, in a week.ScenesJoey: Hey, it’s gonna be all right.ScenesLauren: (to Joey) Hey! So since we’re getting off early, do you want to go and paint mugs?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesLauren: You know! At the place I told you about last night?ScenesJoey: Oh, yeah, with the mug painting. Yeah. I was so listening to that. But ah, y'know what, I think I kinda need to work on my stuff tonight.ScenesLauren: Oh, okay.ScenesJoey: Okay. (he gives her a peck on the cheek)ScenesLauren: I’ll see you tomorrow. (she kisses him full on the mouth.)ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesLauren: G’night. (exits)ScenesJoey: (to Kate) Ah, are you okay?ScenesKate: Yeah, I guess. Look, what are we gonna do about this scene, huh?ScenesJoey: I don’t know.ScenesKate: Well umm, maybe if it had more heat.ScenesJoey: How do you mean?ScenesKate: Well, Adrian’s looking for a reason to stay, right? Victor can’t just kiss her, he’s gotta, gotta really give her a reason, y'know?ScenesJoey: Maybe he could slip her the tongue.ScenesKate: Or maybe, maybe he could grab her, and, and, and, and lift her up.ScenesJoey: Yeah, yeah, and then Adrian, she maybe she could wrap her legs around his waist.ScenesKate: And then she could rip off his shirt and kiss his chest, and, and his stomach!ScenesJoey: And then, then he could use his teeth, his teeth to undo her dress, and, and, and bite her!ScenesKate: And then right, right when the scene ends, he could take her with this raw, animal....Scenes[cut to Joey’s bedroom, Joey and Kate are emerging from under the covers.]ScenesJoey: Something like that?ScenesKate: Yeah, that’s pretty much what I had in mind.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross and Monica are eating breakfast as Joey enters, very happily.]
rows.Content: Joey: (to Ross) Hey.ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesJoey: (to Monica) Hey.Scenes(He walks up behind Monica and gives her a big hug and a kiss on the neck.)ScenesRoss: Hi.ScenesJoey: Hey.Scenes(He walks over behind Ross, thinks about it for a moment, and gives him a big hug.)ScenesRoss: It’s a little early to be drinkin’.ScenesJoey: No-no, things ah, finally happened with Kate.ScenesRoss: Ohhhhh!ScenesMonica: You’re kidding?! That’s great!ScenesJoey: Oh, it was so amazing. After the (pause) love making...ScenesMonica: Oh my.ScenesJoey: Yep. I just, I just watched her sleep for like hours, just breathing in and breathing out. And then I knew she was dreaming ‘cause, ‘cause her eyes keep going like this. (He closes his eyes and moves them around, kinda like he’s been processed by the devil, or something.)ScenesChandler: (entering with Rachel) I’m telling ya, Joanna’s got it all wrong. Okay? All I said was, ‘This was fun. Let’s do it again sometime. I’ll give you a call.’ScenesRachel: Ohh, gee. I wonder why she thinks you’re going to call her?ScenesChandler: That’s what you say at the end of a date.ScenesRachel: You can’t just say, ‘Nice to meet you, good night?’ScenesChandler: To her face? Look it’s the end of the date, I’m standing there, I know all she’s waiting for is for me to say ‘I’ll call her’ and it’s just y'know, comes out. I can’t help it, it’s a compulsion.ScenesMonica: Come on Rach, when a guy says he’s going to call, it doesn’t mean he’s going to call. Hasn’t it ever happened to you?ScenesRachel: Well, they always called.ScenesMonica: Hmm, bite me.

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office.]
rows.Content: Joanna: (entering) Did he call?ScenesRachel: No. Sorry.ScenesJoanna: Why?! Why?! He said he’d call. Why hasn’t he called?ScenesSophie: Maybe he’s intimated by really smart, strong, successful women.ScenesJoanna: Sophie, would you please climb out of my butt. Why hasn’t he called, Rachel? Why?ScenesRachel: Okay, okay. Umm, well ah, maybe he, maybe he feels awkward because you are my boss.ScenesJoanna: Awkward? Why should he feel awkward?ScenesRachel: Well...ScenesJoanna: The only person that should feel awkward is you, and you didn’t tell him not to call me, did you?ScenesRachel: No. I...ScenesJoanna: Because if you feel uncomfortable with your friend dating someone you work for, there are always ways to fix...that.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler is reading a magazine as Rachel approaches.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (grabbing the magazine out of his hands) Call her! Call her now!ScenesChandler: Multiple, so many paper cuts.ScenesRachel: Why hasn’t he called Rachel? Why? Why? I don’t understand. Why? He said he’ll call. Why? Why? Chandler I’m telling you she has flipped out, she’s gone crazy!ScenesChandler: (sarcastic) Oh, well give me the phone then.ScenesRachel: Come on, this isn’t funny. She thinks it’s my fault that you haven’t called her. You have to call her!ScenesChandler: Look, you can’t call somebody after this long just to say, ‘In case you didn’t notice, I don’t like you!’ScenesRachel: Well then you’re going to have to take her out again.ScenesChandler: Nooo!! She’s really dull! And she gets this gross mascara goop thing in the corner of her eye!ScenesRachel: I don’t care! I don’t care! You are going to have to take her out again and end it, and end it in way that she knows it’s actually ended. And, I don’t care how hard it is for you, do not tell her that you will call her again!ScenesChandler: All right! Fine! But it’s just a lunch date, no more than an hour! And from now on I get my own dates, I don’t want you setting me up with anybody ever again!ScenesRachel: That’s fine!ScenesChandler: That’s just a lot of big talk, y'know.ScenesRachel: I know.

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Ross is entering.]
rows.Content: Ross: Mon?ScenesMonica: (from the bathroom) I’m in the shower!Scenes[He closes the door and walks over to get something from the fridge. He starts to smell something and turns around to see Phoebe’s dollhouse smoking. He runs over and takes off the roof to reveal that the dollhouse fire.]ScenesRoss: Oh, fire! There, there’s a fire! Fire!!Scenes[He tries to blow it out, and obviously, it doesn’t work. He runs over to the sink to get a glass of water to put out the fire, but since Monica is in the shower the water pressure is very low and takes a long time to fill the glass. In desperation he takes the half full glass over and dumps it on the fire, it doesn’t work. He then picks up the dollhouse and considers bringing it over to the sink, but decides to take it into the bathroom and use the shower to put it out. He kicks open the door and we hear Monica scream at the top of her lungs.]

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, Kate is arriving for rehearsal.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey.ScenesKate: Hi.ScenesJoey: So I ah, talked to Lauren, kinda told her how things were with us. Did you ah, did you talk to Marshall?ScenesKate: About what?ScenesJoey: Y'know, about what happened with us.ScenesKate: Nooo. And there’s really no reason he should find out, so ah let’s not make a big deal about it, okay?ScenesJoey: What are you talking about? It was a big deal. I mean, come on you can’t tell me last night didn’t mean something to you. I-I was there, you’re not that good an actress.ScenesKate: Look umm, I, I was, I was just caught up in the moment. That’s all it was. Joey, I’m-I’m sorry you feel bad, but haven’t you ever sleep with a women where it meant more to her than it did to you?ScenesJoey: Nooo.ScenesLauren: (entering) Hi, Kate!ScenesKate: Hi, Lauren.ScenesJoey: Hi, Lauren.ScenesLauren: Hi, pig!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Ross are inspecting the damage to the dollhouse.]
rows.Content: Ross: Sorry I ah, I scared you in there.ScenesMonica: Oh, that’s okay. By the way, I was just checking the shower massager.ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesPhoebe: (entering) Hey!ScenesMonica: (runs over to her) I tried to reach you at work. There’s....been a fire.ScenesPhoebe: What?! Oh my... (sees the remains of the house) Oh my God!! What happened?!ScenesRoss: Well, we believe it originated here. (He uses a pointer and points to the point of origin.) In the Aroma Room.ScenesPhoebe: All right. Did everyone get out okay?ScenesMonica: Well, the giraffe’s okay. And so is the pirate.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh. What is this? (She sees a tissue covering something, and moves to remove it.)ScenesRoss: No Phoebe, don’t look! You don’t want to see what’s under there!!ScenesPhoebe: (She pauses to ready herself, and removes the tissue.) Ohh, the-the Foster puppets!Scenes(She picks up a charred piece of plastic that once was the Foster puppets, and starts to break down. Monica goes over and comforts her.)

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s office, Chandler and Joanna are returning from their lunch date. He is telling her about her mascara problem. Rachel is already there.]
rows.Content: Chandler: It’s not a big deal. It’s, just it’s right here, (points to his eye) and it’s all the time.ScenesJoanna: Well, thanks again for lunch.ScenesChandler: (He looks over at Rachel, who nods her head) Yes, this, this was pleasant.Scenes(Rachel is slowing trying to leave and let them talk.)ScenesJoanna: It was, wasn’t it?ScenesChandler: The food there was, was great.ScenesJoanna: Wasn’t it?ScenesChandler: So take care.ScenesJoanna: You too.ScenesChandler: Well, this was great. I’ll give you a call. We should do it again sometime. (Rachel is disappointed)ScenesJoanna: Great! I’m looking forward to it. Rachel, any messages?ScenesRachel: Sophie’s desk.Scenes(Chandler starts to leave ashamed of himself, but Rachel stops him in the hallway.)ScenesRachel: (whispering) Chandler!! Are you gonna call her!ScenesChandler: Noo!ScenesRachel: Chandler!!ScenesChandler: Look, I’m sorry. Okay? I’m weak, and pathetic, and sorry.ScenesRachel: Okay, you are going to tell her and you’re going to tell her now. (She grabs his nipple and starts to twist it.)ScenesChandler: Ahhhh—I’m not going to call you.ScenesJoanna: What?ScenesChandler: I’m sorry. I’m-I’m-I’m sorry that I said I was going to when I’m not. Look, this has nothing to do with you, y'know? And this isn’t Rachel’s fault. It’s me. I have serious, serious problems when it comes to women. I have issues with commitment, intimacy, (pause) mascara goop. And I’m really sorry, it’s just that this is not, this isn’t going to work out.ScenesJoanna: Well, this isn’t how I was hoping how this would end, but I guess I have to appreciate your honesty.ScenesChandler: Yeah, o-okay.ScenesJoanna: So...ScenesChandler: Well this is great! I’ll give you a call! We should do it again sometime!Scenes(Rachel is shocked, and holds her arms out in disbelief.)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is talking on the phone.]
rows.Content: Joey: (on phone) Well, so anyway Beth, what I’m saying is I should’ve considered your feelings before I went home with you that night. I’ve ah, I’ve recently learned what’s it like to be on your side of it, and I’m sorry. So, do you think you can forgive me? (listens) Great. Thanks. Okay, bye. (He sits down and crosses out something, and dials the phone again.) Hello, Jennifer? (listens) Oh hi, Mrs. Loreo, is Jennifer there? (listens) Oh, she’s not home huh? (listens) Well ah, actually I kinda need to talk to you too.ScenesEndScenesThe One With A Chick. And A DuckScenesWritten by: Chris BrownScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Outside Central Perk, Rachel and Phoebe are helping Monica learn how to roller skate by rolling her between themselves.]
rows.Content: Rachel: So who’s idea was it to put everybody in the diner on skates?ScenesMonica: Oh, some idiot customer put a suggestion in the suggestion box.ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, they took my idea!ScenesMonica: That was you?!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah! Okay, here you go. (rolls her back to Rachel)ScenesGunther: (bringing Rachel a mug) Rachel, I made you a cocoa.Scenes[He distracts her from catching Monica and Monica slams into her, knocking her down. Monica then falls on top of her.]ScenesPhoebe: Oh my God, are you guys okay?ScenesGunther: Are you all right?ScenesJoey: (leaving Central Perk and seeing Monica laying on top of Rachel who is moaning in pain.) Oh my.Scenes(They both turn and give him a dirty look.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Joey is watching Quincy M.E. as Chandler is walking into the living room from his bedroom.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (sporting a goatee) Hey.ScenesJoey: Hey. Y'know with that goatee you kinda look like Satan.ScenesChandler: Oh, so that’s why the priest threw holy water on me. (there’s no reaction from Joey) Okay, listen, you have to cheer up! Okay? You should come out with Ross and me, I mean anything is better than sitting around here crying all day about Kate.ScenesJoey: Hey I was crying because, because nobody believed Quincy’s theory. Okay?ScenesRoss: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesRoss: (triumphantly) I’m gonna be on TV!!ScenesChandler: No way!ScenesRoss: Yeah! They’re putting together this panel to talk about these fossils they just found in Peru and The Discovery Channel’s gonna film it!ScenesChandler: Oh my God! Who’s gonna watch that?!ScenesRoss: Thanks. You ready to go?ScenesChandler: Yeah. (they start to leave)ScenesJoey: Saw a girl with that vest.ScenesChandler: Thanks. (He takes off the vest and throws it on the floor.)ScenesAnchorwoman: (on TV) While most of us think of chocolate bunnies and baskets as traditional Easter gifts. Some people insist on giving live chicks as presents. (Joey is intrigued by the idea) Unfortunately, the sad fact remains that most of these little guys won’t live to see the fourth of July. (Joey starts to call a place to buy a little baby chick) Because of as a result of improper care, they will be dead.ScenesJoey: (on phone) Yeah, hi. You guys got any of those baby chicks? ‘Cause I was watching this ah, commercial on TV and man, those guys are cute!

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner, Pete is entering, Monica is on roller skates.]
rows.Content: Pete: Hi!ScenesMonica: Hi! Hey, Pete you’re back! Hey, check this out. (She starts to skate over to him)ScenesPete: Wow! Skates!Scenes(She gets just about all the way over to him and falls into his arms.)ScenesMonica: Wow! You’re a lot sturdier that Chandler. He crumpled like a piece of paper. So how was you’re trip?ScenesPete: Well... (he holds up a gift he brought her)ScenesMonica: Oh, what’d ya bring me?! (She opens the gift) Awww, hotel toiletries from Japan. Oh, these are gonna go in my permanent collection. You want some coffee?ScenesPete: Yeah, sure, that’d be great.Scenes(She starts to go and get the coffee and falls behind the counter.)ScenesMonica: (popping back up) Regular or decaf?ScenesPete: Ah, which ever is closest.ScenesMonica: Okay. (hands him a cup)ScenesPete: So ask me what I did today.ScenesMonica: So what did you do today Pete?ScenesPete: I bought a restaurant and I would like you to be the head chef.ScenesMonica: What?! Oh.(She turns around quickly and falls)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is telling Rachel about Pete’s offer.]
rows.Content: Monica: Can you believe he just offered me a restaurant?ScenesRachel: What a jerk! You want me to kick his ass?ScenesMonica: I mean this has been like my dream since I got my first Easy Bake Oven and opened Easy Monica’s Bakery. I mean I would kill for this job. I mean I can totally do this job, and God knows I paid my dues. (She removes her fake breasts) But Pete’s just doing this because he has a crush on me.ScenesRachel: And you’re still not attracted to him at all?ScenesMonica: Hmm, no. I mean how can I accept a restaurant from him? I-I-I-I can’t. I couldn’t even accept a necklace from Stu Vincent in the seventh grade.ScenesRachel: Yeah, but Mon that’s totally different. He was you’re health teacher.ScenesMonica: Oh, please.Scenes(She slaps Rachel’s side and Rachel screams in pain.)ScenesMonica: What? Honey.ScenesRachel: Oh, I am, my side still hurts from when you crashed into me yesterday.ScenesMonica: Oh God, I’m so sorry.ScenesRachel: I know.Scenes(Monica hugs her goes and hugs her)ScenesRachel: Ow!!ScenesMonica: Oh God!ScenesRoss: (entering, wearing a white suit with a little red bow tie) Hey, you guys! Guess what?ScenesRachel: (looking at the outfit) Got a job on a river boat?ScenesRoss: Y'know what I didn’t wear this suit for a year because you hated it. Well, guess what? You’re not my girlfriend anymore so...ScenesRachel: Oh I see, so this suit is making a point.ScenesRoss: Right.ScenesRachel: Now that you’re on you’re own, you’re free to look as stupid as you like.ScenesRoss: (to Monica) You like it right?ScenesMonica: Oh absolutely. I like it even more on you than I did on Colonel Sanders. (Ross starts to leave) Ross! Ross! I’m kidding!ScenesRachel: Yeah, come here!ScenesMonica: What-what was it you were gonna tell us?ScenesRachel: Yeah. Oh! Was how you invented the cotton gin?!ScenesRoss: Okay, good bye! (leaves)

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is talking to Phoebe about her suggestion.]
rows.Content: Chandler: So um, after you put the suggestion in the box, how long did it take for the roller skating thing to happen.ScenesPhoebe: Umm, oh, about three months.ScenesChandler: Okay, so I guess that’s about ah, two weeks before the topless thing kicks in.ScenesJoey: (entering carrying a box) Hey!!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: I got you something! Open it! Open it!ScenesChandler: Okay. (He opens it and it’s a baby chick) It’s a chicken.ScenesJoey: It’s cute, huh?ScenesPhoebe: Whoa-whoa-whoa, you guys, do you know anything about chicks?ScenesChandler: Fowl? No. Women? Nooo.ScenesPhoebe: Okay, well they are a huge responsibility, especially at this age. They require constant care. They-they need just the right food, and lot’s and lot’s of love.ScenesJoey: Oh, well no problem there. (He picks up the chick, hugs it really tight, and talks to it like it’s a little baby.)ScenesChandler: Easy Lenny.

rows.Scenes: The Moondance Diner, Pete is talking to Monica about the restaurant.]
rows.Content: Pete: So? I mean have you thought about it?ScenesMonica: Okay. Here’s the thing.ScenesPete: Oh no, not the thing. I hate the thing. What’s the thing?ScenesMonica: I can’t do it. I’m sorry, I wish I could, but umm, see you have these feelings for me....ScenesPete: Wait, wait, wait, wait, that’s-that’s what you’re worried about? If that’s the problem, we’ve got no problem.ScenesMonica: Huh?ScenesPete: No! Look, I was gonna tell you this over dinner, but I met somebody else. On my trip.ScenesMonica: Oh?ScenesPete: Her name’s Ann, she’s a journalist. Ahh, we met on the plane. She asked me if she could finish off my peanuts, I thought she said something else, we had a big laugh. Yeah, I just, I mean I got, I got tired of waiting.ScenesMonica: Oh, that’s great! I mean I’m-I’m sorry, but I’m so happy for you. And now I can work for you!ScenesPete: I guess you can.ScenesMonica: Oh my God! Oh, this is incredible! Ohh! (she rolls over and kisses him on the cheek) All right, y'know what? I’m just gonna roll right into that office and-and quit!ScenesPete: All right.ScenesMonica: Okay. (she gets ready to go) Can you give me a little push?ScenesPete: Yeah, sure. Good luck!ScenesMonica: (rolling towards the office) I’m quitting!! Woo-hoo! (She rolls through a doorway and out of sight. We then hear a big crash, and see Monica roll past the door the other way.) I’m okay!! I’m all right!!ScenesPhoebe: (to Pete) Wow! That’s exciting, you went to Japan, made up a woman.ScenesPete: What?ScenesPhoebe: I’m just saying, this woman, I mean she’s fictitious. No?ScenesPete: Why would you say that?ScenesPhoebe: ‘Cause you’re still into Monica. So you told her there was somebody else so she would agree to work with you, so ‘cause you figure oh if you spent a lot of time together, maybe something might happen, and...ScenesPete: You’re good. You’re good!ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, no, I’m fairly intuitive and psychic. It’s a substantial gift.ScenesPete: Listen, can you promise me that you won’t tell her though?ScenesPhoebe: Absolutely, oh I promise. Tell her what?ScenesPete: Thanks a lot.ScenesPhoebe: No I’m serious. I mean I’m intuitive, but my memory sucks.

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is baby-chick sitting.]
rows.Content: Chandler: Okay, but this is the last time. (singing) With a chick-chick here, and a chick-chick there. Here a chick, there a chick, everywhere a chick-chick-(Joey enters)-chickeeeen.ScenesJoey: Hey.ScenesChandler: Hey.ScenesJoey: How’s she doing?ScenesChandler: She?ScenesJoey: Well yeah, don’t-don’t you think it’s a she?ScenesChandler: I don’t know. (He picks the chick up and turns it over, trying to determine the sex of the chick, and blows on it.) I can’t tell, what ever it was went back in too quickly.ScenesJoey: Well, anyway, I got to go change, I’m ah, meeting some of the cast for drinks.ScenesChandler: Excuse me?ScenesJoey: What?ScenesChandler: I stayed home from work today while you were at rehearsal so somebody could be here with our chick!ScenesJoey: Hey! Who was up from 2 o’clock this morning until 5 o’clock this morning trying to get her back to sleep?ScenesChandler: You don’t think I get up when you get up?ScenesJoey: Ohhh, here it comes.ScenesChandler: Yes, here it comes! I’m stuck here all day, and then you come in and spend two seconds with us and then expect to go off gallivanting with your friends? Well I don’t think so mister!ScenesJoey: Hey!! I need to relax! Okay? I was working all day!ScenesChandler: And you don’t think taking care of our chick is work?ScenesJoey: That’s not what I said. Okay, I just meant...ScenesChandler: I know what you meant!! (pause) You notice that ever since we got this chick, we’ve been fighting a lot more than we used too?ScenesJoey: I don’t know, maybe we weren’t ready to have a chick.ScenesChandler: I’ll take her back tomorrow.ScenesJoey: Do you think we’ll get our three bucks back?ScenesRoss: (entering carrying a garment bag) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesRoss: (sees the chick) Ohhh, hey! All right, listen, I-I have that TV thing in like two hours, and I need your help, okay? What do you think? (takes out two suits) This blue suit, or this brown one?ScenesJoey: Well, the brown one brings out your eyes, but your butt looks great in the blue one.ScenesRoss: Really? (Joey gives him a ‘Like I would know’ look)

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Rachel is trying to take some aspirin.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (she reaches for the bottle) Oww! (She grabs the bottle, but has trouble opening it. She pops the top off and aspirins fly all over the place as Ross enters.)ScenesRoss: Wow! That aspirin dance really works!ScenesRachel: (She bends over to try and pick up the aspirin) Oww!ScenesRoss: Oh my God, is that still...ScenesRachel: I’m fine, I’m fine.ScenesRoss: No you’re not.ScenesRachel: Yes I am!ScenesRoss: Rach!ScenesRachel: Look, I’m fine. Watch. (She picks up an aspirin between her toes) Look at that. (She lifts her leg to grab the aspirin with her hand and almost falls over.) Whoa-whoa!ScenesRoss: (stopping her from falling) Okay, okay. Look, you have got to go to a doctor! Okay?ScenesRachel: No. I have got to get ready and go to a dinner at my bosses house. It’s a very big deal, there’s a lot of people there I have to meet.ScenesRoss: And I’m sure you’re gonna make a big impression. Hi! I’m Rachel Green. It’s nice to meet you. (He lifts his leg and imitates shaking hands with it, just like how Rachel was trying to pick up the aspirin with her feet.) Come on, you probably have a broken rib!ScenesRachel: Well, I will go to the hospital tomorrow, it’ll still be broken then.ScenesRoss: Rach...ScenesRachel: But y'know, I could use a hand getting ready.ScenesRoss: Rachel...ScenesRachel: Look, either help me or go.ScenesRoss: Fine. I’ll go.ScenesRachel: (with a hurt expression on her face) Okay, but before you go, could you help me first?ScenesRoss: (He checks his watch) Sure. I’ll help you.ScenesChandler: (rushing in) Oh, good! Good! Do you guys know how to get a chick out of a VCR?!ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s bedroom, Rachel is trying to put on eye liner with her left hand, as Ross is setting out her shoes.]
rows.Content: Rachel: (She drops the brush) Y'know what? I cannot do this with my left hand! Would you please, help me with this too?ScenesRoss: Ohh. (He drops the shoes, takes the brush from her, and licks the tip. He doesn’t like how it tastes.)ScenesRachel: (taking the brush back) Okay. Let’s use this brush. (Hands him another one.)ScenesRoss: Okay. This stuff?ScenesRachel: Yeah.ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesRachel: Careful. Light. Okay, do you know how, just sweep it across the lid. Okay? Just sweep it.ScenesRoss: Oke-dokey. (He pokes her in the eye with the brush.)ScenesRachel: Oh-ho!ScenesRoss: Sorry.ScenesRachel: Hey! That’s just poking me in the eye!ScenesRoss: Sorry, I’m sorry. Close, close, close...ScenesRachel: Okay, just sweep it.ScenesRoss: I’m sweeping...ScenesRachel: Right.ScenesRoss: Sweep, sweep....(He starts to paint it on her eye, making it look like she has a black eye.)ScenesRachel: Okay, now make it even, ‘cause we don’t...ScenesRoss: What? What?ScenesRachel: We don’t want it-it to be too much, we want it to be subtle.Scenes(Of course it’s too late for that.)ScenesRoss: No. No, y'know you don’t, you don’t wear enough of this. (Rachel is shocked) What?ScenesRachel: Since when, since when do you think I don’t wear enough of this?ScenesRoss: Well I, close your eyes, I just think you’re gonna like this a little better, ‘cause, close-close... (He gets some more on the brush)ScenesRachel: Blow it.ScenesRoss: (blows it) Sorry. ‘Cause umm, I think this will make you a little more sophisticated.ScenesRachel: Sophisticated like a hooker?

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is entering, Phoebe is already there.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey, guess what I’m doing tonight.ScenesPhoebe: What?ScenesMonica: I’m checking out the restaurant with Pete.ScenesPhoebe: Ohh, Monica, I am so excited for you.ScenesMonica: I know.ScenesPhoebe: Ooh, I have to tell you something.ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: But I can’t tell you.ScenesMonica: Okay, but wouldn’t it be easier if you had to tell me something that you could tell me.ScenesPhoebe: Well, sure in a perfect world. But, no, I promised I wouldn’t tell, and I swore to like all my gods.ScenesMonica: Okay. Does it have to do with Ross and Rachel?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: Does it have to do with Joey?ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: Does it have to do with-with Chandler and that sock that he keeps by his bed?ScenesPhoebe: No, but let’s come back to that later!

rows.Scenes: Rachel’s Bedroom, Ross is finishing up her make-up.]
rows.Content: Ross: There you go! Good enough for your party, huh?Scenes(She turns and looks in the mirror, and it’s way, way over done. She looks like she has two black eyes.)ScenesRachel: Sure.ScenesRoss: Yep?ScenesRachel: Sure, I’ll just sit next to the trans-sexual from purchasing.ScenesRoss: Okay, come on! All right, I gotta go! So good luck at the party. Okay?ScenesRachel: Oh wait, Ross, would you just stay and help me get dressed?ScenesRoss: (checks his watch) Sure, okay.ScenesRachel: Okay. Okay, great! Umm, okay, just turn around.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: I don’t want you to see me naked!ScenesRoss: Rachel, I’ve seen you naked a million times. I ate hot fudge off you naked. Remember, I-I sucked that mini-marshmallow out of your belly button?ScenesRachel: Yeah, but that was different. Y’know? I mean, we were, we were going out then, now I think it’s weird.ScenesRoss: Rach, y'know I can see you naked any time I want.ScenesRachel: What?ScenesRoss: All I have to do is close my eyes. See? (closes his eyes) Woo-hoo!!ScenesRachel: Ross! Stop that!ScenesRoss: Ah, I’m sorry.ScenesRachel: Come on! I don’t want you thinking of me like that any more!ScenesRoss: Ahh, sorry, nothing you can do about it. It’s one of my ah, rights as the ex-boyfriend. (closes his eyes again) Oop, oh yeah!ScenesRachel: Stop it! Cut it out! Cut it out!ScenesRoss: Okay, okay, I’m sorry, it will never happen... (closes eyes) Uh-oh! Wait a minute! Wait-wait, now there are a hundred of you and I’m the king.ScenesRachel: Rosss...ScenesRoss: Come on, would you grow up? It’s no big deal.ScenesRachel: All right. (She starts to take off her robe) Fine.ScenesRoss: Yowzah!!!ScenesRachel: O-kay!! See what you did, I’m gonna be doing it by myself now. Okay?ScenesRoss: Aww, come on.ScenesRachel: That’s it. (She crawls onto the bed) Ow!!!ScenesRoss: Oh my God!ScenesRachel: Oh-ow!ScenesRoss: All right.ScenesRachel: Ow!ScenesRoss: Look...ScenesRachel: Ow!ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: Ow!ScenesRoss: Rach?ScenesRachel: Ow! Ow!ScenesRoss: Easy. Easy. You have to go to the hospital. Okay?ScenesRachel: Okay, I do.ScenesRoss: Okay.ScenesRachel: I really do.ScenesRoss: Okay, I’m gonna get your coat and then I’ll-I’ll put you in a cab.ScenesRachel: Okay. Oh wait, wait-wait, you’re not gonna come with me?ScenesRoss: (He thinks about it) Of course I am. I just have to make a call.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: Okay? (goes into the living room)ScenesRachel: Thank you. (She goes to take off her make-up and screams in pain) Oww!!!! God!ScenesRoss: (rushing back in) What?! I wh-, what’s wrong?ScenesRachel: I’m sorry, I just can’t go to the hospital lookin’ like this.

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Monica is trying to find out what Phoebe won’t tell her.]
rows.Content: Monica: Does it involve travel?ScenesPhoebe: Noo!ScenesMonica: Does it involve clogs?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, wait, wait. Clogs, or claws?ScenesMonica: Clogs.ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: Claws?!ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesMonica: Okay, so it doesn’t involve Ross or Rachel or Chandler or Joey. But, what about Pete?ScenesPhoebe: (Shaking her head yes) No!ScenesMonica: What is it?! What about Pete?ScenesPhoebe: I don’t know! (frantically points at Monica)ScenesMonica: Okay, I feel like I’m talking to Lassie. All right, Phoebe would you just tell me!ScenesPhoebe: I can’t!!ScenesMonica: Okay, I gotta go. (gets up)ScenesPhoebe: I, but you’re so close! No!ScenesMonica: Okay, does it involve something to do with Pete’s computer company?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, just go. You’re never gonna get it!

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey's, Chandler is watching Baywatch with the baby chick. He’s on one leather chair, the chick is on the other. It’s watching Yasmine Bleeth run and is chirping.]
rows.Content: Chandler: I know. See, yes. That’s Yasmine Bleeth, she’s a completely different kind of chick. I love you both. But in very different ways.ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey!ScenesChandler: Hey!ScenesJoey: (sees he’s watching Baywatch) Ohhh. (sees he still has the chick) Ahh! What are you doing?! I thought you were gonna take her back to the store today.ScenesChandler: I did! But the store wouldn’t take her back! So then I took her to the shelter, and you know what I found out?Scenes(Joey wants to know, but Chandler doesn’t want to discuss it by the chick, so he and Joey move over to the windows and away from the chick.)ScenesChandler: If they can’t find a home for her, they kill her! And I’m not gonna let that happen to little Yasmine!ScenesJoey: Okay, good, good, good, ‘cause, good, ‘cause I was kinda having second thoughts too.ScenesChandler: Okay. And it’s not just chicks y'know? It’s all kinds of other animals!ScenesJoey: That’s horrible! Well, you did the right thing man.ScenesChandler: Thanks, I’m glad you see it that way.Scenes(He hear a duck start quacking, and see it waddle into the living room from the bathroom. Joey wants to know what’s with the duck.)ScenesChandler: Ohhh-hoo, funny story!

rows.Scenes: Pete’s Restaurant’s Kitchen, Pete is showing Monica around the kitchen.]
rows.Content: Monica: I don’t believe this! Wow, look at this refrigerator! It’s gigantic! I mean I could live in this thing! I’d be cold, but I’m always cold. Oh my God, look at these spider burners! I love spider burners.ScenesPete: So you like it?ScenesMonica: Oh, it is sooo perfect. Thank you so much. (runs over and hugs him)ScenesPete: Oh, you’re welcome. (He takes a deep breath)ScenesMonica: Did you just smell my hair?ScenesPete: Nooo. Uh-huh, no way. What? No.ScenesMonica: Oh God.ScenesPete: What?ScenesMonica: You still have feelings for me don’t you?ScenesPete: Now, nooo! I’m just excited about the restaurant, that’s all.ScenesMonica: Pete.ScenesPete: Okay, I love you. Is that so bad?ScenesMonica: No, it’s not bad. It’s not bad at all. It’s-it’s really nice.ScenesPete: Look, the only who stands to get hurt is me. And I’m okay with that.ScenesMonica: You may be okay about getting hurt, but I am not okay with being the one who hurts you. That’s why I can’t take this job.ScenesPete: What?ScenesMonica: And well, we probably shouldn’t see each other anymore. I’m sorry.ScenesPete: Okay, yeah. I mean... If that’s, if that’s really what you want, okay.ScenesMonica: Okay, bye.Scenes(She kisses him on the cheek, and he kisses her back on the mouth.)ScenesPete: I’m sorry things didn’t work out...ScenesMonica: All right shut up for a second and let me just see something. (She kisses him back on the lips) Oh, wow! (They then hug and kiss, very passionately.)

rows.Scenes: The Hallway Between The Apartments, Ross and Rachel are coming back from the hospital. Ross is helping her up the stairs.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Okay, you’d tell me the truth. Right?ScenesRoss: Rach, you can’t look fat in an x-ray.ScenesRachel: Okay.Scenes(As they approach the door, Chandler comes out carrying his duck.)ScenesChandler: Okay! Now you stay out here, and you think about what you did!!ScenesRoss: (to Chandler) That’s a duck.ScenesChandler: That’s a bad duck!!! (to Ross) How’d the thing go tonight, Ross?ScenesRoss: Oh, it was, nah, well....ScenesRachel: What thing? What thing?ScenesRoss: Nothing, ah there was this thing at the museum. Come on. (they go into her apartment) Easy.ScenesChandler: (to the duck) Okay, now when you come back I hope you remember that, that chick is not a toy! (He goes back into the apartment)Scenes[cut to inside Monica and Rachel’s]ScenesRachel: What thing? What is this thing?ScenesRoss: I was kinda, supposed to be on TV tonight for The Discovery Channel.ScenesRachel: Oh my God!ScenesRoss: Yeah.ScenesRachel: Ross, why didn’t you tell me that?ScenesRoss: Eh, ‘cause I knew that if I told you, you’d make me go, and I knew you needed someone to be with you tonight. Come on. Come on.ScenesRachel: I cannot believe you.ScenesRoss: What?ScenesRachel: That is the sweetest thing, I just....Scenes(They both look at each other for a while)ScenesRoss: (breaking the silence) You should get some sleep.ScenesRachel: Okay.ScenesRoss: So, I’ll umm...ScenesRachel: Oh, I’m sorry I spoiled you’re evening.ScenesRoss: No, that’s, no, as long as you’re okay. So I’ll ah, I’ll see you tomorrow.ScenesRachel: Um-hmm, yeah.Scenes(He leaves)ScenesRachel: (After he closes the door) See ya.Scenes(In the hallway, Ross all dejected, sits down on the step.)ScenesChandler: (coming out of his apartment and seeing Ross) What did you do?ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Chandler and Joey’s Bathroom: Chandler is watching the duck swim in the bathtub.]
rows.Content: Joey: What ‘cha doing?ScenesChandler: Having a swim.ScenesJoey: What about the chick?ScenesChandler: Chicks don’t swim.ScenesJoey: Are you sure?ScenesChandler: I don’t know. Should we try it?ScenesJoey: Sure.Scenes(Chandler picks up the chick and drops it in the water.)ScenesChandler: See, I told you they don’t swim. (He goes to take it out)ScenesJoey: (stopping him) Wait. Give him a minute.ScenesChandler: Noo! (takes him out) Oh, it’s okay, it’s okay, baby, baby, baby.Scenes(Joey picks up and turns on a hair dryer.)ScenesEndScenesThe One With The ScreamerScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the phone, Chandler and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Ross is in the kitchen as Rachel enters from her bedroom.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold? I was supposed to call my Dad back like two hours ago.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance, he’s at Flimby’s.ScenesRachel: What’s Flimby’s?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, that’s the word I use when I can’t remember the real thing.ScenesRachel: Okay. Hang up! That’s it! Come on!ScenesPhoebe: No! Rachel, that’s what they want me to do. My warranty expires tomorrow, if I don’t get through, they’re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone for free! We cannot let them win! It’s us versus them!ScenesChandler: Ye-e-es!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesJoey: Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight. Who-who got what?ScenesChandler, Phoebe, and Rachel: I had one.ScenesMonica: I need two. I’m bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend now!ScenesJoey: Two it is. Ross, how about you?ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two.ScenesMonica: Really? Who’s number two?ScenesChandler: Who’s number two? One of the more difficult games sewer workers play.ScenesRoss: Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person.ScenesPhoebe: Like a date type (looks at Rachel) person?ScenesRoss: Yeah, kinda. It’s this woman from work. I hope that won’t be too weird. Will it, Rach?ScenesRachel: No. No, not at all, not at all. I actually was gonna bring someone myself, so…ScenesJoey: But you said one.ScenesRachel: I meant, me plus one!ScenesJoey: Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one?ScenesRoss: All right, I’ll see you tonight.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay, bye-bye!ScenesChandler: Bye!ScenesMonica: Bye-bye!Scenes(Ross exits)ScenesRachel: Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom)ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate!ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes it.ScenesMonica: Joey, what are you doing?! It’s never gonna happen, she’s seeing somebody.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne.ScenesJoey: The green bottle next to the shaving cream.ScenesChandler: Oh! Worm medicine for the duck.Scenes(In horror, Joey wipes his neck and smells it.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is getting ready to go to Joey’s premiere and Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Phoebe) Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (on phone) Ooh, I’m setting the phone down. (does so) But I’m still here! Just don’t go anywhere I’m still here. (starts to put on the sweater) Don’t-don’t switch or anything, ‘cause I’m, I’m right here. (She has pulled the sweater over her head, but her head is stuck in a sleeve.) Just one sec. One sec! One second!! (She is now frantically trying to get the sweater on, as Monica returns from the bathroom.) Wait! One second! Just…ScenesMonica: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: What?! Monica, I’m scared!!ScenesMonica: All right. Honey, that’s-that’s a sleeve. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)ScenesHold Voice: Please, stay on the line. Your call is important to us.ScenesMonica: Okay, wait, you gotta hang up ‘cause we’re gonna be late.Scenes(Phoebe starts to hang up the phone, but…)ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesPhoebe: Yes!! Yes!! I’m the next caller! You were gonna have me hang up.ScenesChandler: (entering, carrying the chick and duck) Hey! Can you take a duck and a chick to the theatre?ScenesMonica: Of course not.ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesChandler: Okay. I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy who's played by Ben Stiller who will be in There's Something About Mary and Meet The Parents, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of the dates and pats him on the shoulder.)ScenesRoss: Good.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here.ScenesRachel: Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!!ScenesRoss: Yay!!Scenes(An awkward silence follows.)ScenesRachel: Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy.ScenesTommy: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey. Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin.Scenes(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to shake each other’s hand, and Ross says…)ScenesRoss: And! Break!!Scenes(Awkward laughter follows.)ScenesRachel: Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room.ScenesTommy: Okay.ScenesCailin: I’ll join you.ScenesTommy: I’ll get our seats.ScenesRoss: Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is awkward.ScenesTommy: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Well y'know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out.ScenesTommy: Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that.ScenesRoss: Oh! Well then this is awkward. So what do you uh…ScenesTommy: I think we’re here.ScenesRoss: Oh! Yeah.ScenesTommy: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me, I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats.ScenesMan: Umm, no, I don’t think so.ScenesTommy: Can-can we take a look at your ticket?ScenesMan: Sure. (Hands him the ticket.)ScenesRoss: (looking at ticket) Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh…ScenesMan: Oh, well I thought that ah…ScenesTommy: Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too well for you did it you idiot!! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?! Look you’re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?!ScenesMan: Uh, the usher told us to come…ScenesTommy: Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross, calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle?ScenesRoss: No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, at the post premiere party. The gang is already there, except Phoebe. Joey runs in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (seeing Joey) There he is!ScenesMonica: There’s our star!ScenesJoey: So, so, what’d ya think?ScenesChandler: Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw.ScenesJoey: I-I wasn’t in that.ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesJoey: (sees Kate) Oh-oh, hey-hey, Kate! Listen I want you to meet everybody. Everybody, this is Kate.ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesThe Director: (stepping in) Excuse me. Excuse me. (to Kate) Sweetheart! (Kisses her.) Come! (They leave.)ScenesChandler: So that’s the girl you like.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: (drags Chandler over to buffet table) I’m telling you, this guy Rachel is with is crazy! Okay? He viscously screamed at total strangers! I think he’s baaad news!ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, wait a minute, you don’t like the guy Rachel’s dating? Well, that’s odd.Scenes[cut to Joey, Rachel, and Tommy.]ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, Lauren. Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate’s understudy, Lauren.ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesLauren: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey. Gosh, you look soo familiar.ScenesLauren: Oh, yeah! I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building. It was right after I slept with Joey. He dumped me the next day.Scenes[cut to Monica, Pete, and Cailin]ScenesCailin: So. How’d you guys meet?ScenesPete: Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months, then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine.ScenesMonica: Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version.Scenes[cut to Joey as Estelle, Joey’s agent, approaches]ScenesEstelle: Joey, sweetheart, you were fabulous!ScenesJoey: Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle.ScenesEstelle: How do you do. (to Rachel and Monica) Ooh, you two girls were outstanding! (to Joey) Did they have representation?ScenesJoey: No, they-they weren’t in the play.ScenesRachel: We’re not actors.ScenesEstelle: Ooh, what a shame! Because with her face (points to Monica) and her chest (points to Rachel) I could really put something together.ScenesChandler: Could I borrow it?Scenes[cut to later]ScenesCailin: (to Ross) Hi! Remember me?ScenesRoss: Hi! Yeah! Tommy’s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in front of him, I think he’s gonna snap. (He’s watching very intently)ScenesCailin: Ross, I’m gonna go.ScenesRoss: Go? Why?ScenesCailin: I don’t know. Could be because I don’t feel like standing around all night waiting for some guy who may or may not scream.ScenesRoss: But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream.ScenesCailin: Good bye Ross.ScenesRoss: Uh, oh-ho bye.ScenesThe Director: (entering carrying a newspaper) Here we go people! (starts reading the review) Boxing Day! The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la… Ah-ha! Joey Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr. Tribianni is not the worst thing in this production.ScenesJoey: Yes!!! Ha-ha-ha!ScenesThe Director: Kate Miller’s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable. (Kate walks away depressed.) Badda-badda-badda. Ah-ha! Here it is! The direction by Marshal Talmant is… (stops, reads it again, and throws down the paper in disgust) Thank you, boys and girls, you’ve ruined my life. Please, stuff your talentless faces with my Mother’s crab cakes! (starts to leave) Excuse me!!Scenes(Joey steps in a picks up the paper, the gang all look at him.)ScenesJoey: Anyone mind if I save this?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, is the play over?ScenesMonica: Yeah. Where were you?ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesMonica: You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Nah. I kept myself busy.Scenes(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living room with confused looks on their faces.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff in your room.Scenes(They both look at each other, nod their heads ‘All right’ and follow their stuff into their new rooms.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Are you okay?ScenesKate: Fabulous.ScenesJoey: Listen, drama critics they’re nothing but, but people who couldn’t make it as actors. You know what you should do?ScenesKate: Become a drama critic!ScenesThe Director: (entering, drunk) I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both your houses! (walks away)ScenesKate: By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.ScenesJoey: Oh, classy.ScenesKate: Yep! I sure know how to pick ‘em, huh? Y'know I gave up a part on a soap for this!ScenesJoey: Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.ScenesKate: Really. What?ScenesJoey: Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We’ll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.ScenesKate: Why the Post?ScenesJoey: Oh, you didn’t see the Post?ScenesKate: No. You?ScenesJoey: No. Why?

rows.Scenes: Kate’s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the town.]
rows.Content: Kate: (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?ScenesJoey: Oh, absolutely! You’re talented and you’re good looking.ScenesKate: Oh, you’re sweet and cute.ScenesJoey: I know! That’s why they trashed me!Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesJoey: Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.ScenesKate: What?ScenesJoey: I, I don’t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.ScenesKate: What? So you never went out with an actress before?ScenesJoey: Kate, do you even like me?ScenesKate: Of course I do.ScenesJoey: Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him?ScenesKate: I don’t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone like you?ScenesJoey: Thanks.ScenesKate: You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you’re just so, you’re so, so… (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)ScenesJoey: (Checks to see if she’s drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay, hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let’s get your feet up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I’m gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is STILL on hold.]
rows.Content: Hold Voice: Please stay on the line. You’re call is very important to us.ScenesMonica: (entering from her bedroom) Pheebs, you’ve been up for 24 hours! Go to sleep, honey. Th-this isn’t healthy.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, I’m fine, and y’know why? ‘Cause of all the riboflavin.ScenesJoey: (entering, happily) Hey!ScenesMonica: Hey! Didn’t you have that outfit on last night?ScenesJoey: Yeah! I stayed at Kate’s, but ah, nothing happened. Hey, Pheebs, where were ya?ScenesPhoebe: I’m so, so, so sorry, Joey. I definitely am gonna see you’re play. I swear you’re play is very important to us, thank you for your patience. You’re play is the next play is the next play I’m gonna see.ScenesMonica: Anyway, how did it go with Kate?ScenesJoey: Oh, it was great! Yeah, I-I walked her home, and it was amazing how much we connected, y'know? Then ah, then she passed out, but then she woke up. Yeah? And we stayed up all night talking, and now we’re like totally crazy about each other!ScenesMonica: Joey, you had the night!ScenesJoey: What?ScenesMonica: When two people finally realise their feelings for each other, and-and they talk for hours, and they-they learn all about the other person!ScenesJoey: You-you think?ScenesMonica: Did you like learn about her family?ScenesJoey: Two brothers, one died!ScenesMonica: Yes!!ScenesJoey: Yeah?!ScenesMonica: Oh! (They hug, triumphantly.)

rows.Scenes: Central Perk, Chandler and Monica are sitting on the couch, Rachel is on the chair.]
rows.Content: Gunther: (bringing Chandler a cup) This is from the woman at the bar.ScenesChandler: Oh-ho-ho-ho.Scenes(He turns and looks at her. The woman whispers something to Gunther; who comes back and takes the mug away from Chandler.)ScenesGunther: Sorry. She thought you were somebody else.ScenesRachel: What time is it?ScenesMonica: One.ScenesRoss: One.ScenesChandler: 7:15. (Monica looks at him) Watch doesn’t work.ScenesRachel: Tommy’s supposed to be here soon, we’re going to lunch.ScenesRoss: Look. Look, I wasn’t going to say anything to you, but... All right, I don’t think you should be seeing Tommy anymore.ScenesRachel: You don’t?!ScenesRoss: No! The guy is mean. I mean really mean. I think you should stay away from him.ScenesRachel: Umm, or, maybe, I should stay away from all men.ScenesRoss: No, it’s not just ‘cause I’m jealous. (Both Monica and Chandler give him a ‘Come on’ look) I mean I’m not, I’m not, I’m not jealous, okay? It’s… Look, the guy, he screamed, he actually screamed at this couple sitting in our seats.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and at the end of the play, he, he got up y'know, and he just started like, (claps his hands) banging his hands together!ScenesRoss: Okay, fine, fine. You don’t want to believe me? No, that’s fine. (starts to leave)ScenesMonica: We’re kidding!ScenesChandler: Ross, don’t. Ross!ScenesMonica; Ross!Scenes[cut to outside of Central Perk]ScenesRoss: You don’t want to believe me, I’m Mr. Funny to you. Mr. Funny… (turns around and almost spills his coffee on Tommy)ScenesTommy: Whoa!!ScenesRoss: Whoa, sorry Tommy.ScenesTommy: What’s in the cup, Ross?ScenesRoss: Umm…ScenesTommy: What is in the cup?!ScenesRoss: Okay, it’s coffee.ScenesTommy: Ice coffee? Tell me it’s ice coffee!ScenesRoss: It’s-it’s hot…ScenesTommy: Hot coffee!!! You idiot!! You were gonna spill hot coffee all over me, huh?!! What are you just some big, dumb, stupid, doofy idiot, with a doofy idiot hairdo, huh?! Huh?!Scenes[cut to inside Central Perk, we see Ross quietly tapping on the window, desperately trying to get the gang’s attention, while Tommy is still screaming at him]ScenesRachel: (not seeing Ross) What’s your favourite thing about summertime?ScenesMonica: Umm, going to the beach. When it stays light real late.ScenesRachel: Yeah…ScenesTommy: (entering, finished with yelling at Ross, who follows him in shell shocked) (happily) Hey!ScenesRachel: Tommyyyy! Say, what’s your favourite thing about summer?ScenesTommy: Ooh, I don’t know. Probably the smell of freshly cut grass.ScenesChandler: Ohh, that’s a good one.Scenes(Ross is having a fit, about how calm Tommy is now)

rows.Scenes: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is arriving, late.]
rows.Content: Joey: Sorry! Sorry, I’m late; sorry, I’m late! My duck and my chick and a fight, it-it was ugly.ScenesStage Manager: Look, we held the curtain for you buddy. Come on, let’s go! Let’s go!Scenes[cut to onstage with Lauren standing in for Kate, the doorbell rings.]ScenesLauren: (answering the door) Vic! Where have you been, baby?!ScenesJoey: (surprised it’s Lauren) (hugs her) (whispering) Where’s Kate?ScenesLauren: (whispering) She got a job in L.A.ScenesJoey: (stunned) What?!ScenesLauren: I’ve been waiting up all night for ya. Where have you been? (Joey doesn’t answer) Where have you been? Vic?!ScenesJoey: Oh, ahh, go to the window. I’m wanna run down to the truck and show you something.ScenesLauren: (at the window, she’s looking down out of the window) What do you got down there, Vic? What do you got under that tarp?ScenesJoey: (grabs the window from the outside and sticks his head in) (whispering) When is she leaving?ScenesLauren: (whispering) Tonight. What are you doing?ScenesJoey: (making like he is yelling up to the second floor) I’m coming up!

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Chandler and Ross are in the kitchen, Rachel and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Phoebe is, you guessed it, still on hold.]
rows.Content: Tommy: Hey, mind if I use the phone?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, I… (starts jabbering incoherently)ScenesChandler: Why don’t you use ours across the hall, ‘cause she…has…problems.ScenesRoss: (coming out of the kitchen with a cup of coffee, almost running into Tommy) Oh-ho, whoa! Sorry, Tommy. I almost spilled this hot coffee on you.ScenesTommy: Yeah, but you didn’t.ScenesRoss: No, but it’s-it’s-it’s hot!Scenes(We see Tommy go into Joey and Chandler’s apartment)ScenesRachel: Ross, would you just stop it! It’s getting really old.ScenesRoss: I can’t believe no one believes me!ScenesPhoebe: I do, I believe you.ScenesRoss: You do Pheebs?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah. But I also believed her (points to the phone) when she said I was next.Scenes[cut to Chandler and Joey’s apartment, Tommy is using the phone]ScenesTommy: (noticing the chick) Ooh, hey! Hey, there little fella. (picks up the chick) Mr. Fuzzy-Man, how are you doing? (starts to pet him) Aww. (The chick poops on his hand.) Eww! Oh! Eww! Gross! Idiot!! Stupid little, fuzzy, yellow creature!! Oh look at me, I’m so cute, I’m a little chick who’s disgusting! God, you’re so stupid, how are you not yet extinct!! (the duck wattles behind him and quacks) (to the duck) Quack-quack, quack-quack!! What are you quacking about?! Dumb Donald Doo-Doo!!Scenes(We see the gang staring at him through the doorways.)ScenesChandler: Step away from the duck.ScenesTommy: Ooh, sorry little Mr. Chic-A-Dee, sorry you went doody in my hand! (starts to walk out and stops) (to Rachel) Well, I guess we’re not going out anymore. Whaa!!!Scenes(He leaves the gang in stunned silence.)

rows.Scenes: Backstage at Joey’s play, Joey is changing for the next scene as Kate arrives, carrying her bags.]
rows.Content: Kate: Joey!ScenesJoey: Hey!ScenesKate: I’m soo glad I caught you, I couldn’t find you before.ScenesJoey: Wh-wh-what’s going on? Wh-what’s this about L.A.?ScenesKate: They still want me for General Hospital.ScenesJoey: But, but wh-what about us?ScenesKate: Last night was wonderful. But I-I can’t stay here just for you.ScenesJoey: Well, so, stay for the museums!ScenesKate: I’m sorry.ScenesStage Manager: Joey, onstage!ScenesJoey: Well can you at least stay to the end of the play? I mean, I’ll go to the airport with ya, I-I wanna say good bye.ScenesLauren: (yelling from onstage) Where are you Vic?ScenesKate: Flight’s in an hour. I-I gotta go.ScenesLauren: Vic! Vic! Vic!!!ScenesJoey: (to Lauren) In a minute!!Scenes[cut to the end of the play]ScenesLauren: So this is it? Victor?ScenesJoey: Yeah, I guess it is. (sees Kate is watching, he turns Lauren so that he can talk directly to Kate, but still look like he is talking to Lauren) Listen, I ah, I gotta say good bye, and-and I gotta say it quick ‘cause this is killing me. One thing you gotta know, is that I will never forget you. But, you’ve got things you have to do now, and so do I. And so… I’m gonna get on this spaceship, (smoke starts pouring in from the ceiling, and a ladder comes down, with flashing, colored lights on the side of it) and I’m gonna go to Blargon 7 in search of alternative fuels. But when I return, 200 years from now, you’ll be long gone. But I won’t have aged at all. (gets on the ladder) So you tell your great-great-granddaughter to look me up, because Adrienne, baby, I’m gonna want to meet her.Scenes(The ladder retracts, taking Joey up into the spaceship for his voyage to Blargon 7, and Kate waves good bye.)ScenesLauren: So long, Vic! (waving good bye as the ladder retracts)ScenesClosing Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the gang, except Joey, is there. Phoebe is, well you y'know.]
rows.Content: Monica: Phoebe, it’s been two days.ScenesPhoebe: Yeah, I know. Oh, good thing it’s one of those 801 numbers. Right?ScenesRoss: Phoebe, 800 is toll free, 801 is-is Utah.ScenesPhoebe: No, no, no, oh no-no-no, it’s has to be 800. (picks up the instruction manual to check the phone number) ‘Cause all those big companies have 800 numbers, every one. (Finds the number) Yeah, every big Utah-based company has one.ScenesRachel: Phoe-be!!ScenesPhoebe: Sorry, I’m so sorry, I will pay you back.ScenesChandler: And yet, she’s still not hanging up the phone.ScenesAll: Hang it up! Hang up the phone!!ScenesPhoebe: Fine! Fine! (slams the phone down, breaking it) Oh-oh!ScenesMonica: What?ScenesPhoebe: Well, I think I broke it. But that’s all right, here’s the number you can call.ScenesMonica: (sarcastic) Oh.ScenesEndScenesThe One With The ScreamerScenesWritten by: Scott Silveri & Shana Goldberg-MeehanScenesTranscribed by: Eric Aasen

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Phoebe is on the phone, Chandler and Monica are sitting in the living room, and Ross is in the kitchen as Rachel enters from her bedroom.]
rows.Content: Rachel: Oh, Phoebe, are you still on hold? I was supposed to call my Dad back like two hours ago.ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, he clipped on, he said call him as soon as you get a chance, he’s at Flimby’s.ScenesRachel: What’s Flimby’s?ScenesPhoebe: Oh, yeah, that’s the word I use when I can’t remember the real thing.ScenesRachel: Okay. Hang up! That’s it! Come on!ScenesPhoebe: No! Rachel, that’s what they want me to do. My warranty expires tomorrow, if I don’t get through, they’re not gonna fix my crappy, broken phone for free! We cannot let them win! It’s us versus them!ScenesChandler: Ye-e-es!!ScenesJoey: (entering) Hey.ScenesAll: Hey.ScenesJoey: Uh, listen I gotta double check for tickets tonight. Who-who got what?ScenesChandler, Phoebe, and Rachel: I had one.ScenesMonica: I need two. I’m bringing Pete. My boyfriend. I have a boyfriend now!ScenesJoey: Two it is. Ross, how about you?ScenesRoss: Uh, yeah, I ah, I also need two.ScenesMonica: Really? Who’s number two?ScenesChandler: Who’s number two? One of the more difficult games sewer workers play.ScenesRoss: Uh, no, it’s-it’s just this person.ScenesPhoebe: Like a date type (looks at Rachel) person?ScenesRoss: Yeah, kinda. It’s this woman from work. I hope that won’t be too weird. Will it, Rach?ScenesRachel: No. No, not at all, not at all. I actually was gonna bring someone myself, so…ScenesJoey: But you said one.ScenesRachel: I meant, me plus one!ScenesJoey: Okay. (to Phoebe and Chandler) Did ah, you guys mean you plus one?ScenesRoss: All right, I’ll see you tonight.ScenesJoey: Okay.ScenesRachel: Okay, bye-bye!ScenesChandler: Bye!ScenesMonica: Bye-bye!Scenes(Ross exits)ScenesRachel: Okay, I need a date! (runs to her bedroom)ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, you guys are finally gonna get to meet Kate!ScenesAll: Oh!ScenesJoey: (to Chandler) And I ah, borrowed some of your cologne. I hope she likes it.ScenesMonica: Joey, what are you doing?! It’s never gonna happen, she’s seeing somebody.ScenesChandler: Yeah, and I don’t have any cologne.ScenesJoey: The green bottle next to the shaving cream.ScenesChandler: Oh! Worm medicine for the duck.Scenes(In horror, Joey wipes his neck and smells it.)ScenesOpening Credits

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica is getting ready to go to Joey’s premiere and Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: (to Phoebe) Here you go. You can wear this. (hands her a sweater)ScenesPhoebe: Thanks!ScenesMonica: Uh-huh.ScenesPhoebe: Okay. (on phone) Ooh, I’m setting the phone down. (does so) But I’m still here! Just don’t go anywhere I’m still here. (starts to put on the sweater) Don’t-don’t switch or anything, ‘cause I’m, I’m right here. (She has pulled the sweater over her head, but her head is stuck in a sleeve.) Just one sec. One sec! One second!! (She is now frantically trying to get the sweater on, as Monica returns from the bathroom.) Wait! One second! Just…ScenesMonica: Phoebe?ScenesPhoebe: What?! Monica, I’m scared!!ScenesMonica: All right. Honey, that’s-that’s a sleeve. Okay?ScenesPhoebe: Yeah.ScenesMonica: And! We also have speaker phone. (She turns on the speaker phone.)ScenesHold Voice: Please, stay on the line. Your call is important to us.ScenesMonica: Okay, wait, you gotta hang up ‘cause we’re gonna be late.Scenes(Phoebe starts to hang up the phone, but…)ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesPhoebe: Yes!! Yes!! I’m the next caller! You were gonna have me hang up.ScenesChandler: (entering, carrying the chick and duck) Hey! Can you take a duck and a chick to the theatre?ScenesMonica: Of course not.ScenesPhoebe: No.ScenesChandler: Okay. I just wanted them to hear it from somebody else.

rows.Scenes: Joey’s Premiere, Rachel is already there with her date, Tommy who's played by Ben Stiller who will be in There's Something About Mary and Meet The Parents, as Ross and his date, Cailin, arrive.]
rows.Content: Ross: Hey, hey Rach!ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesRoss: Hi!ScenesRachel: How are you? (She goes to kiss him on the cheek, but stops because of the dates and pats him on the shoulder.)ScenesRoss: Good.ScenesRachel: Hey.ScenesRoss: So it’s looks like we’re the first ones here.ScenesRachel: Yeah, looks that way. First ones here! Wooo!!ScenesRoss: Yay!!Scenes(An awkward silence follows.)ScenesRachel: Oh! Tommy, this is Ross. Ross, Tommy.ScenesTommy: Hey.ScenesRoss: Hey. Oh, I’m sorry, this is Cailin.Scenes(They all try and shake hands at once. They end up criss-crossing they’re arms to shake each other’s hand, and Ross says…)ScenesRoss: And! Break!!Scenes(Awkward laughter follows.)ScenesRachel: Okay, uhh, I think I’m going to run to the ladies room.ScenesTommy: Okay.ScenesCailin: I’ll join you.ScenesTommy: I’ll get our seats.ScenesRoss: Okay. (The girls leave.) (to Tommy) So uh, well, this-this is uh, this is awkward.ScenesTommy: Yeah?ScenesRoss: Well y'know ‘cause Rachel and I used to go out.ScenesTommy: Oh, I didn’t, I didn’t know that.ScenesRoss: Oh! Well then this is awkward. So what do you uh…ScenesTommy: I think we’re here.ScenesRoss: Oh! Yeah.ScenesTommy: Yeah.ScenesRoss: Okay. (sees two people sitting in their seats.) Uh, huh. Excuse me, I’m sorry, I-I think you may be in our seats.ScenesMan: Umm, no, I don’t think so.ScenesTommy: Can-can we take a look at your ticket?ScenesMan: Sure. (Hands him the ticket.)ScenesRoss: (looking at ticket) Yep! Yeah, see this says D-13, and uh…ScenesMan: Oh, well I thought that ah…ScenesTommy: Oh, you thought, huh? Yeah, well that didn’t really work out too well for you did it you idiot!! What are you?! A moron!! Huh?! It says D-13! Okay?! Look you’re surrounded by even numbers!! Did that give you some clue?!ScenesMan: Uh, the usher told us to come…ScenesTommy: Oh! Oh! The usher must be right! What, with all that training they go through! Get out!! (They start to leave.) Here! (He throws him back his ticket.) (to Ross, calmly) Hey man, you want the aisle?ScenesRoss: No, I’m good. (He sits down, stunned.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, at the post premiere party. The gang is already there, except Phoebe. Joey runs in.]
rows.Content: Chandler: (seeing Joey) There he is!ScenesMonica: There’s our star!ScenesJoey: So, so, what’d ya think?ScenesChandler: Almost as good as that play with the two naked girls on the see-saw.ScenesJoey: I-I wasn’t in that.ScenesChandler: I know.ScenesJoey: (sees Kate) Oh-oh, hey-hey, Kate! Listen I want you to meet everybody. Everybody, this is Kate.ScenesMonica: Hi!ScenesThe Director: (stepping in) Excuse me. Excuse me. (to Kate) Sweetheart! (Kisses her.) Come! (They leave.)ScenesChandler: So that’s the girl you like.ScenesJoey: Yeah.ScenesRoss: (drags Chandler over to buffet table) I’m telling you, this guy Rachel is with is crazy! Okay? He viscously screamed at total strangers! I think he’s baaad news!ScenesChandler: Wait a minute, wait a minute, you don’t like the guy Rachel’s dating? Well, that’s odd.Scenes[cut to Joey, Rachel, and Tommy.]ScenesJoey: Oh, hey, Lauren. Uh, you guys this is, this is Kate’s understudy, Lauren.ScenesRachel: Oh, hi!ScenesLauren: Hey.ScenesRachel: Hey. Gosh, you look soo familiar.ScenesLauren: Oh, yeah! I-I ran into you in the hallway in your building. It was right after I slept with Joey. He dumped me the next day.Scenes[cut to Monica, Pete, and Cailin]ScenesCailin: So. How’d you guys meet?ScenesPete: Well ah, the short version is, I ah pursued her for a couple of months, then I gave her a check for 20,000 dollars, and she was mine.ScenesMonica: Yeah, and in the long version, I dump him for telling people the short version.Scenes[cut to Joey as Estelle, Joey’s agent, approaches]ScenesEstelle: Joey, sweetheart, you were fabulous!ScenesJoey: Hey you guys, this is my agent, Estelle.ScenesEstelle: How do you do. (to Rachel and Monica) Ooh, you two girls were outstanding! (to Joey) Did they have representation?ScenesJoey: No, they-they weren’t in the play.ScenesRachel: We’re not actors.ScenesEstelle: Ooh, what a shame! Because with her face (points to Monica) and her chest (points to Rachel) I could really put something together.ScenesChandler: Could I borrow it?Scenes[cut to later]ScenesCailin: (to Ross) Hi! Remember me?ScenesRoss: Hi! Yeah! Tommy’s in line for the bathroom and someone just cut in front of him, I think he’s gonna snap. (He’s watching very intently)ScenesCailin: Ross, I’m gonna go.ScenesRoss: Go? Why?ScenesCailin: I don’t know. Could be because I don’t feel like standing around all night waiting for some guy who may or may not scream.ScenesRoss: But-but Cailin, he definitely will scream.ScenesCailin: Good bye Ross.ScenesRoss: Uh, oh-ho bye.ScenesThe Director: (entering carrying a newspaper) Here we go people! (starts reading the review) Boxing Day! The Lucille Lortel Theatre, blah-la-la-la… Ah-ha! Joey Tribianni, gives an uneven performance, but Mr. Tribianni is not the worst thing in this production.ScenesJoey: Yes!!! Ha-ha-ha!ScenesThe Director: Kate Miller’s awkward and mannered portrayal is laughable. (Kate walks away depressed.) Badda-badda-badda. Ah-ha! Here it is! The direction by Marshal Talmant is… (stops, reads it again, and throws down the paper in disgust) Thank you, boys and girls, you’ve ruined my life. Please, stuff your talentless faces with my Mother’s crab cakes! (starts to leave) Excuse me!!Scenes(Joey steps in a picks up the paper, the gang all look at him.)ScenesJoey: Anyone mind if I save this?

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, Monica and Rachel are returning. Phoebe is still on hold.]
rows.Content: Monica: Hey!ScenesRachel: Hey!ScenesPhoebe: Oh, is the play over?ScenesMonica: Yeah. Where were you?ScenesHold Voice: Thank you for your patience, you’re the next caller.ScenesMonica: You were the next caller five hours ago. You must be going crazy.ScenesPhoebe: Nah. I kept myself busy.Scenes(Both Rachel and Monica walk into their bedrooms, stop, and come back into the living room with confused looks on their faces.)ScenesPhoebe: Oh, okay, yeah. (to Monica) I put your stuff in her room, and her stuff in your room.Scenes(They both look at each other, nod their heads ‘All right’ and follow their stuff into their new rooms.)

rows.Scenes: The Theatre, after the party. Joey is trying to comfort Kate.]
rows.Content: Joey: Hey! Are you okay?ScenesKate: Fabulous.ScenesJoey: Listen, drama critics they’re nothing but, but people who couldn’t make it as actors. You know what you should do?ScenesKate: Become a drama critic!ScenesThe Director: (entering, drunk) I am hurt! (to Joey and Kate) A plague on both your houses! (walks away)ScenesKate: By the way, he dumped me tonight after he read my review.ScenesJoey: Oh, classy.ScenesKate: Yep! I sure know how to pick ‘em, huh? Y'know I gave up a part on a soap for this!ScenesJoey: Wow! Yeah I ah, I gave up a job too.ScenesKate: Really. What?ScenesJoey: Uh, de-clawing cats. Hey, tell ya what. Let me walk you home. We’ll stop by every news stand and burn every copy of their Times and the Post.ScenesKate: Why the Post?ScenesJoey: Oh, you didn’t see the Post?ScenesKate: No. You?ScenesJoey: No. Why?

rows.Scenes: Kate’s Apartment, Joey and Kate are returning from a night out on the town.]
rows.Content: Kate: (drunk) So you really think those newspapers are just jealous of me?ScenesJoey: Oh, absolutely! You’re talented and you’re good looking.ScenesKate: Oh, you’re sweet and cute.ScenesJoey: I know! That’s why they trashed me!Scenes(They kiss.)ScenesJoey: Whoa. Wait a minute, wait a minute.ScenesKate: What?ScenesJoey: I, I don’t get you. I mean first, you hate me. Then you sleep with me. Then you want nothing to do with me, now you want me again.ScenesKate: What? So you never went out with an actress before?ScenesJoey: Kate, do you even like me?ScenesKate: Of course I do.ScenesJoey: Well so, how come you blew me off? Y'know? How come you were with him?ScenesKate: I don’t know! I just, just do this! I-I always have to pick the like the smartest guy, or-or the most talented guy… Why can’t I just pick someone like you?ScenesJoey: Thanks.ScenesKate: You know what I mean. I mean like the sweetest guy. Joey, you’re just so, you’re so, so… (She passes out and slumps against his shoulder.)ScenesJoey: (Checks to see if she’s drooling on his shirt.) Okay. Okay, okay, hey. (Lays her down and covers her with a blanket.) There we go, let’s get your feet up there. (Looks at her) Good night, Kate. Sweet dreams. (Picks up a garbage can) I’m gonna put this can right here in case you have to hurl.ScenesCommercial Break

rows.Scenes: Monica and Rachel's, the next morning, Phoebe is STILL on hold.]
